Reviews.Title: “Great stay - except the pool”
Reviews.Author: 4HatsRoadtrip
Reviews.Content: I am writing after reading the review from March 19 from Travw2kids. My family and I stayed at the Lagham around the same time and I can absolutely verify that the pool chlorine levels were ridiculous. Our daughter's hair was exactly the same as she reported - a tangled brittle mess. After gobs of conditioner not working, we ended up chopping off 5 inches. We still ended up having to buy some chlorine-removing shampoo. My son's bathing suits also lost their color. When I called the Langham to complain, action had already been taken (thanks to the other reviewer, as I now find out). I luckily did not have the same experience with management. I'm sure they had no other choice other than to be responsive since the health department was involved. I felt compelled to write to support the other reviewer. I will say that besides this experience, the rest of the stay was great. The concierge, in particular, was extremely helpful and the room was impeccable, even though a bit old. I am often accused of being too forgiving, but as long as the Langham has rectified the pool, I would still recommend staying there. The poor customer service the other reviewer experienced, however, is unacceptable, so can understand someone hesitating.

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: nycnyc12
Reviews.Content: not over the top but clean and cheerful and gracious. good location for walking to quincy market. bell staff excedingly friendly. Bond Bar was interesting but not really hopping. spa was nice and so is the pool. gave us a great room on 9th floor overlooking park as i was going to propose (and did). quiet and charming. dishes were left in the hallways inordinately long. downer was construction going on so you felt you were missing something in the lobby area. i would come again especially when contruction is over.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme skin irritation and hair damage from pool—pool permit suspended by city inspectors”
Reviews.Author: travw2kids
Reviews.Content: While all the reviews I’ve read are true—both the good (nice rooms, clean, accommodating service) and the bad (dismissive management, nickel and diming, lobby construction noise)—the real measure of a good hotel is how they handle a problem. And since we went to the Langham primarily for the pool, if I had read about this, I would have definitely stayed somewhere else. Even though we have never had a problem at any other pool—including the indoor water parks where you can barely breathe through the chlorine fumes—one of my daughters had such extreme skin irritation from the pool water that she later sobbed in the shower from the pain. Both of my daughters’ hair completely changed consistency into a dry and brittle mess. My husband’s swimsuit bleached in the pool water. And when I called to alert the hotel of the severity of the situation so they could protect other guests, I first got complete unresponsiveness and then a flat denial that there was any problem. Other than watching my children suffer because of my unfounded confidence that a five star hotel would have completely safe pool conditions, my ultimate conversation with the hotel manager was the worst part. He was completely dismissive and condescendingly “assured” me nothing was wrong with the pool, but he also refused to give me the chemical levels during our stay. (Although the spa manager did tell me that the pH was “on the high side” at 8.0, which is coincidentally the upper legal limit and the CDC says healthy pool water should be between 7.2 and 7.8.) I could not believe the general manager’s failure to accept there was an issue he needed to resolve and told him he left me no choice but to report the situation to the city authorities. Several days later, the Boston pool inspector called me to report on their inspection. He told me that there had been a mechanical failure and that the chlorine levels were “off the charts,” so the city suspended the Langham’s pool permit and closed the pool until the issue was resolved. Truly unbelievable. The pool was kept open for at least four days at illegal levels, and for two days after I had reported the “chemical burns” in my child (and yes, that was the exact terminology I used). Either the Langham’s pool maintenance system left them incapable of knowing they were operating at illegal levels, or they lied to me and kept the pool open despite knowing how high the levels were—either way the situation is completely unacceptable and unsafe. And even if their testing protocol was flawed, they should have done more to protect their other guests after I reported the chemical burns from the pool. Both managers told me they received no other complaints, but my initial complaint at the front desk was not given to them. If you’ve had a similar problem, please leave a review so other people will know whether this was an isolated incident. Finally, I reported the entire incident in a lengthy email to the corporate offices of the Langham chain and was not even given the courtesy of a response. I am truly stunned at the complete failure at every level of Langham management. Good luck choosing a hotel. Needless to say, we won’t be going back to the Langham. Next time we want a Boston hotel with a pool, we’ll try the Marriott Long Wharf, the Copley Weston, or the Boston Harbor Hotel. If you want the full story, here it is . . . . My husband, two children, and I stayed at the Langham on February 20 and 21. Our goal was to spend the night in a fancy hotel in Boston with a great pool. The room was beautiful and the service was great, with special touches like very early check-in and complimentary chocolates sent to the room for my daughter’s birthday. The pool was also beautiful, as nice as it looks in the pictures. After just one swim, though, my daughters’ hair completely changed consistency. It was with no exaggeration like straw and could not be brushed until it was washed and conditioned, and then it was still completely dry, brittle, and stiff. (Can you imagine if a to-be bride at the hotel had gone in the pool!) My husband’s swimsuit was also ruined, being bleached from blue to spotty gray. Still, we were there for the pool and I trusted that in such a nice hotel, everything was safe. So, they went in the pool two more times, but the swims were short for my kids (who usually have to be dragged out of the pool) because the water was too irritating. After the third swim, one of them had a red rash around the goggle area on her face, so we left the pool. Because the stay was otherwise so nice, I just wanted to make the most of it and not complain. But when we left, I did mention at checkout that the pool caused these problems so they would be aware of the issue. Then we went home and the kids showered again to try to get their hair to a manageable condition. In the shower, I could see the extent of my younger daughter’s rash and the water hurt her so much she was sobbing. As much as I wanted to let the whole thing go after a tiring stay away, I decided I had to call to alert them to the severity of the issue so they could do something to protect other swimmers. I assumed that I’d be thanked for letting them know and told that they would get right on it to make sure no one else had that reaction, but that is not the response I got. I called at 4:45 pm and asked to speak to the manager. I was told there are many managers and asked what my issue was—so I told this person that my child received a CHEMICAL BURN from the pool. Then I was told I should talk to the spa manager, who may have left for the day. The person on the phone told me she would have the spa manager call me back or she would call me herself. I waited an hour, knowing other people were in the pool, and I got no call back! I was flabbergasted at the lack of response! I really wanted to make sure the right people knew about the issue so they could correct it without anyone else suffering, so I called again and got the same person on the phone who told me the spa manager had left. In desperation and frustration, I again expressed that this was a safety issue—A CHEMICAL BURN IN A CHILD. So I was asked if I wanted to be transferred to the spa. I couldn’t believe it was on me to continue to communicate this issue, but what else could I do? I was transferred and there was no answer, so I left a very frustrated message. Then, a security person called me back, and he was responsive, but I still got the feeling that no one was checking that the pool was safe and getting people out of there if necessary. The spa manager called me later that night and assured me that the levels were safe. Before this, I was just trying to be a good citizen and let them know they had a problem, but once they started trying to minimize the situation, I became angry. While a place like this should have the pool water at ideal levels at all times, I know pool chemistry is variable (we have a pool). Things can get out of whack. But to insist that levels are normal when people have that kind of reaction to the water led me to the conclusion that either: 1) there is something wrong with the pool testing protocol and the Langham is incapable of knowing if the levels are safe, or 2) they knew levels were off and did not address it promptly and were not admitting it to me. Neither conclusion leaves me feeling comfortable. The next morning, the spa manager called me again to say she was investigating and to tell me that the levels had been acceptable, although she did tell me that the pH was “on the high side” at 8.0. So, I looked that up—8.0 is the highest allowable level for public pools in Massachusetts (and for summer camp pools the highest allowable level is 7.8). OK, now we were getting somewhere. Also, at high pH levels, the chlorine is less effective, so they have to add more. I was not given a chlorine level, but it was likely high too given the legal requirements based on the pH level. According to the websites I checked, the combination of high pH and high chlorine is particularly irritating to the skin. During this morning call, the spa manager told me she had spoken to the general manager who said he would call me. He did not call until that night, and his call was the worst experience of the whole ordeal. He apologized for our situation but very condescendingly “assured” me that the pool levels were normal. Truly, I lost it with that denial. Things happen. Pool chemicals get out of whack. But to not own responsibility for the issue and pledge to immediately address it for the benefit of the other guests is unacceptable. I told him that I was very concerned that this would happen to someone else if they did not accept that there was a serious issue and he angrily and pompously insisted that they had always had everything under control. In anger and frustration, I asked him if I needed to get a lawyer to get him to understand the seriousness of the situation and he challenged me to do it. At that point, I knew the conversation was useless and just asked for the complete records of the chemical levels during our stay. He told me he would only give them to my lawyer! If there’s nothing wrong with the levels, why not give them to me? So, the next morning, I called the City of Boston pool inspectors to report the problem. Oh, and five days after that first swim, my other daughter came down with swimmers ear, something she has never had before. This is the only time she has been swimming all winter. Swimmers ear is very rare in the winter and is a sign of poor pool conditions. But it gets even more insane! The Monday after our visit, I got from the pool inspector. We stayed at the Langham on Monday and Tuesday. Tuesday night is when I called to alert the hotel of the chemical burn. Tuesday night and Wednesday morning is when I was assured by the spa manager that the levels were safe. Wednesday night is when the general manager refused to admit there was a problem and give me the pool levels. Thursday morning I reported the problem to the Boston pool inspectors, who I believe went out that day. They found that there had been a “mechanical failure” in the pool system and that the chlorine levels were “off the charts” and “suspended the permit” for the pool until the issue was resolved. So, despite all of the denials, this pool was operating at illegal chlorine levels for at least four days! I wish I reported it to the city right away, but honestly, I felt like things would be resolved more quickly and safely if I went straight to the hotel. But instead, they stuck their head in the sand and ignored the problem until the city forced them to address it—and unsurprisingly, I have received no apology from them. After I heard from the Boston authorities, I emailed the Langham chain to report the situation. It has been more than two weeks, and I have still not even received a response form them. So that’s the long sorry tale.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Boston”
Reviews.Author: connie m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew up to Boston from Florida for a family gathering in early March 2012. We stayed at the Langham Hotel, which is conveniently located near Fanueil Hall, the North End, and the Waterfront area. The hotel has a fun club where we met up with friends for a drink. The Chocolate Bar on Saturday was awesome and Sunday Brunch was excellent! Our room was clean, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. I will be returning to the Langham Hotel the next time we travel to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Our wonderful weekend at the Langham Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ann m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Langham Hotel the weekend of December 9,2011. We could not have asked for better service. Attention to detail from the staff was amazing. Our ride with Salim in the pink taxi was one of many highlights of our weekend. We are looking forward to another great weekend in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot, will stay again despite renovation work.”
Reviews.Author: MangaMan
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Professional, friendly staff. Absolutely great turn-down service (blinds closed, trash emptied, bed cover removed, ice in the ice-bucket, chocolate on pillow). You're going to pay a lot to stay downtown, might as well pay a little more and stay here. Room is clean, hallways need some attention. I travel a lot on business. I've stayed here before and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: 5kmr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham Boston in December. I had a huge, corner room overlooking Post Office Square. I was only there for one night, but cannot wait to go back! The food at BOND was excellent, service excellent - a great hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Awful beds, worse service”
Reviews.Author: claygr
Reviews.Content: The beds in this hotel were incredibly hard and uncomfortable. I asked to be switched rooms and the beds in the second room were no better. I ended up pulling the comforter off the second bed to try to create some cushion. I told this to the clerk at check-out, who informed me that they could have put a foam insert in to make it softer. I told him that this would have been nice to know when I complained to him the first time and asked for a different room. My memory of this hotel will be four days of back pain. Also, even by hotel standards, the towels were the consistency of 60-grit sandpaper. Excellent for stripping paint off wood, not so great on the skin. The hotel looks beautiful but does not have the comfort you would expect from a Marriott Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Beau-ti-ous!!!”
Reviews.Author: McGallin
Reviews.Content: So beautiful, so elegant, so historical. I stayed here with ten friends when we celebrated "our" birthdays.... We went to Dueling Pianos at "Howl at the Moon" for our celebration. Blast! The Langham has everything you want and more. Great lounges...unbelievable food, Sunday brunch, AND A CHOCOLATE BUFFET - to die for. All the staff (or most) spoke with European accents...so quaint. The door man was dressed military style and very professional and helpful. Stunningly spotless interior. We're coming back in April.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Financial District!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravWayne_NJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Langham Boston for one night while on business. The hotel was perfectly located to explore Financial District and Goverment Center. The staff were helpful and accomodating. They are in the middle of renovating the hotel lobby and Cafe Flueri so there was construction during the day. Rooms were upscale and well appointed. Turn-down service is a nice touch! Valet parking is offered at $42 per night but worth it. We enjoyed a business dinner at the Boston Chart House on the Wharf and enjoyed our meal and found the selection to appeal to everyone. The hotel concierge recommended and managed reservation in advance of our stay. When I return to Boston I will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You to the Langham for Taking Care of My Sick Dad!”
Reviews.Author: 2012Liz
Reviews.Content: Every time I stay at the Langham in Boston I am impressed by the personal service and the genuinely welcoming and professional staff - but this week they totally blew me away. My elderly father (he is 86) was due to check out of the hotel but came down with the flu and was too sick to move. While my sister planned an emergency flight to Boston to take care of him and escort him home when he was able, I worked with the hotel staff to get her a room on the same floor, bring dad ice chips and crackers, and periodically check in on him to make sure he was both hydrated and cogent. Everybody from the front desk to security and guest services was on it! I received three calls from guest services throughout the day to let me know Dad was being cared for, that they had physically checked in on him and he was okay. From 3,000 miles away I had made a single request for help and they made him their priority; he was the subject of their morning staff meeting and the focus of their day. Even my dad's wake up call was made with an inquiry as to his health the next morning. Wow. I can't say enough about how great they were and what a relief it was. They made us all feel like he was safe and far from alone in his time of need.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Retreat”
Reviews.Author: newenglander1111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful 2-night stay at the Langham. Due to work commitments, we had had to postpone our honeymoon for almost a year and finally were able to take a much-needed vacation back to my home state of Massachusetts. We stayed at several properties during that time and the Langham far exceeded the rest in quality and service. In making our reservation, we had noted that the trip was a honeymoon and when we arrived at our room, we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine, hors d'oeuvres, beautiful roses and a handwritten card. It was a lovely, unexpected touch! The hotel itself is extremely convenient in location - just steps from Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall and close to all the shopping you could hope for. The room was very clean and quiet and had a great view of the financial district. Plush robes and slippers are provided and the beds are extremely comfortable. The bathroom was large and spacious. The only difficulty we had was in finding parking when we first arrived, but that was handled fairly quickly. We'll be staying at the Langham again when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing break at the Langham”
Reviews.Author: tc1983uk
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed at the Langham Boston for four nights and we had an amazing time. The hotel itself is in the financial district but is in easy walking distance to Quincy Market (for excellent shops and all the food you could ever wish for) and the downtown shopping district (Macyâ€™s and other department stores). It is also fairly close to the Freedom Trail. We found it to be in a convenient location. Having read the trip advisor comments recommending rooms overlooking post office square and getting a room higher up, I decided to phone the hotel a week before to find out if it was possible to get such a room. Upon arrival, we were told that we had been given a room on the 7th floor overlooking post office square. It was also away from the elevator so we were really pleased that our request had been met. Haruko on the front desk deserves a mention as we found her to be welcoming and professional upon checking in to the hotel. We had a classic queen room and found it to be clean and a good size. The bed turn down service is a nice touch and you get a chocolate put on the pillow every evening. There is even a complimentary newspaper service in which you can get a copy of the Boston Globe. As our room was near the end of the corridor and being on the 7th floor, we found it to be quiet and peaceful. I thoroughly recommend this hotel. Tip - If you are coming to Boston for sightseeing, I would recommend getting the CityPass which costs $46 and is excellent value for money, but you would need to give yourself at least 2-3 days to see all the attractions. The New England Aquarium (excellent) is the nearest to the Langham Hotel and is in easy walking distance. For the remaining attractions which include the Prudential Tower skywalk, you will need to use the T to get to them. A weekly Charlie ticket costs $15 which is amazing value for money and gives you unlimited travel on the T and buses. The nearest T stops to the Langham are Downtown Crossing and State St, both of which are a 5-10 min walk away. State St is on the blue line making it ideal if you get the T from the Airport to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant lobby, top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: lynnsy
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the business district, The Langham was quiet when we arrived on Saturday. We were greeted by the doorman, desk staff and concierge and on our way to our room in moments. Our seventh floor room faced the street and was near the elevator but was quiet and convenient. The bed (king) was comfortable, the linens and towels immaculate. The bathroom was small, but there was plenty of hot water and good courtesy toiletries. There is so much to do in the area, we did not take advantage of the hotel's many amenities, but spent our time out and about. Boston driving and parking is the pits; use the valet parking- reasonable, safe, quick, courteous. Special kudos to Lincoln, the concierge who offered excellent suggestions and directions.

Reviews.Title: “A proper 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMF3758
Reviews.Content: A good humored doorman and a very friendly and efficient check-in get things off to an excellent start. The attention to detail is everywhere evident in this venerable and stylish hotel. My huge room was tastefully although perhaps for some rather austerely furnished but everything is perfectly maintained. Well stocked mini-bar, decent coffee maker, top of the range hair-dryer, five huge fluffy towels and luxurious bath robes. I returned after dinner to find that my clothes had been carefully folded and stored by the maid. The bar is an extraordinary architectural feat and must be visited even if you are not a drinker. The waitresses are very friendly, the martinis huge, and the snacks imaginative. The breakfast in the Cafe in the morning is one of the best I have had in a hotel in the US. And all this comes at a very reasonable price given the quality, I paid USD190. This hotel provides a really excellent service in a formal setting while managing to remain friendly and relaxed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “i know its going to be great !”
Reviews.Author: chef142
Reviews.Content: my wife and my brother are going in May to the Langham we will have been married 44 years and we just know the hotel will be great as we all stayed in the Langham in Hong Kong a couple of years ago and it was a fantastic experience .cant wait to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Perfect Location for my needs”
Reviews.Author: JPDucks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham Boston for a business trip that I took to Boston and both the hotel and the location were perfect for my needs. The airport was a short cab ride away and since the hotel is in the Financial District the location was perfect for me. That being said, I did walk the Freedom Trail in the evening and it was very convenient to pick up from the hotel. Boston is a very small big city so nothing is too far away from this hotel. As for the room itself; the standard room was a nice size and would have easily accommodated travel with my wife and son if they were with me on the trip. The bed was very comfortable and the water in the bathroom was great. The pressure was great and the water got hot very quickly which is all I need and unexpected especially with an older building. The restaurant in the hotel (CafÃ© Fleuri) was a bit expensive but the food was really good (try the mac nâ€™ cheese with lobster) and the bar (Bond) had a great ambiance, especially since itâ€™s the old Federal Reserve. Overall this is a great hotel and I look forward to my next business stay in Boston when Iâ€™ll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just for a Week-end Dream !!!”
Reviews.Author: Marc-Andre B
Reviews.Content: We been to Boston in a road trip, we booked the hotel 2 days in advance, thanks tripadvisor for the recommendation, we wanted an hotel on the spot so we got it !!!!! Just absolutely perfect !!!! the concierge give us his card and we had vip in a club near the hotel, we been to No 9 Park restaurant so cool !!! We walked to the downtown and we been to the several places !! Hotel is great, the staff awesome !! the room are small but clean and great !!! Good value ! We really enjoyed Boston, and we want to go back !!! The club : Bond, is just fantastic the staff are great and all the people we met there was just great !!! We will go back to this hotel trust me !! we been to more than 200 hotels all around the world and this hotel is absolutely perfect !!! The only tning, is, there is no longer nothing opened after 2h00 AM ??

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: From the very first moment when we handed the keys to the Valet, front desk arriving to the room and the whole stay was just SO fabulous! Every single member of the staff called us by our names immediately after the check in. When we arrived to the room there was Lemonade and chocolate covered strawberries with a very sweet note welcoming us to the hotel. Unlike other hotels they were prompt to help and very sweet all the time! I could not be happier will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean room”
Reviews.Author: itnorluv
Reviews.Content: The Langham has a great location with a few minutes easy walk from South Station and many of the sites along the Freedom Trail, including Faneuil Hall and Boston Common. It is in the financial district and near the Aquarium and Children's Museum. I stayed in a very small classic room with a nice bathroom. It was right at the elevators which was noisy especially in the evening and early morning. The room was clean, with a large flat-screen TV with amble stations, mini-bar, large closet and queen bed. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were very compressible and uncomfortable. Nightly turn-down service with chocolates, robes and slippers was a nice touch as were the nice toiletries from the hotel spa. Unfortunately, there was a very strong perfume smell in the bathroom and room which caused headaches and allergies. The wireless internet ($12/day) was very slow and inconsistent making it difficult to use. The hotel has a restaurant and a nice gym, indoor pool and spa. The gym had a nice selection of cardio equipment overlooking the pool as well as a weights area. Overall, the Langham is very nice and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: quacks
Reviews.Content: We booked the Langham for a 5 day New Year break on the basis of the TA reviews, availability through British Airways and the location. We took Taxis to and from the airport which were only 15 minutes each way and cost less than $20. I have to say the service we received at the Langham was as good as anywhere we have been in the world. We booked the basic room and it was small but serviceable. However during our first night we had a problem with the room and the speed with which the problem was addressed together with the actions that the hotel took to rectify the problem were awesome. We were upgraded, offered Wi-Fi and breakfast!!. The Superior room which was on the 7th floor was ample size, quiet and serviced efficiently everyday by the housemaids. Our one concern were a number of comments concerning how quiet the area was at weekends being in the Financial District. We needn't have worried. We were within a 5 minute walk to Quinicey Market, The Old Statehouse and the Freedom Trail and the Seafront where the Trolley Buses (very worthwhile and great value) depart from. In the area we ate at Ruth's Chris steakhouse (excellent) and Mr Dooleys Irish Bar (great pub, fantastic atmosphere with good hearty pub grub) both of which were only a couple of minutes walk away. Taxi's were readily available outside the hotel and the rides to Legal Seafood Harbourside (Floor 2)and Atlantic Fish (no 2 rated Restaurant on TA) on Boylston Street were both under $10. Within the hotel we loved the Bond Bar for a stylish start and end to the evening - truly a great location. Overall we had a fantastic time in Boston and are so glad we chose the Langham. We would heartily recommend it for service, location, style and value!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Petite32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham for 2 nights in early december. Very good standard. I guess the best with this hotel is the swimmingpool area and the feeling of being in another time. I was very impressed by the doorman who looked so magnificent. The swimmingpool area is beautiful, very clean with a lot of light from the outside and it was not crowded at all on a saturday morning at 10.00 am! There is also a jacuzzi ... The area close to the hotel is very nice and it is by walking distance to several interesting sites as the Holocaust Memorial that I really liked a lot. It's an outside memorial so you do not need to pay anything or to check the opening hours because it's in a public park. I heard the site is also interesting by night. The Boston Common is not very far from the hotel and definately a must. It's like Boston's Central Park I guess with squirrels everywhere. We tried the breakfast once and it was good but not great. The closest subway station is a little bit far away when the wind is blowing during winter time but certainly not a problem in summer time. There is only one thing that I didn't really like and that was that the housekeeping staff did move our things. My first thought was that this was impressive because, when we came back from dinner, somebody had moved the things we had left on the bed somewhere else in the room (on a table I think) and we could just go to bed without thinking about tidying up. But the next day, that happened again, and I think that somebody threw away something that could look like an empty plastic bag but it wasn't totally empty and I wanted to keep the bill that was in the bag and the bag too! Otherwise very good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Aditya_Shrivastava
Reviews.Content: I went on a short trip to Boston and this hotel was right near to the place I visited (Metro meeting center ), I liked the rooms; though they could have been more spacious. Bed was good and so does the other amenities. Service is the area where it shines and get high five for that. Be it front desk or the concierge desk; guys at door or the ladies at room service they are all warm and welcoming. I tried both the restaurants, one glitch is that the Bond is small considering the number of people gathers for dinner. Once we did not get a seat and had to go out. The saver here is that there are many eating outlets around the area and they should suffice your hunger and taste buds in such case. Additionally it is near to Quincy market, New England Aquarium; the place from where Boston tour buses starts; so a nice convenience if you intend to take a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Weekend Retreat”
Reviews.Author: mgbriggs
Reviews.Content: The Langham Boston is the ideal Hotel for quick weekend getaway. With easy access off Route 93 and within walking distance to Quincy Market & Government Center, you can't beat it. The staff, from the moment you arrive are more than welcoming. Each were well presented, professional and welcoming. From Bob at the door, to Helen and Haruko at reception, Kamal the bellman, and Sheila in Housekeeping, each were pleasent to interact with. Bond, the hotel lounge is a must try! Great atmosphere, menu, drinks and staff. The room itself was spacious, well appointed and the bedding comfortable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you like Old School Boston”
Reviews.Author: jakemcg00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Langham recently with my wife after booking through Hotwire. Having never stayed there (or knowing much about the property) we were looking forward to trying something different. The service there was excellent, from our arrival all the way to checkout. The clientele was skewed older, and I half expected to see an elderly woman in a fur coat carrying around a little poodle. The rooms were small, but comfortable (my wife was sure the bed was smaller than a Queen)! We checked out the gym and pool area which were certainly a highlight â€“ lots of modern equipment and a comfortable pool area for lounging. Check out the lounge Bond on early Saturday evenings â€“ youâ€™ll see many patrons coming from the chocolate buffet wearing the oddest costumes (we thought we were in Tim Burtonâ€™s Alice in Wonderland). I prefer a more contemporary property with more spacious rooms (e.g. The Intercontinental), so The Langham was a letdown in that regard. That said, if old school Boston is your cup of tea, then you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDInHouston
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful weekend at the Langham, service was fabulous, no small detail was overlooked, and any request was promptly taken care of. The the pink London cab was complimentary for short distances when available; it was a kick to ride in and a real head turner when we arrived. I can't say enough wonderful things about the hotel. Room was perfect, staff was genuine. Can't imagine why it is rated 14 of 73 because in my opional (and I'm a very fussy person when it comes to travel and hotel accomodations) that it should be rated between at least a 5-10. Spa and indoor pool facilities were great and the entire hotel was immaculate. There was only one noticeable drawback, and that was we could hear others in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place but could do with a more accessible bar area!”
Reviews.Author: Will W
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston at the start of our holiday. The Langham was our first stop. A very nice hotel, very tastfully decorated. Our room was very nice, and met our needs. Staff were attentive to our needs. We had a bed and breakfast deal, and breakfast was pretty good. Our one gripe was that there isnt a bar area where you can relax during the day, maybe have a drink and take it easy. The bar in question (Bond I think), is a little pretentious. So much so that on the evening we decided to pop up for a drink I was told I needed to put some shoes on. To be fair, the staff were very nice about it and I understood, but I always found that we were either in our hotel room or else out of the hotel somewhere else as a result. That said, location of this hotel is perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any visitors to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “sweet service”
Reviews.Author: Rockyluvsrochacha
Reviews.Content: Service is perfect and unparalleled. Real sense of royalty. Bed is awesome, soft and cozy. Convenient to move around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: doc_joe_NY
Reviews.Content: Booked after reading reviews on this site. Elegant setting. Followed travelers' advice in asking for high floor away from elevator, great suggestion. I was charged for internet but then fitness center was free. Nice pool. Spa on site. Got a room and breakfast deal on the hotel website for $195 + taxes. Walking distance from Boston South station but need a map and not with heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: gillianholt
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at the Langham as I did last Sunday,20 November.From the minute you stop the car until you leave you are treated like an honored relative by all the staff, made to feel at home and nothing I have ever asked for is too much trouble.Concierge desk is one of a kind,led by William,Lincoln ,the newset addition is very helpful and a worthy member of a fabulous team. Mentioned my shopping plans on the way to breakfast and while leaving the hotel they had telephoned to check the opening hours for me, never happened anywhere else. I am always sorry that I cant book my next stay immediately to have something to look forward to. Well done,Langham. The beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place - Disappointing Visit”
Reviews.Author: wendysprague
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, a Monday night, after having purchased a reduced night rate via a well known hotel website. I was checking in after 5:00 p.m. and leaving early the next morning. I'm assuming that it was because I booked at a discount, but I was given a room *directly* outside the elevator doors. And by discount, I mean a discount of their rates, still not cheap by any stretch. At 5:30 p.m. I could hear every conversation in the hallway. After attending a concert and returning to my room around midnight, and having to work the next morning, I was quite disturbed to hear children yelling in the hallway at 12:30 a.m. at the elevators, along with their parents' loud talking as well. To top it off, I had called just before checking in and was advised that the valet overnight parking fee was $40 and when I checked out, it suddenly was $42. Not that the $2 made a difference, but I had set aside cash to pay for the parking and to tip the valet, so I then had to charge the parking fee. I don't appreciate being nickled and dimed, especially after having just informed the front desk staff that I had been continually disturbed in my room. Seeing me holding the $40 cash for the parking should have been sufficient since I couldn't get my night of non-restful sleep back. It is in such a great place, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it for its location and the fact that it does have a pool, but I would definitely ensure that you are not placed in a room by an elevator or you can expect to get no rest. One major plus was their showerheads - a slice of heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Always a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Langham a number of time and was there again in the last month. It's gotten even better - the dining room which I always thought was a bit tired, seems to have been changed somewhat and is much more inviting. The staff is always great, from the front desk staff to the concierge desk (this staff is tremendously helpful) to room service. The hotel is located in a business district which I was initially concerned about since I didn't know what restaurants, etc, would be open in the evening but it's not a problem... the hotel is within walking distance of Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market and a quick cab ride to Boston's version of Little Italy. The hotel is great and my only negative comment, which I also made to the management, is that in a luxury hotel a guest should not be charged for internet service. In 2001 this is no different for charging for electricity in the room... no hotel would think of doing that and similarlly, should not charge for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location and friendly staff - typically Langham”
Reviews.Author: BasherWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: The Langham hotel is in the financial district but only a couple of hundred metres from the seafront and Faneuil Hall and probably 300 metres from the Common. Very clean and friendly, we had a lovely room with a nice high ceiling. I would suspect that you probably pay a bit more for the name and to be assured of the standard you would expect from The Langham.

Reviews.Title: “excellent down town hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: excellent downtown hotel with fine service and access to major in-town spots

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveitaly01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, excellent location to see many of the sights on the freedom trail--within walking distance of the Quincy Market,Fanueil Hall, aquarium, with a fairly convenient bus stop for sightseeing busses. The food in the Cafe was excellent and we had breakfast included. The Bond is a beautiful bar and lounge, but they also serve food and it was good for light fare. The only drawback is that it is a bit noisy in the evenings during the week. Our only disappointment was our room, and only because it seemed a bit dated and the carpet had a few stains. Not what you would expect when seeing the rest of the hotel. However, the bathroom was beautiful, all marble, plenty of hot water, fluffy towels and all the amenities.Housekeeping service was good,the concierge(s) helpful, and the doormen excellent. Service in the dining areas was good, too. Comfortable, convenient and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars All the Way”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl500
Reviews.Content: This large imposing and historic structure, a former Federal Reserve bank building, houses an elegant, well appointed luxury hotel. We reserved a Queen Classic through Ideeli for $175 but decided to upgrade to a room with 2 doubles after arrival. It was no problem for the accomodating and cheerful front desk. The staff is first rate. The lobby is gleaming marble and filled with flowers. Our room was spacious with 11 or 12' ceilings, mahoghany furniture, soft, comfy bed linens and the biggest bathtowels I've had in a loonnnggg time. The bath was marble, spacious and spotless. We had a walk-in closet, lots of drawer space and turn down was lovely with slippers laid out on an immaculate linen towel, chocolates and terry robes. The Langham has a history in England and they transferred the elegance to Boston. The valets wear bowlers and long coats. Everything is whisper quiet. But you're in the center of Boston's Financial District within walking distance of the Seaport World Trade Center, the North End, Fanueil Hall and much more. Delighted to enjoy a five star experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “First Class & Great Location for theater & north end”
Reviews.Author: ManitoMarsh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for mother's 80th birthday celebration. Concierge sent up complimentary wine & snacks to jr. suite for grammy. Other room was standard king with room for roll away. Pool was AWESOME! Kids and adults liked it. Standard room was standard size and beautifully appointed. Short walk to Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall. Easy taxi to North End for dinner after show in theater district. Brunch/breakfast was delicious and service excellent. Loved the historic map room and the holiday decorations throughout the common areas. My 8 year old son wants to go back and so does grammy!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Schull
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham in August when in Boston for business meetings. Excellent location, easily accessed ... not cheap, but you get what you pay for ... great room, very good staff, very good service ... they do exactly what they are supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to start our trip to New England”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: The Langham is right in the centre of Boston. Everything is walkable. It has an old school charm about it, and is a very impressive hotel. The check in staff were most courteous and the children were treated like VIPs. The front desk sent up slippers and dressing gown for them, albeit I think they need to perhaps look at their sizing as they were all much to small. We had an amazing view over post office Square and the room was quiet and well appointed. The swimming pool area is beautiful and the gym is well equipped. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleg
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy staying at the Langham hotels. Boston's Langham is very conveniently located in the historic district of the city. It is easy to walk to from South Station and is a $35.00 taxi ride from Logan airport. The service is good, I arrived late and they were able to check in my friend who was already at the hotel. It did take me 10 minutes holding before reception took my call. The rooms were comfortable and the seating area made it feel like a junior suite. The bathroom is older and could do with a refurbishment initiative. Concierge was also busy and poor man was on multiple calls as well as helping customers. It took a while before we were helped. Overall a nice stay and a nice hotel with nice facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: LJIG
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at this hotel. The staff were friendly, the rooms very comfortable and the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - great location, awesome service and very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: prestonflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to joining a cruise from Boston. This is a great hotel, very well run with great standards and very good rooms. The Bond bar and restaurant is well worth a visit. If you are there on a Saturday do not miss the CHOCOLATE BUFFET - if you love chocolate you will be in heaven. Great location for walking the Freedom Trail or for the business / banking district.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: MNKristen
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when I am in Boston. They have great customer service, from the doorman, to the front desk, turndown service, concierge and the room service staff! It feels like a vacation when I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing Chocolate Bar”
Reviews.Author: chitowncuse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Langham for 5 nights in October. The location is great - walking distance to 2 different "T" stops. Close to the Financial District and many of the attractions, including Faneuil Hall and the North End. Rooms are very nice, including chocolates on the pillow. Hotel staff nice and concierge helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Me515
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a Bachelorette party...so gorgeous and classy. Located in the Financial District, great location to walk to Faneuil Hall, anything in the Financial District, Waterfront etc. The rooms were lush, the lobby was all marble with little boutiques, a nice restaurant we did not eat at, great lounge/nightclub "Bond" we went to. It was an old Federal Reserve bank converted to a hotel, still keeping the main structure of a bank intact partially. The spa/fitness area/pool was very open and zen, complete with a glass ceiling, whirpool and great locker room/entryway. The staff was very helpful, including loaning us an umbrella for bad weather. Overall, a classic Boston hotel, overlooking scenic Post Office Square...not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Comforable room, good service, great breakfast high charges for wireless!”
Reviews.Author: sb8967
Reviews.Content: The Langham was the first hotel we stopped at during a recent trip to New England. We had a 'Classic' room on the fourth floor, overlooking the front of the hotel. It was very peaceful and served its purpose as a relaxing retreat for several busy days touring Boston. As is customary in the USA, concierge was very helpful and the doormen delivered our bags to and from our room, hailed taxis for us as and when we needed them. We breakfasted in Cafe Fleuri and whilst very pleasant, its cavernous size though decorated to a high standard made it quite impersonal. This is not a criticism of the Langham simply an observation of the building it occupies vis-Ã -vis former bank. Our two negative observations about the Langham concern; the charge for wireless internet access in the bedrooms - $12.99 for 1 day access and $33.00 for 3 days & in the hotel lobby. For a hotel of this quality we think this unnecessary. The Langham was the only hotel during our stay in New England that charged us for wireless internet access and compared to other luxury hotel groups such as Raffles, Shangri-La and De Vere this puts Langham Hotels at a disadvantage certainly from our perspective as future guests. We were also surprised at the Norwegian sourced water in the bathroom costing $8.00 a bottle - European Visitors note you will receive complimentary bottled water each night at turn down when your slippers will also be placed by your bed. Our criticism is not only for the charge this but also for the source of water. Surely a 'responsible' hotel that seeks sustainable environmental credentials through guests not having their towels replaced each day etc. should be questioning the sustainability of importing water from Scandinavia in glass bottles? This is something the European traveller may be more conscious of than our American counterparts? This said we acknowledge our trip to the US was not green in itself! So in summary the Langham is a great city centre hotel despoiled by its 'extra' charges.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oldbloke_TH
Reviews.Content: On our way home we stayed one night here. We wished we had done it on the way out as well. Excellent service, rooms, food, everything.... Centrally placed for getting around the city. Ate in the hotel at their restaurant and was really glad we did for quality of food and service. Whether it was just us, but Boston seems to shut on a Sunday. A brilliant experience.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon heaven!”
Reviews.Author: HackersDevon
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 5 days of our honeymoon here and could not fault it. From a very welcoming check-in where we were congratulated and given an up-grade for our stay, to the beautiful top-floor room and the friendly but completely professional staff throughout this hotel, we would highly recommend it. The concierge staff were very helpful - even before we arrived, in sorting out a whale watching trip and helping us find the best places to eat etc. Our room was immaculately clean - as was every other area of the hotel that we used. If you are looking for a great location with old fashioned, excellent service and an elegance that is often lacking in modern hotels, then this is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “my recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Opusone1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Langham Hotel in Boston for a business trip. I remember this hotel when i use to live in the Boston area. It was intriguing for me. The hotel building is a former Federal Reserve Bank, so there are many unique architectural aspects. Overall the hotel was wonderful. Location is very central and one can get to the tourist locations easily or to the financial district. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was very large and very clean. Bathroom was clean and efficient. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Langham - again!”
Reviews.Author: greenshorts
Reviews.Content: We started off with the unpleasant words that "your room is not ready" , upon check-in at past 5PM on a Saturday... but the front desk was extremely apologetic and expressed desire to make things right for us. They brought us drinks from the bar, and offered lollypops to our 2 children. They readily provided us the codes for complimentary wifi, as my wife was trying to do some computer work at the lobby. There was also complimentary wifi in our room. It took about an hour to get the room ready. Upstairs, the housekeeper gave the children backpacks with toy lobsters in them, and small bathrobes and slippers to use during our stay. During checkout, I requested a late checkout at 2 pm, and the front desk staff (Samuel) , granted our request without any extra charge. Overall, our stay was made pleasant by the people who work there- always personable and easy to deal with. We will be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Z
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good location. Above expectation. Really kind and excellent Service and friendly staff. Beautiful rooms. Very good gym. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic building, beware partiers & thin walls”
Reviews.Author: 75205Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on college visit. Gorgeous old Federal Reserve building. Comfortable room, walked to major sites. Quiet part of town at night. Lobby filled with sounds from loud, drunken reception ... "frat" party in room next to ours lasted into the wee hours. Multiple visits by security didn't solve problem. Although our two calls to front desk were extremely polite, we never received a hint of an apology. MUST SEE: 5th floor historic photos of Fed and two gorgeous NC Wyeth murals of founding fathers and Lincoln pondering war finances (Wyeth Room at top of staircase). We aren't ones to go out of our way to see art, but these are VERY cool and well worth 5-10 min. before dinner or on your way out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Joannanamnoum
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, the staff was very professional and helpful. Amazing lounge, room service was great too

Reviews.Title: “Nice, a little stuffy though”
Reviews.Author: senor_boom
Reviews.Content: The Langham is a nice enough hotel, in the old federal reserve building. The room we had was pretty small and had no natural light. I was surprised at how easy you could hear the people next door and in the hallway. Service was great and everyone really went out of their way to make sure our stay was good. Overall, a nice place to stay but the design and decor was a little too old school for me.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Boston”
Reviews.Author: missjenni
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Langham for 2 nights and was very pleased with the room and the service. The lobby is scented of rose (not overpowering) and the beds are comfortable. It's in the financial district so in easy walking distance to most central Boston locations.

Reviews.Title: “Some good,some not so good..”
Reviews.Author: cherryRUk
Reviews.Content: Good location and very easy walking distance of practically everything you'd want to see in Boston. We had a good room overlooking post office square. Nice touches like roses and chocolates (it was our wedding anniversary). Breakfast was acceptable but not memorable for $25 a head. Reception on arrival was impersonal and overly formal which contrasted sharply with all other staff we came into contact with who were delightful,friendly and helpful. My irritation with the Langham is their charging policy. Charging for the internet in these days of high technology where Wi fi is freely available in cafe's and public places appears stingy. Charging $4-8 dollars for " small bites" with drinks in the Bond bar ,when other high end hotels will give you small plate of nibbles with your drink, appears mean and the $42 per day valet charge is eye watering.I am aware they are a business and need to make a profit but if there is a perception in the customer's mind of profiteering rather than making a profit, they are getting it wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for our first trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days/nights at the Langham as part of our honeymoon. Staff were very nice and helpful, and we got given drinks and chocolate strawberries to help us celebrate which was a nice touch. The place looks amazing, very luxurious, and our room was very nice. We had a drink at the Bond Bar which was expensive (but most of Boston is) but very trendy. This was our first visit to Boston, and we had been told Back Bay was the best area to stay in, however we wanted a nice hotel but didn't want to pay Back Bay prices so we chose the Langham. The location wasn't bad if, like us, you don't mind walking. You can easily walk to Quincy Market and the marina. The nearest T stop is about a 15 min walk which is doable but can get a bit tiring. Being the financial district we found a lot of places closed up really early so the area was a bit quiet. The one big negative about the Langham was that it does not offer free wireless internet, and it's about $20 a day to get it (kind of steep seeing as the rooms aren't cheap, and that it is full of business people). If you want free internet then we found a great little coffee place called 'Flatblack' which is just around the corner - awesome coffee and free Wifi! Also a lot of the public parks have free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “It felt just like home”
Reviews.Author: brissiegirl01
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights at the Langham and I missed it from the moment we checked out and stepped into the taxi to go to the airport. It is such a beautiful Hotel and the staff are amazing. On our previous visit to Boston we stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza which was lovely, but the Langham is better. The key is their staff who make you feel like you're at home from the moment you walk through the front door. The staff also seem to be regulars, no different faces every day which helps to build a warm rapport. A huge thank you to Ezra, Junior & Sang who waited on us each morning with a smile and remembered what our 'usual' was, Daniel (who was happy to assist with any and all of our enquiries/requests - and who remembered us and welcomed us by name everytime we returned to the Hotel), Ryan on Reception who promptly and very efficiently found us another room - NO, there was nothing wrong with the room they gave us, it was amazing, had a lovely view over the park across the road, it was huge and had 2 double beds but I really just wanted a room with a King Bed and to Kamahl who had to move our hords (and I mean lots) of baggage from room to room and when we left without so much as even a snarl. Nothing was ever a problem and everyone seems to genuinely enjoy their job. I can't wait to go back if even just to say hello to them all again. It will feel like going home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: teedles S
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Langham. A luxuorious hotel with beautifully appointed rooms. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are well equipped with products. The staff are friendly and helpful.The only negatives: no free internet access not even in the lobby, it is in the financial district so very quiet after business hours and not much in the way of restaurants in the immediate vicinty. However, Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall are about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. South Station is also about a 10 minute walk away. If you are looking for a weekend of shopping and sight seeing, this locale is not ideal, rather stay in Back Bay, but for the business traveller, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Devongirlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights , and really enjoyed it. The Hotel, has a beautiful reception area, our bedroom was lovely withan amazingly comfy bed, and a spacious bathroom. Location is in the financial district.so quiet and safe at night, which we like.We walked the short distance to Chinatown for some excellent tasty, and reasonably priced dinners. By day we were pleased to find most of Bostons highlights close by.The staff were all friendly and helpful, [especially the Concierge Dan]. Breakfast was pricey but very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Tankstar
Reviews.Content: The Langham hotel is in the financial district so great location for walking easily to some of the key sights like Quincy Market, North End however it does mean it's pretty quiet on the weekends with most cafes being shut. However since Boston is easily walkable, this wasn't a problem for us. The real positives about this hotel were the lovely spacious rooms with comfortable beds, fluffy towels and an array of toiletries in case you've forgotten to pack something. The turndown service was also excellent with nice little chocolates left on the bed each evening. There was also a gym and pool which were relatively small but clean and a good extra facility. It was our anniversary whilst we were staying at the Langham and as my husband had informed the hotel when booking, we were greeted upon arrival with a platter of lovely chocolate dipped strawberries, lemonade and roses - a really nice touch. The not so great aspects of this hotel for me were the mixed concierge service (it really depended who you got - we were recommended an Italian restaurant which was awful!) and the Bond bar - although this is a stunning bar visually, we found the food and drinks to be completely overpriced. Since this was the only open bar/restaurant one evening when we didn't feel like venturing out, we had no choice but to eat there. Overall a nice hotel and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DawnQuorn
Reviews.Content: After travelling around the coast of New England we finished with 4 nights in The Langham. After living out of a suitcase this was pure luxury. The room was so comfortable and had pillows that you just sunk into. The hotel is clean and very big and the decor superb. It is in a fantastic location and minutes away from major sites. The hotel has a fantastic gym, swimming pool and wonderful whirlpool and separate sauna's. A great way to unwind after a busy day. On arriving in Boston we thought about going to see the Red Sox baseball. We approached the concierge and spoke to William. He could not do enough for us and within minutes had checked the prices and booked tickets for us. Although this is expected of the concierge, William went out of his way for us during our entire stay and could not do enough for us. He made us feel very much at home. All other staff were polite and helpful. This is a hotel not to be missed and we will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price of admission”
Reviews.Author: 304171Fulla
Reviews.Content: The Langham was exquisite from customer service to room/building maintenance. We stayed at the Langham for two nights. The Langham was kid-friendly with the rich luxuries adults crave. We were offered a map to all of the nearest parks and playgrounds for the kids and always received walking directions for our adventures. The mini-fridge was stocked with candies, foods, alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. The room was stocked with various gifts to enjoy during the stay (all for purchase, perhaps at higher costs than your local grocery store). I really enjoyed the personal service received from the front desk personnel and housekeeping personnel. Even the in-house phone service made me feel special. Each time I called down to the front desk I would receive a cheerful "hello miss ___ , how can I help you? Even with the questions which may have seemed silly, they always answered me seriously and without hesitation. One evening after the gift shop had closed, I called down to the front desk to ask where I'd be able to pick up a book or magazine in the area. The gentleman who I spoke with invited me to come down to the lobby so he could open the gift shop for me so I could find some reading material. He did just that which I was very grateful for, as tv is not my interest. I don't have to tell you how beautiful the rooms are, the on-line brochure shows exactly what you'll find; thick, beautiful window drapes, colorfully themed walls, and inviting living spaces. The pool area was nice too. It's not your everyday hotel pool. The entire hotel is sparkling clean and absolutely gorgeous. Everyone I was traveling with hated to leave the hotel. I certainly recommend it to someone who wants luxury and accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Location both a plus and a minus”
Reviews.Author: eliza6
Reviews.Content: We've often stayed in Boston hotels however we usually stay in the Copley Square area of town. This time we stayed at the Langham because it was the close to the site of a family wedding reception On the plus side, the hotel is located within walking distance of most tourist attractions. However it's in the financial district so there aren't many reasonably priced coffee shops or restaurants near by. Our party included small children. While the hotel restaurant accomodated us by seating us in an area where the children could walk around without disturbing other customers, it was expensive (Buffet breakfast was $15 for children and $25 for adults) and we would have preferred a more relaxed "family" atmosphere and less expensive dining. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff were all very efficient and friendly. Our room was a "Superior" and quite large with a king size bed. Lots of nice little touches including huge bath towels, extra special toiletries in the bathroom, cozy robes, evening bed "turn down" with chocolates on pillows, slippers next to the bed. Room service was excellent, room was immaculatly clean. The adults had drinks in the hotel bar "Bond". Decor very interesting, comfortable seating, and delicious warm potato chips. This hotel offers attractively priced room packages to wedding parties, even when the wedding isn't in the hotel. Our room price was a bargain for Boston. Traffic - Most of the streets in the finaancial district are one-way, and several streets were under construction . Therefore traffic is a mess and taxi cab rides were more expensive than normal. We took cabs to and from the wedding ceremony at the Boston Pulic Garden and it cost double what it usually would due to traffic. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return for a couples weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable”
Reviews.Author: Francesca D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very classy without being stiff. Nearly everything you want to see in Boston is within walking distance and when you come back there's a beautiful swimming pool with its fitness centre waiting for you to relax and enjoy the luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but impersonal. And it needs some expenditure to bring it to par with competitors.”
Reviews.Author: Steinbeck1805
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in October 2010. This hotel is handsome indeed, but has a more business-type feel to it than the likes of Back Bay Hotel or the Lenox. Location: - Well-located for business travellers due to its close proximity to pretty much every financial institution in Boston, a bit less attractive for Newbury St addicts. Although, keep in mind Boston is very walkable. If you shun the hotel restaurant for breakfast on weekend, you'll have a problem - there is a dearth of good options in that area. It is also not heavy on dinner choices (yes, Ruth's is close by), but you may walk to Chinatown for reasonable food (10-15mins). Room: - Superior King in our case. No surprises here for that category, although we wondered about the clunky CRT TV. No flatscreens in a 4-star hotel? It worked perfectly well, but it made me wonder the owner's willingness to cough up the capital expenditure to maintain such a huge outfit. They seem to have corrected it by now, still half a decade after most competitors. - On the more important issue of cleanliness, we could not fault it. - Size was generous, both for the living area and the bath. The most striking feature were the huge windows, which opened the view over Post Office square towards some of the imposing (for Boston..) skyscrapers, which made a memorable impression at night. Service - Check-in/out was efficient; retrieving our bags from the storage room took a while, but overall everything seemed professional. - Staff (both for room service and cleaning) was very friendly, which didn't do much to change the slightly impersonal feel of the place, however. Overall Impression - While there weren't any hiccups during our stay we came away unimpressed. Maybe the Langham appeals to the slightly "mature" traveller (we are in our early 30s); the atmosphere was more Old England than New England. Walking the corridors I thought it's a tad more stuffy than elegant or even luxurious, but of course that is a matter of personal taste. Objectively, it is a decent downtown option, not fancy but solid. It is just that you'll likely find better for pretty much the same price. Still, there seems to have been some upgrade going on (flatscreens..), so if you like the location, it is solid enough to at least give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: badgertracks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and in an excellent location for seeing Boston. They follow the habit of many upper-level hotels of gouging the customer for the use of wireless internet, but that's pretty common. They mistakenly charged me for use of the minibar, but corrected the situation with my credit card company immediately, with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first rate.”
Reviews.Author: Sir-Loin-of-Cali
Reviews.Content: Top notch, top drawer, upper crust. Name the superlative, it applies. Beautiful property. Super classy.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Victoria B
Reviews.Content: My husband, my daughter and I really enjoyed our stay at this luxurious hotel. What really stands out in my mind is the service. When we would come back for the night, we were greeted with a 'welcome back!'. The check in and check out were easy. Even the cleaning staff were excellent and helpful. My daughter wanted additional chocolates and they gladly gave her many with a smile. The most important thing or me is cleanliness. And it was clean. The room was large. The bathroom - avg. There was a hallway as well which we really liked. I must admit that the bed was not comfortable. If you are staying here on weekend, please be advised that most breakfast places are closed since this hotel is in a business district. It is very close to all tourist attractions. We walked to most of them. Had to take a car to science museum and took a train (which we walked to) to Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great ammenities, but couldn't use”
Reviews.Author: SusMil
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were a little surprised that we needed to take our own bags to the room. Room was very clean, large and comfortable. The matresses were very comfortable. They had turn-down service and free newspaper and had many options for eating in your room. The Langham has an award winning dining room and wonderful spa services. We were there for a wedding and, unfortunately for us, did not have the time to utilize them. The conciege was excellent. When I needed something, the gift shop was closed, so the congierge opened it for me so I could make my purchase. (I did not realize there was a CVS close by, or I would never have taken him up on his offer to open the shop)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TomX
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Boston for several years and when business took me there recently I asked a colleague to recommend a hotel. She recommended The Langham and I'm going to buy her a drink for pointing me in that direction. The hotel provides world-class service in an incredibly convenient location. Room was large and well-appointed, staff were unobtrusively eager to please and I was able to take an easy and very interesting walk to the North End for dinner. I will definitely return to The Langham.

Reviews.Title: “wish i had had more time to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: JohnFromMpls
Reviews.Content: I was in and out of boston this week. stayed at the langham. very good service from the moment i was in the door. very comfortable bed and extremely quiet. not the cheapest place on the planet. definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Elegance”
Reviews.Author: TednCaryn
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me with weekend stay at Langham for a special anniversary. Our executive suite was beautifully appointed and immaculate. Not even hurricane Irene was able to dampen our stay, due to special attention of Concierge. Special thanks to Dan, Daniel and Lincoln for making our weekend so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pcbbs
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided a great and friendly service and the facilities were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: MauiBear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old Federal Reserve building so there is an air of old grandeur here. The rooms are very nice and nicely appointed. The check-in was a bit cumbersome due to the (seemingly) experienced desk attendant but the rest of the stay was very nice. The location is close to the historic part of Boston but also right in the middle of the business district. All the major sites are walking distance. I found the staff to be attentive and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kal_C
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for my first visit and this hotel was selected by others in the group. The hotel is beautiful and you definitely get what you pay for. The service was wonderful and everyone we interacted with was extremely accommodating and helpful. We stayed over the weekend of Hurricane Irene and the front desk, wait staff, concierge, etc. made any and all adjustments necessary to soften the shock of having flights cancelled and stays unexpectedly extended. The hotel is conveniently located downtown and tourist sites, restaurants, T line, etc. are all within walking distance. There is a lovely park across the street with a small snack shop for coffee, ice cream,and sandwiches in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great service, wonderful breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: mchu
Reviews.Content: Deluxe room is very large with writing desk and two chairs at a table. Great LG HD TV with many cable stations. We loved that our linens were changed each day without the usual "save the environment" reminder. "SIX" pillows!! Robe and slippers. Staff service was sincere and friendly. And best of all, each morning, we had a sit-down made-to-order breakfast with linen napkins and friendly smiles. While waiting for Hurricane Irene to arrive, my United flight back home for Sunday was canceled. James, the night manager, gets huge kudos for getting me out of Boston early. Booked me a flight Saturday morning for departure that same afternoon. Thanks, James. I was a happy camper to be home before the storm hit Boston. Otherwise, I would have been stuck in Boston probably until Wednesday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guygsimpson
Reviews.Content: My wife and have just enjoyed three lovely nights at the langham Boston the hotel is clean and very comfortable bed only week point was the concierge Who did not know much about the city

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wiced
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and the pool and health suite were first class but I suppose they should be it is quite expensive to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham is simply bostonishing!”
Reviews.Author: Amber L
Reviews.Content: Like all good hotels in Boston the Langham is expensive. This hotel is excellent but it's daily rate is, in my view, overpriced. We were able to get 150 dollars a night off by booking early through the usual suspects and this made the value much more competitive. They had a charge of $12 per day or wifi, which is unnecessary these days in any hotel let alone such a pricey one. The room are small but comfortable and well furnished. The bed is awesome. The room had everything and while only seven or eight stories high the view the street allowed slot of natural light. The room where quiet and the hotel well placed. The concierge was excellent in all regards. The gym was excellent and the pool looked good. Simply an excellent all-round experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robbbyva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham for 12 nights. The hotel and staff were terrific. The hotel staff could not have been more courteous or helpful. The rooms were nice and the bed/sheets were all very comfortable. On my day of departure, I had a 6PM flight. I asked if I could have a late checkout....as in 3PM. Since they were full that night that was not possible. Instead, they did offer me the use of their gym so I could shower before my flight. In reality, thats all thats all that I needed. I did leave my luggage with the concierge. The only possible con is that the doors have a tendancy to shut loudly. So when the maids turn down your bed, deliver you water and chocolates, you do hear the doors closing - as well as the late night revelers..... I would defintely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “elegant, service oriented”
Reviews.Author: ngkgschck
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to stay at The Langham in Boston for a wedding. The service is impeccable. The building was the Federal Reserve Bank and the architecture reflects an era that can't be duplicated today. The room in which the wedding took place held two gigantic murals by N.C. Wyeth. The meals choices for the wedding were excellent, not typical wedding fare for sure. The following day breakfast which is delicious and well worth visiting was hosted in this same room. The staff at ever turn was helpful and gracious. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it. It is centrally located for walking to Quincy Market, the North End etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: marcello41
Reviews.Content: Hotel elegant and very convenient for visiting Boston (the major attractions can be easily reached walking). Friendly staff and very available in providing support. The only drawback the fee for Internet access service, that we would expect to be free of charge. In addition for each (tentative) telephon call you pay more than 2 dollars even if you can't reach the other party

Reviews.Title: “Boston is a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Walkers829
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew to Boston and stayed from July 1 through July 5 at the Langham Hotel. The Junior Suite, overlooking the park below, and tall buildings surrounding were very scenic and beautiful. The Suite was very comfortable and the breakfasts/brunches at the restaurant had a wide variety of food for U.S. and international guests and the service was great. It was the ideal location for us as we enjoyed the short walk to the waterfront where the Aquarium, many restaurants, , the Extreme Sailing racing was taking place, and where we could hop on Trolley which would take you to different parts of the city.
