It was not necessary to have a car -took taxi from the Airport. The Trolley company offered different packages/pricing tailored to your interests. We had a great experience sighting several whales with New England Aquarium Whale Watch part of the package we chose and saw many historic parts of the city on the Freedom Trail, as well as sampling several chowders at the Chowderfest. Not on the waterfront, but again, a short distance from the hotel, Faneil Hall area had wonderful shopping opportunities as well as different free activities, music, jugglers, magicians, mimes in unusual costumes, and much more. It was my first trip to Boston although my husband had been there over 20 years. I really enjoyed it. A wonderful, clean, historic, and modern city to walk and tour around. A great place for all ages. I wquld go back again in the Spring or Fall.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dorgadog
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nites on the Linger Longer Rate which included excellent hot breakfast daily . Good value for old world elegance , civilized comfort , quiet rooms , high quality bedding- towels- bath amenties , cleanliness throughout , great pool-health club , friendly staff everywhere - excellent location within walking distance of numerous attractions and subway stations. The package deal includes the highest priced a la carte breakfast for two persons --- we were two adults and a child --- our three breakies exceeded that credit daily but hotel did not charge us the excess . The concierge knows the city very well always leading us to the closest subway station , restaurants or the shortest route . Our room was on second floor overlooking Oliver Street --- it is a quiet street - no buses, or truck traffic did we hear - Hotel is chiefly caters to business but very accomodating of our tourist family - there are no kids activities - the pool was heated , max depth is 4.5 ft and our 10 yo daughter loved it - When you visit Boston , you must take in the JFK museum -- easily accessible by subway and free shuttle . Boston is a beautiful city ; our stay at The Langham enhanced our experience/.

Reviews.Title: “Historical building, small room but good service”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Langham Boston in May for business. The hotel was converted from a former Boston Federal Reserve Bank thus the building wasn't really designed for a hotel - and you will see some odd pillars and structures here and there. The kingbed room I had was small but well appointed. Yet I think the price was still too high for what it had to offer. Perhaps it's all for the location which is very convenient and within walking distance to the Financial District, South Station and China Town.

Reviews.Title: “what a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: trim42
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Langham, one night (8/7) ... valet parking was expensive ($42.), inconvenient, incredibly rushed by the overworked doorman in the rain ... had booked through Capital One Rewards, a "supposed" $485. room that could double as a walk-in closet adjacent to the elevator ... questioned the front desk as this was totally unacceptable, but to no avail ... with all the deals available in the downtown Boston area, this place is way overpriced, room was well appointed but miserably small, staff friendly but unaccommodating ... glad the red sox beat the yanks in the bottom of the 10th so we didn't have to go back until 1:30 AM and left as early as we could ... would NEVER go back. ... but really, more Capital One Credit Rewards Program's fault than Langhams ... still an incredibly poor price/value!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: UncleTommy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short weekend getaway to Boston. Having already stayed at the Langham for business, I was confident that it would be a good location for some sightseeing -- and it was! Very easy to walk to Faneuil Hall, the Waterfront, and Boston Common. The superior king room was comfortable and had nice amenities. The Perfectly Langham Package included an excellent breakfast each morning at Cafe Fleuri. We also enjoyed dinner and drinks at the hotel's BOND Restaurant & Lounge -- great ambiance in the former Federal Reserve Bank. The hotel/restaurant staff was helpful and courteous. I'd recommend the Langham for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fine.”
Reviews.Author: lesleyd
Reviews.Content: We were expecting something just a little nearer to The Langhams in London and Hong Kong. We had no complaints, area was great, rooms fine, staff helpful but nothing outstanding. Would probably stay again. (Lovely cafe in the Post Office Park next door for breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurenh121
Reviews.Content: hotels in boston are expensive, so went for this one as it was a little cheaper than others in the same range and absolutley loved it. the service was excellent and they really have kept the ellegance of the building, i would definitley recommend and stay here again if i ever found myself in boston again, although they do charge for wifi / internet!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: nyme
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Langham Boston many times. It is located conveniently for most of my business meetings. Plus, I like it. It's hushed elegance, the way the Ritz Boston used to be before it went all modern. ... In any case, I was only staying the night, and the hotel was seemingly fairly empty, so I was awarded a free upgrade to a suite overlooking Post Office Square - if that's the name of it. All kinds of nice upgraded amenities came with, even the pens were lovely - not the usual. I think I really lucked out - maybe some celeb cancelled! Everything was first class, including the breakfast room service the next morning. I had the health breakfast and it was GIGANTIC and DELICIOUS. I felt like Julia Roberts in Pretty Woman - you remember the scene - definitely out of context and replace the waffles with egg white omelete with wild mushrooms and mild green onion. Tasty! My view of the Langham has improved even from the high opinion I held earlier. The staff are very international, and nice too. Thanks for the upgrade guys!

Reviews.Title: “You don't get service like this anymore”
Reviews.Author: eakNYC
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Langham Boston once or twice a year when business brings me to Boston. The Langham is what I'd imagine hotels were like in a more genteel time. The lobby is modest but you are greeted like royalty. I've stayed in both the queen-sized and king rooms; both are very well appointed with nice bath amenities and bed linens and robes and slipper laid out every evening with the turn down service. You also get chocolates on your pillow, another lovely touch. There may be glitzier hotels but if you want impeccable service and old world charm the Langham can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel -- paranormal experience in room 411.”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveler618
Reviews.Content: The Langham is a beautiful, elegant hotel in the middle of the financial district, close to my company's Boston office. I've stayed here on business several times, whenever I have found a price below $300 per night, per company policy. And I will stay there again -- as long as I don't get room 411. At 4:09 am, I was suddenly awakened by an unseen force pulling me up out of bed. I was ice cold on that side, even though the room temperature was set at 72 degrees and I had a couple of blankets on the bed. was I am not kidding, I am not crazy, and nothing like that had ever happened to me before, or since. I yelled out in the darkness to whatever it was, to leave me alone and leave my room. I immediately felt the cold air go away and the feeling of dread, and I rolled over and went back to sleep and didn't wake until the alarm went off. At check-out, I asked the front desk if anyone else had had this experience in the room before and of course they very politely said no. But I wrote about it in the in-room diary. I would love to know if this has happened to anyone else staying in this hotel, especially room 411.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulscan
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for our 3 night stay this month. The front office staff were welcoming and very efficient. Our room was quite spacious, very clean, quiet and bedding very comfortable. Bathroom was excellent. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, but slightly inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: JessNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a bachelorette party weekend. We had great adjoining rooms. The front desk staff was super helpful and the rooms were beautiful. The Langham is a lovely old Boston hotel. Parking was actually really convenient and cheap -- $18 in the garage a half block away (that is dirt cheap for Boston!). The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. My only complaint is the location. Being in the Financial District, it was tough to wake up on Sunday morning and not be able to get a quick cup of coffee without paying a fortune. In Boston, it's tough to go a block without somewhere for coffee, but the nearest place other than the pricey hotel restaurant was five blocks away, according to the bellman. That's the only downside to this place. I'm guessing this hotel is fabulous if you're in town for business travel. Overall, though, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Staff go the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: EWADSU
Reviews.Content: Lovely grand dame type hotel, restaurant worth visiting, beds &linen top notch, rooms a bit on small side & though our bathroom huge only one small handbasin & elderly difficult to use shower! Location really quiet but near to sights, etc. All the staff happy to help in all departments, we had a lovely time here

Reviews.Title: “Great location and overall outstanding hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Clive35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights over the 4th of July weekend and loved this hotel. The location is in the middle of the financial district, but is a very easy 5 minute walk from Quincy Market, North End or the Aquarium/Waterfront area. We liked the fact that the hotel was a little removed from the crowds at the Waterfront or Quincy Market, and there were several pubs, restaurants and convenience stores within a few block area. The hotel staff were all very friendly, in particular, the concierge staff, who provided several candid and helpful restaurant and tour recommendations . The fitness area was pretty extensive for a hotel and well-equipped. The pool was indoor, but was a good size. We didn't have time for any spa services, but the list looked inviting. We were upgraded to a larger king room, which was nicely furnished and roomy. The bed was very comfortable, and the housekeeping staff were like invisible ninjas--never seen but always efficient, with an evening turndown service. We had absolutely no problems or complaints of any sort during the entire time we were there and definitely will make it a point to stay there when we're in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect”
Reviews.Author: BTBL40
Reviews.Content: Luckily the hotels near the Seaport Trade Centre would not take a booking for the WAFA show June 13 to 19, at the time we booked our flight from the UK. We settled for the Langham, thank goodness, although we used taxis to and from the event it was well worth the expense because we were so near the City when not at the Show. Everyone employed in the Hotel were excellent, you felt that they cared. The doormen were very friendly and offered advice about dining and getting around Boston. Located in the Financial District the Langham is an ideal place to stay, not too far from the T and near most of the attractions with many dining opportunities around. When we return this is were we will stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service for Business and Family Vacation for 5”
Reviews.Author: terabill
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Boston that I was able to bring my family along. We have three children, ages 5, 3 and 1. We stayed for 7 nights. We picked the hotel because of its location in the financial district while also being about less than a 1/2 mile to parks (one next door), transportation, Quincy Market, the wharf and attractions. We had stayed at a Langham before with good service, but the Boston Langham brought it to another level for caring for my family. We came in on a red-eye flight and arrived very early with exhausted children. The staff accommodated us, letting us get into the room very early. They provided an upgraded suite with a beautiful view of Leventhal Park next door, which the kids really enjoyed. Their was a fresh fruit market and Starbucks nearby. They had good choices for breakfast for the whole family in the cafe. From the concierges and front desk staff to the bell men and housekeeping staff along with the restaurant servers, they all went the extra mile in meeting our families needs and requests. They were very kind to our children and gave us excellent suggestions for transportation, getting around town and places to see and eat. The lap pool while small in size, was perfect for my children and they had floating equipment for them as well. While we didn't make use of the spa services, the staff were helpful and the area was restful and inviting with a good exercise room. For business or vacation, this is a great hotel for good service at a very reasonable value. We would definitely return on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Ideal Spot”
Reviews.Author: PaulD97
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston and we loved it. Spent most of our time walking, always felt safe and the sites and history are incredible. This Hotel was in the perfect spot for walking to almost everything. Our room was great, not huge but very comfortable. The staff was top notch and will stay there again. One thing, when you book through most of these sites, we used booking.com, the final price is not the final price, make sure to add in 14.4% sales tax. Other than that stay there.!!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent luxury hotel, but not sure I'd come back”
Reviews.Author: wagnerlk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Hotwire.com and checked in to find out we had a room with a full size bed. Unacceptable at the high rate we paid (even for Hotwire). So we upgraded for $75/night to get a king size bed in what I thought was still a very small room. The hotel doesn't have many special or memorable things about it. Even down to the toiletries not being name brand. I expect more from hotels in the luxury category. Will say that the room service was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, old-world style”
Reviews.Author: KiraBeauty
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff knew our names and were genuinely enthusiastic for us to enjoy our stay. I chose the Langham as I am an 1865 member & prepaid for the booking online. It was great. Mostly, I'd recommend the concierge staff who were incredibly knowledgeable - particularly Daniel - and who had wonderful suggestions for dinner and activities.Internet was free for me so that was good but I must mention the amazing bar/loung BOND - it was stunning! Now I look forward to the Langham in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat008186356
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very friendly and helpful and really went the extra mile to make our stay special. The room was very well presented and clean and they include some nice touches in the turn down service. The hotel bar/restaurant is also really nice. Definitely worth a visit especially on a Wednesday night when they have a live jazz evening.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel, and you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: pfbird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham three days in May while attending a business conference at a large convention hotel down the street. I hate the impersonality of big convention hotels, and since the big hotel was booked solid, I was looking forward to the more intimate comfortable surroundings of a smaller place. The Langham did not disappoint. The lobby was beautiful and set a terrific tone. In checking in, however, the rates listed on my registration documents were $20 to $30 higher than specified in my email confirmation sent several weeks earlier. I had to produce that document before they would reduce the rate to what had been agreed. That was distressing. It was also disappointing that at an average nightly rate of nearly $300, the hotel still wanted to charge $15 a night for internet access. Fortunately, I didn't need it. I just used my smartphone instead. Having said all of that, the room was beautiful, though the upper hallways seemed dated. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom had a lot of luxury details, including an air tub and booties set out every evening next to the bed. The location was excellent, just a five-minute walk from Quincy Market. The hotel also had an excellent restaurant on the premises, though the prices were way up there.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with a nice, warm touch”
Reviews.Author: Gunya
Reviews.Content: This is a grand hotel in what was formerly the federal reserve bank building, refurbished and kitted out in Second Empire style. The location is central, and about 15 minutes' walk from the Boston Convention Centre. Staff members are unfailingly cheerful and helpful and really enhanced our stay. The fitness centre was pleasantly set out, well equipped and included a pool and jacuzzi. Whilst I would hesitate to pay for this out of my own pocket, getting it paid for via my employer made this achievable. Overall, a classy hotel with a great team for whom nothing was too juch trouble. The only negative was the wireless internet in room access, which was appalingly slow. Not sure whether this was geenrally true, or just our room location.

Reviews.Title: “All round good place..............”
Reviews.Author: millie04
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights here in May. Boston Langham is a great hotel. The facilities are excellent and the room we had was super. Great position in town. Only one hiccup really. We turned up at the bar for a drink on the Saturday night. I was wearing a smart shirt, trousers, jacket and deck shoes. They would not let me in due to the deck shoes. Quite astonishing really. This incident certainly detracted from our night out and although I left notes on the questionaire detailing this, nobody ever got back to me. Having said all that I would say that as long as you don't wear deckshoes anywhere you will enjoy your stay at he Langham Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BRnurse
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Langham. We did splurge on the superior king instead of the standard room and were upgraded to a large, corner, king room. I was able to peak in other rooms while walking down the hall and did notice that the standard room was rather small, but nicely decorated. We found the service, housekeeping, and concierge to be exceptional. The beds are comfortable and all rooms have robes and slippers. Brunch at Cafe Fleuri is expensive but definitely worth doing once- make reservations. Spa, pool, and gym were beautiful, but we did not get to use the facilities. The hotel is in walking distance to basically everthing in Boston and is a short walk to the central subway station. Don't waste your money on transportation if the weather is nice! Don't listen to the bad reviews. This place is really nice. (I cannot speak for the standard rooms or suites, though)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NickJodySiena
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to the US about 10 times and The Langham has the best service I have ever encountered. They genuinely care. I did not try the restaurants but the room service was excellent. The hotel has Wi-Fi as well. The rooms are not very big but that reflects the age of the hotel. I got sick one night and my wife phoned the front desk and they immediately patched us through to Massachusetts General Hospital and within minutes I was talking to a Doctor for advice and the Dr was willing to visit the hotel. The Langham then gave my wife and toddler a free room for the night to ensure they did not get sick as well. As it turns out I was fine the next day (reacted badly to a meal) and in the morning the manager phoned to check on me. The hotel is located in the financial district but it is only a short walk to the main tourist areas. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Why Ancient Bank Buildings Don't Make Good Hotels”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: In a way I feel sad for the Langham in Boston. It's a great brand with a great heritage, but its Boston property has a distinct problem: INFRASTRUCTURE. There is nothing that can be done about that, given the fact that the building was the old (in Boston, that means really old) Federal Reserve Bank building. So it has a massive girth, squat height, and wave upon wave of granite facade asking with all of its might that you stay away. The end result, once you do find a way in, is a forced imposition of elegance which, to my experience, did nothing to fight back the overall impression of claustrophobia. Not helpful is the window treatment I found in my room: a relatively small double hung window with an insulating pane screwed in to keep away any access to fresh air and a huge awning covering almost half of the visible exterior space, resulting in a bunker-like view. The location of the building in the continually deadening old center of finance in Boston leaves one with the simple impression that better hotels are to be found. Everything about the service levels during my stay were superb; cheerful and efficient checkin and room service. Welcoming all about. Again, however, I can only feel sad that nothing can be done about the structure and its enveloping gloom...

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: cardak1990
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the welcoming staff was exceedingly friendly. I scheduled a spa treatment; however, I did not book it correctly. When I went to the spa the receptionist tried to find other employees who could come in. None of the associates wanted to come in and I was very disappointed, but it was my own fault. Knowingly that I was disappointed, when my spouse and I were in the hot tub with the whole room to ourselves she brought out mimosas for us to have at our leisure. She was a five star employee. The only problem I had was after we checked out, I had forgotten my swimsuit and when we called to notify the staff we were coming to pick it up, they â€œaccidentlyâ€� hung up on me twice. Long story short I waited for over an hour for them to go into our room and pick up the swimsuit. The hotel as a whole was a wonderful experience and I would recommend visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint New England”
Reviews.Author: CAevents
Reviews.Content: You definitely know you're in NE when you stay at the Langham. The doorman are dressed in top hats and long coats, wallpaper, wood paneling and heavy drapery abound the property. The guest rooms are nicely appointed, albeit with small closets. The Hotel used to be a bank - they have pictures of the buildings construction all throughout. As a place to have a meeting the meeting rooms are located all over the building. They too have heavy drapery, ornate wallpaper and gilt fixtures. Room sizes are on the smaller size. Food is quite delicious - from banquet food to restaurant and room service. The scones are simply yummy. I wasn't there to experience their famous chocolate Sunday service - it comes highly recommended. Location is convenient to major shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but no complaints”
Reviews.Author: kemc83
Reviews.Content: We booked via expedia's unpublished rate system and were pleasently surprised when we found out that we would be staying at the Langham. The staff were friendly and the hotel smart. Our room was small but had everything we needed. The spa facilities were good although the pool was quite cold. The on-site bar was great. If you want a table it would be wise to book as when we arrived all the tables had reserved signs on them.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuthLo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a corner suite, which was huge. We were also presented with roses and wine. The room had everything you could possibly wish for (and a lot more too). The turndown service was exceptional. The location was brilliant - it was only a few minutes walk to all the main sights: Faneuil Hall, Boston Common etc. The Bond bar was stylish and hip but without being pretenious. We had no problem getting in as we were guests of the hotel. Special mention should go to Daniel Abbott, the concierge, who went over and above the call of duty in helping us organising our onward travel by train to pick up a motorhome. The only downside of the hotel was, it is not cheap, and once we got there, there was a further charge to use the wifi. After paying Â£300 per night - I did expect free wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: colinl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, easy walking distance to most things. Airport is 15 minutes in a cab, or 15 minutes by public transport. Rooms are well appointed and in good condition, staff were very helpful. The gym was well appointed and open 24 hours. Not too much else to say really, everything just worked and was non-obtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ225
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of anything remotely negative to say about the Langham. Our experiences-from smooth check in, to the elegant rooms and great amenities- were all outstanding. My fiancÃ© were looking to explore Boston for the weekend. The Langham was in a great location for walking or taking the subway to all of the popular sites. We enjoyed the club that was attached to the hotel, Bond, which was a great late night lounge for drinks. The hotel had an amazing indoor pool and hot tub, it was a great way to warm up after walking around chilly/rainy Boston in April. The concierge was also very helpful in suggesting a great restaurant- Eastern Standard. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a weekend getaway. Hope to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding”
Reviews.Author: thedishBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned this getaway into Boston to celebrate a milestone birthday. I chose the Langham mainly because of the great rate and good location. I honestly didn't expect much more than that... But I was very pleasantly surprised! When we checked in, the desk clerk informed us that we had been given a free upgrade to a suite. Our suite had two floors, two bathrooms, two flat-screens, an espresso maker, and an enormous picture window. It was immaculate and beautifully decorated. Then we received a surprise gift from room service... A chocolate "Happy Birthday" cake with sparkling lemonade! In addition to the excellent customer service, we found the hotel's location to be ideal. We parked right across the street, walked to many nearby attractions, and enjoyed a few drinks in the bar (which used to be a Federal Reserve Bank). My husband also got a massage at the spa. All in all, we couldn't have found a better spot for a one-night getaway into the city. I'll be staying here from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Service made this stay get top marks”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two times in February, one for 1 night and one stay for 5 nights. Let me say from the start that from a "style" pov I generally prefer a more minimalist, less classic/historical looking hotel, but this hotel won me over! I can't think of a better place to stay with young children in Boston. Everything is spotless, the rooms are extremely comfortable and the furniture is in excellent shape, the towels and robes are nice and thick, the turndown service is amazing (we were given roses one night!). The kiddie menu at Bond and Cafe Fleur are incredible values with a lot of selection. The pool is GREAT. So fun to swim inside when it is cold outside and we had my 4-year old with us and he paddled around with a life jacket and a noodle. Everyone was very smiley and friendly-- I guess that is the most important thing to mention. Service everywhere (Bond, Front Desk, Concierge, Bellhop) was great great great. I was overlapping business travel with family travel and it worked, thanks to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Langham Boston Continues To Impress”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Langham Boston while attending a conference held at the hotel. This was probably my sixth stay at the Langham over the past six years and the hotel fits me like a glove. Check in and check out were efficient and pleasant. Front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff were pleasant and accommodating as always. My room and bathroom were impeccably clean throughout my stay. Although the hotel was at capacity, I heard no noise from adjacent rooms and virtually no noise from the hallway outside my door. My room was on the seventh floor and I heard no street noise. I slept soundly on the comfortable bed and there were plenty of great pillows. I always request a room on a high floor and away from the elevator and the Langham is always happy to oblige. I am a member of Langham's 1865 loyalty program. As a result, fresh fruit and a newspaper were delivered to my room daily and I was afforded a late 2:00 p.m. checkout on my final day allowing me to change into comfortable clothing for my travel home. Much appreciated. I did not have occasion to use the pool or fitness center during my stay. I did not use room service during my visit however, all meals served as part of my conference were nothing short of excellent, far exceeding any expectations I would have for large group meals. A festive adult beverage with colleagues in the trendy bar was most enjoyable as well. Private meeting rooms were excellent and spacious and were serviced regularly by hotel staff throughout each meeting day. This was a fine choice indeed for a conference venue. When my travels take me to Boston, the Langham is my first choice in hotels. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Fabulous Customer Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LobosBahia
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The service at all levels from all staff was great. Everyone helpful, friendly and efficient. Room was nice enough and very clean but slightly disappointing considering the rest of the hotel was so amazing. The Langham is very well located and is 5 mins walk from Quincy Market and a couple of mins from State train station. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay with the Langham Boston and would highly recommend for it's beauty and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: momyto2yearold
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel trip as a "complete family" as we just had a baby. We really needed to get out of our house for a weekend so we decided on a long weekend "staycation" in case it doesn't work out (we wanted to be able to return home easily). Langham Hotel was a fantastic choice for us. We brought more bags then if we were going to the trip around the world, but with 2 little kids you have no choice. The doorman was phenomenal. He helped us unload, he gave each of the kids a small beany baby toy and lollipops. Right of the bet that made us feel so great! The parking next door in the Post Office garage is only $9/day on the weekends so we took advantage of that. It's easy to get in and out. We got a room on the 5th floor (Pool is on the 2nd but that floor is being renovated so they didn't have rooms close to the Pool). The room was HUGE with two most comfortable beds, desk, table and two arm chairs. Everything smelled clean. The complementary chocolates awaited us. It's those small things that count when you're paying for a luxury hotel. The location cannot be beat - just a block from Quincy Market (shopping, food, attractions). We got complementary newspaper (you have a choice at check in between Boston Globe, NYT, usual suspects). The towels were replenished twice a day by great room service. The pool area was nice and relaxing, yet kid friendly (they had kid floatation devices available, pool noodles etc). The jacuzzi was nice but packed. The bathrobes and slippers are provided in the room so you don't need to bring your own. So is the blow dryer. The locker rooms are luxurious and kept clean. Fresh fruit is complementary (apples & oranges) in the spa area and the main front desk. The consiege was very helpful in booking Sunday brunch. I would avoid eating in Bond Restaurant (overpriced, snobby, mediocre food), but would try to go to the "Sunday Brunch Buffet". Even at $54/person it's a fantastic experience, and great for special events. The food was high quality, the atmosphere amazing and the service great. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We wish we could live in it ;). P.S. No free internet, isn't that strange in this day and age?

Reviews.Title: “The beds should be a controlled substance”
Reviews.Author: sansovino2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, but I just want to point out that the beds are the most comfortable I've ever experienced. They should be classified as a drug; go ahead, lay down and the most you'll say is 'good nigh-' before you're asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: lmd86
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the financial district - just a short walk away from quincy market/faneuil hall and the north end. Check in is always a breeze, and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I have stayed here several times and the rooms are always great. They are spacious with very comfortable bed/pillows. There are pretty city views and the flat screen tv and ipod dock are nice touches. The fogless mirror in the bathroom, makeup mirror, and full size hair dryer are great as well. I have never eaten at the restaurant however, BOND was a great time - but got crowded pretty early. Also, the chocolates on the pillow are tasty - so i'm sure the chocolate buffet would be superb.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service - Loved the Bathroom Mirror Defroster”
Reviews.Author: dimes
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel from check-in to check-out. It's an beautiful building, the staff are dressed to please, and they are attentive to the little details that make the stay grand. We loved the turn down service, complete with a small bottle of water and a chocolate and slippers. We spent alot of time walking in Boston and the slippers were a nice touch to pad our feet at the end of a long day. The concierge was helpful in arranging a nice restaurant for our first wedding anniversary - Mare. The bell hop arranged a taxi for us as needed. We were a short walk from the subway station and on the weekends, the financial district was quiet. We were able to sleep soundly - my husband was grateful for this. Access to free wireless internet would make the value for my dollar even higher. A lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: ant0shka
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Boston in the financial district near the office. The hotel was clean, rooms were nice, and the breakfast was good. enjoyed the bond lounge, drinking 18 year old scotch.

Reviews.Title: “European charm with Bostonian sensibility.”
Reviews.Author: BostonLegal02110
Reviews.Content: My partner and I live in Boston and each year we spend our anniversary enjoying the delights of the city that we would not necessarily have time to appreciate otherwise. Â This year I decided to surprise him with tickets to a Bruins game followed by dinner at Menton and a night at the Langham Hotel. I work in the Financial District and entertain clients in the restaurants at the Langham from time to time so I am familiar with the hotel. Â Needless to say I expected a first-class experience and as usual the Langham and its staff delivered and made our brief overnight visit brilliant. I booked a two-storey Loft Suite at $615.00 on their website. Â The price was a tad more expensive than our disappointing junior suite experience at the Fairmont Copley last year, but I feel it was well worth the premium price tag. Â Our suite was beautifully decorated in a classical elegant style, wonderfully quiet and serene and had everything that one should expect. Â A plush comfortable bed with high-quality linens, Penhaligons bath products, fluffy towels, large flat screen TVs, yadah, yadah, yadah. Â We appreciated the little unexpected niceties like the fresh flowers, personal stationary on the desk, scented small pillows for relaxing next to the bed and trinket box in the master bathroom. Â  Nice accommodation aside, what makes the Langham special is its employees. Â From the clerks at the reception desk who recognized our anniversary when we registered and again when we came to checked out to the gents at the Concierge desk who sent sparkling wine with chocolate covered strawberries to our room, to Cathleen in the spa, everyone we encountered was pleasant and genuinely cared for our well-being. For the reasons mentioned, the Langham is easy to recommend to visitors from out of town, or those from in town like us. Thank you, Jason and Ryan

Reviews.Title: “Sleep but don't eat”
Reviews.Author: WolverineFl
Reviews.Content: Went to a wedding at this hotel last week and found a beautiful hotel in a great location with wonderful staff and not very good food. We had lunch at the Main restaurant Bond with my grand kids I did not see anything on the lunch menu I liked so I ordered form the kids menu a Fenway Park hot dog and indeed it did come from Fenway Park a long time ago it was limp and crickled, the others enjoyed their salads etc. Eddie the bartender/ waiter was very good. Ordered Eggs Benedict from room service the next morning and got a person on the phone that was not familiar with Hollandase sauce or that toast does not normally come with this dish, I ordered extra sauce which I had to reorder when it did not arrive. The dish was not good the eggs over cooked and cool. The wedding reception was at the hotel the and dinner was served buffet style again great service but bad food. The location of the hotel and the Hotel itself is great but I would not stay there again because the food is in complete contrast to the facilty.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great People, Excellent Spa! Stay Here Now!”
Reviews.Author: gailslist
Reviews.Content: Each year i pick a different hotel to stay for Christmas...saw this online http://www.mayorsholidayspecial.com/ called and talked to Jim the night mgr, he gave me a special AAA rate $157. for a big hotel in the city near fanueil hall? and they bumped me to a king superior room, wow! and i forgot it was an old bank, wow the decor is astounding! Bond Restaurant is my new hangout in town (you should see the decor) and Chef Leavy makes a shortrib that is to die for literally! The rooms are very nice, beautiful ammenities, great bed and tv, free use of bathrobes and you get to keep the slippers nice...and the spa omg it is so beautiful (ask for Lyndsay) she gave me a salt scrub that was so fine she is so good at what she does, you should see the pool jacuzzi area you can see out the window (see pics below) all in all i have to say that the staff is the best i've encountered, the location is like wow you can walk up to the Boston Common in like 10 min., i love that! My stay at the Langham was the best stay in Boston so far bar none! If it wasn't for the snow storm coming i would have stayed the entire weekend, don't hesitate stay here now!

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: limousin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel at the end of our round the world trip. We had stayed in other Langham hotels so expected this one to be excellent. I would say that it does not quite have the wow factor of other Langham hotels we have stayed in however it is very comfortable and the staff on the whole are excellent. The rooms are not as plush as other Langham hotels we have stayed in. The king sized bed and pillows are extremely comfortable. The manager was very kind and helpful to us especially when we were disappointed with our superior room. The concierge desk is very knowledgable about Boston and helpful in suggesting trips for us to do. The spa and indoor pool are very pleasant but there is no steam room. Breakfast at the weekends is buffet and a la carte during the week. The quality of the food is very good and the coffee in the Bond restaurant is the best I have had since coming to America. The location is central to the shops and heritage trail which we found very interesting. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: 1goirish
Reviews.Content: Had a two night business stay in Boston recently and chosr this hotel based upon location. Smooth check in and friendly front desk. Worked in room first night and room service was prompt and food was great. The second night the concierge made what turned out to be a great recommendation for dinner. Price was fair for Boston during the week. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: SJ_Australia
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from our 3 night stay at Langham Hotel in Boston. My husband and I both agree it is the best hotel we have ever stayed at. The hotel rooms are spacious and very comfortable, however it was the attentiveness and warmth of the staff employed there that we noticed immediately. Every member of staff during our stay from those at reception, to the concierge desk to the lovely ladies servicing our room were fabulous... because of them we felt our experience was outstanding and we felt spoiled. The hotel is very well situated in Boston - within walking distance to several major attractions such as the 'Freedom Trail' and Science Museum, but also some great restaurants and good shopping. We ate at Mother Anna's (delicious Italian) in North End, about 10 min walk from hotel, as well as Montien (authentic tasty Thai) in the Theatre district (short taxi ride away). We also ordered room service one night and the food was outstanding. The only downside to the entire hotel is lack of free internet and wi-fi, for which you will be charged should you wish to use it. I only add this in as guests who are travelling for business may wish to know this. But I wouldn't let it stop you from choosing to stay here - this is a far more personal hotel than any I have stayed at and am recommending it to anyone looking to stay in Boston city.

Reviews.Title: “High hopes dashed”
Reviews.Author: Rena
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel, based on all the reviews here. While this hotel has fancy curtains and a very good staff, the hotel itself is very ordinary for the price. The bathroom was shockingly small, the furnishings were average, and for a non-smoking hotel, our room had to be changed due to heavy smoke smell because my daughters friend has asthma. I would not pay the money to stay in this hotel again. For the money, I much prefer the Boston Intercontinental hotel. It is directly on the water, the staff is very nice, rooms are a very good size, and the bathrooms are luxurious with an oversized tub, large glass enclosed shower (for 2 if desired), lots of countertop space, etc etc. Based on the reviews here, people are swayed more by finishings and fluff, than substance. For

Reviews.Title: “We Are Guests for Life!”
Reviews.Author: msclvr10
Reviews.Content: Where should I begin, for 5 years my husband and I have travelled to Boston, and stayed at various places, most recently at the Langham. Out of all the places we have stayed, it was by far, the most polite, considerate, and clean experience. From the mints on the pillows, to the directions from the Concierge, Daniel, we felt right at home. I used the facility to work out and swim, the jacuzzi and sauna were awesome, to unwind after a long day, and BOND was a great place to have a drink, and enjoy each other. 10 min walk to Fanuiel Hall and North End.

Reviews.Title: “Our Great Weekend at the Langham”
Reviews.Author: JCandJC
Reviews.Content: It was high time we revisited a friend- that is, what used to be Le Meridien. The Langham turned out to be quite a class act, from it's efficient, friendly check-in, to an upgrade to a corner room on the upper floor, it was the promise of a great weekend in Boston. The room we had was spacious, clean, and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had all the basics, was very well lit, and there was always a hot shower. We got the bed-and-breakfast package, which we recommend. it includes a wonderful breakfast each morning at the venerable Cafe Fleuri. And the one thing that hasn't changed is this wonderful breakfast spot with one of the best breakfast buffets in Boston. The old Meridien had a nice piano bar where a couple could get a drink and listen to fine piano music, in the comfort of big, easy chairs and sofas. The Langham has replaced that with Bond, a lively bar spot, which is noisy, crowded, and a veritable meat market. We really wish that the Langham would provide an alternate bar setting which is more conducive to relaxing conversation. And the weather in Boston was the best we've encountered yet. Fair and mild, very conducive to walking.

Reviews.Title: “A class act that everyone should experience at least once in their life”
Reviews.Author: hoffmailman
Reviews.Content: From the minute you get out of your car you are having a "Langham experience". Everyone is "on their toes" to make sure you are receiving excellent service. The Hotel Bar/Restaurant called "Bond" is NOT to be missed. The ambience, the martinis, the crowd, the food are magical!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Boston”
Reviews.Author: doug_humes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Boston for a wedding and stayed at the Langham. The building is in the heart of the financial district, and an easy walk to Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market and the historic sites (we walked to church Sunday morning at Old North Church). The hotel is located in the former Federal Reserve bank. The building is impressive; built like a medieval fortress, and the U.S. Eagle is still in the floor of what is now the bar, but perhaps was the public banking floor. The room was large, immaculate, and beautiful. The lobby was gorgeous. An upstairs sitting room had murals by N.C. Wyeth. There is a decent exercise facility with pool. It was a very good experience. I would go back there in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in August and couldn't fault the hotel. Clean and decent size room and bathroom. Nice location, just 10 mins away from downtown crossing by foot. Quiet and elegant. Check in was a bit slow, a few people ahead of me but otherwise it went smoothly. I highly recommend and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but rooms small”
Reviews.Author: joannetravel
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel, and after booking on the hotel website, found a lower rate elsewhere, which the hotel not only matched, but gave me a further 25% reduced rate. This applied only to one room, however. Rooms were not available when we tried to check in and we did have to wait till 3pm. It was inconvenient, but the desk staff were good about it. I had asked for 2 rooms on the same floor and they gave us 2 side by side. I have stayed at Langham hotels before (Aukland) and we recieved a much nicer room and better value. That said, the room was small by US standards but it was well appointed. Bathroom was nothing special, and the tub had a slip proof floor that looked a little worn, not very appealling. Because we were delayed getting our room the desk staff gave us an hour free use on the internet, but it didint work! They ended up taking the charge off. But when I phoned down to enquire about it, the person on the desk was ill informed and not particularly helpful. It is a nice hotel, but not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: marniemac
Reviews.Content: An old staple, the rooms could do with a bit of a refresh but the staff are great, as is the location. The Bond bar is a lovely spot and the pool and fitness centre are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: auroranyc1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Langham this past weekend. It was our first stay at the Langham and it was a great stay. Our room was cozy, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel itself was classy. My husband used the fitness center every morning and he was extremely pleased with it. He loved it! We travel alot so he's seen many fitness centers and he was very impressed with this one. I got a facial at the Chuan Spa and I've got to say it was extremely relaxing facial with a great massage... the esthetician Lindsay did a great job. My husband got a massage (he forgot the esthetician's name) but he loved the massage as well. I would recommend to try out the spa services if you are staying at the Langham. We had breakfast at Cafe Fleuri every morning and we thought the food was delicious. We tried the brunch on one day and the buffet another - and no complains everything was good. The Langham hotel is located at walking distance to many sights! This is always a plus if you're a walker. We walked to the Boston Commons, Chinatown, the North End (Little Italy etc), Beacon Hill, the Faneuil Hall marketplace.... the hotel is walking distance to many great sights. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone, just have to mention that there is a club/lounge in the hotel called "Bond". On Friday and Saturday you can hear the music - very faint though, we were on the 3rd floor, I don't know if you can hear anything on the other floors. It wasn't too loud, that's why we didn't care for it and did not bother us. But it is worth to mention so there are no surprises if you do stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: MKL121
Reviews.Content: If you like to be catered to and treated like a VIP this is the hotel for you. From the minute the doorman greets you till the time you check out the staff makes you feel special. For a special weekend or just a visit to the city this is the place to stay. We have been back once or twice a year for the past 5 years and never had a complaint. They get ***** 5 stars from us...

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Dudicrach
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, a short walk from the station, The Langham is an old style establishment where service is gracious and both public areas and rooms are elegant, clean and spacious. Having just spent 5 nights in a very claustrophobic and not very clean hotel in New York, The Langham provided us with three nights of much appreciated comfort in style. Breakfast was included in our deal arranged through Trailfinders and was truly memorable. The only downside was that the Spa (pool and jacuzzi) were out of action.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCoward
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Langham as the final stage of two weeks in NYS and Massachussets. When we arrived the reception staff looked after the children while we returned our hire car. The concierge organised whale watching trips for us and were happy to advise us on places to go and eat. One evening, on our way out for dinner, our daughter was crying because she had lost a toy. The reception staff were very concerned for her. When we returned to our room we found a tray with milk, lemonade and an enormous plate of cookies had been left for her. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities as we were only there a short time but we fell in love with Boston and when we return for a longer visit in 2012 the Langham will be our preferred hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel well worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: debbie2373
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean,location great for the city,receptionist a bit snobby ,he was friendly enough not over joyed to see us turn up with our shorts and rucksacks,we had been upgraded to a super by travel agent he tried to put us in regular room.No chance i had it in black and white.Apart from that I would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Australia1959
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights at that start of a holiday. The website made the rooms look wonderful but we found that it was not at all like those that appeared on the website. We booked a double/double and had asked for foam pillows when booking but they were not in the room on arrival. Although there were four of us in the room there were only two robes, enough towels for two, two mugs, enough tea/coffee for two, two glasses etc. The bathroom was very tired and in dire need of an upgrade. Water had seeped up the back of the door and the base was rotten and the mirror rusty. The charge for the in room water was $9 per bottle!! When we phoned room service for a jug of tap water they told us there would be a $5 service charge to bring it up to our room!! After complaining to the Manager we were given bottled water free of charge with the comment that "they were a business"! They also charge for use of the internet and hooking your laptop up. We ate at the hotel on the first night only because we arrived late and were tired from the flight. The portions were small and the food very expensive for what is was (London prices). Supper for four, three starters, four mains and a bottle of wine $200. We ate out the other nights and certainly did not eat breakfast at the hotel as diners are more fun and better value. The gym was adequate and the pool very small and cold. The only plus side is that the hotel is within walking distance of most things but although we were on the 5th floor our room overlooked the street and was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go again. Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: phillm
Reviews.Content: The Langham, Boston, what can I criticise? Well nothing really. I had a wonderful 4 night stay in Bostonâ€™s best ***** star hotel. I/we found all the staff most accommodating and very friendly. This is not a corporate trait, but something that comes naturally to them. The concierge service couldnâ€™t be faulted (praise to William the third), the reception was well organised and thorough, the service at breakfast was/is excellent. The weekend breakfast was best of all, but then we had great conversation with the weekday service Staff. â€œLots can be learnt through the art of conversationâ€�, this Hotel and its staff have lots of local knowledge to share! Oh, and the rooms were excellent too as was the pool, spa whirl pool and gym facilities. Looking forward to an autumn (fall) visit to the area England misruled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Good Service”
Reviews.Author: CTTan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a lovely building in the business district area, quiet in the evening/weekends. Nevertheless it is in a good location, about 15 minutes walk to Boston Common, 10 minutes to the wharf (Quincy Market, boats for whale watching etc) and about 5 minutes walk from part of the historic freedom trial. We stayed in rooms 460 and 465; rooms are big and very comfortable. The only minor snag is that the shower in room 460 was rather weak. The staff tried to do something but problem was still not solved when we left. Other than this minor hiccup, there is really nothing to complain about. Service was good in all aspects. Check in staff was very courteous and friendly, concierge was very helpful and appeared keen to help. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel for those who want to have a nice break in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AllieCat61
Reviews.Content: Whatever I write here cannot truely convene what a wonderful experience we had at the Langham. Everyone from Jane, at the front desk, to Sonny in guest services, were incredibly helpful and friendly. Let me explain. We booked our rooms through Hotwire...our first time. As we checked in, our conversation with Jane lead to a discussion of the reason we were in Boston. It was to celebrate my 49th birthday. Upon hearing this, Jane upgraded us to a larger room, which was greatly appreciated. During the second night of our stay, we awoke to a problem in our room. When the front desk was notified, they quickly sent a staff member to our room. It was determined that we would need to move to another room. It was 2:00 am! Sonny, our favorite Langham employee, assisted us in moving to another room. For me, this was a challenge because I was so sleepy. He helped us move everything. Shortly after getting squared away in our new room, the front desk called our room to apologize for the inconvenience and gave us a free buffet breakfast the next morning. Later that day, the hotel manager called us again to offer his apologies for the inconvenience we encounted. Several days later, the hotel sent us a bottle of wine and fruit tray to again apologize for the problem. We were overwhelmed by their thoughfulness. If you have traveled a lot, you know that not all hotel chains are this sensitive to their guests. The Langham, Boston, and its employees, are turely guest services specialist, and will do everthing they can do to ensure that you have a wonderful time at their house. I would not hesitate to stay with them again. They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay - comfortable, with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Alanmelon
Reviews.Content: The Langham is situated in the financial district of Boston, in a grand converted Federal Building. Our four night stay was exceptionally comfortable in one of their 'Superior' Rooms. The room was very clean and well maintained, decorated in a classic style with ipod dock/ alarm, TV and iron all on hand. The only thing missing was an affordable/free wifi connection which many hotels now offer. The room was very quiet with little or no noise from outside or other rooms. On arrival we were greeted by friendly receptionist Anton who explained all of the hotel's facilities and details of our stay. We were particularly impressed with the courtesy call to check all was well with the room and the fact that he remembered our names throughout the week. A turn down service was available each evening, with details of the next day's weather forecast included. The quality of cleaning and service were great. The facilities in the hotel were also very good. We found ourselves making use of the pool and spa situated within a full gym complex/holistic centre. The hotel bar, 'Bond' was based in impressive surroundings - comfortably decorated with lounge chairs and more formal tables, and apparently frequented by well off local bankers. It did seem a bit pricey, but probably not more than the going rate for a hotel bar. The main restaurant was closed during our stay due to refurbishment, so breakfast was served in a nearby function room, which again was elegantly decorated. We were lucky enough to have breakfast included in our room price, but would probably not have bothered otherwise due to the cost which amounted to around $50 each day! All in all - very few complaints. Superb service, well maintained, clean and quiet surroundings. Just a bit expensive at times.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtf1949
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! Enjoyed our stay. The location was within walking distance of the waterfront, Quincy Market and general shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Return home after 8 years.”
Reviews.Author: done2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Boston for a re-visit to my old home town. We were very fortunate to have stayed at the LANGHAM HOTEL located in the financial district. This hotel,although located in a business district ,was so conveniet to all the restaurants,pubs,Fanuel Hall,Historical sites,and tourist attractions. The hotel staff were excellent in their friendship and professionalism. My thanks to the Concierge sect. staff,DAN, LINCOLN, and DANIELLE. They made resv. at very good restaurants @ very busy times for us that saved us long waits inline. Vast knowledge of where,what and when. Our room was a DLX Queen on the 6th floor. Bath quite large and room very adequate for us. Bed was comfy and even came w/turndown svc. and chocolates. Room cleanliness was excellent. All of are online request were met.( Hotel,s Resv. website)

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK TICKETS WITH THE CONCIERGE”
Reviews.Author: jls93
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner were traveling around the East coast and were staying in Boston for 2 nights. Neither of us had ever been to a baseball match so we decided to ask the concierge the best place to buy them. He was very happy to tell us that he could get us tickets. We thought the tickets were very expensive but decided to go anyway. We met a "vendor" outside the Red Sox stadium and handed over the money. The tickets cost approx $15 each we handed over approx $150!!! We complained to the hotel and they didn't want to know. If you want to go to the game buy them outside the game or print them off yourself. This incident spoiled our view of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Walking Tourist”
Reviews.Author: wiggum77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the hotel last minute through a discount website that only tells you the name of the hotel after you purchase the rooms. The building used to be the old federal building that they converted. We arrived around 4pm and check in was smooth. Our room was on the top floor and our outside wall was sloped in and all windows. The rooms were small, but the location was perfect. We were less than five minutes from all Faniel Hall and the warf. I would definately stay here again but would not pay the full price that they ask for on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: TheDigitalArtist2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a 30th anniversary getaway, and could not have been more pleased. From check-in to check-out we were treated like honored guests. Our room was upgraded, and management sent up lovely chocolate-covered strawberries and sparkling lemonade. Our room was very well-appointed and immaculately clean, and we had a view of the lovely park next door. In addition to the usual bath amenities, there were two fluffy robes and two pairs of slippers, as well as a neat box of items often forgotten for nail care, shaving, etc. There is turndown service every evening, including a couple of chocolates. The concierge service should get special mention for outstanding service. The personable concierges were always helpful, whether it meant finding an address, giving directions, or locating a lost jacket. When we asked where to get a Charlie card (to ride the T), we were handed a card with fares on it! The pool is good - not huge, but big enough to swim laps, and set at a comfortable temperature. The ladders are a bit high, so getting in or out may be difficult for anyone with knee problems. But another plus - there are mats ringing the pool so that you will not slip! I haven't seen this elsewhere, but it certainly seems like something ALL pools should have. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “First of all let me start by saying the...”
Reviews.Author: dana713
Reviews.Content: First of all let me start by saying the actual hotel is beautiful. That being said, I would like to complain about how rude management is. I attending a wedding on saturday and after the reception we tried to go to bond, the bar inside the hotel. We were told we were not in appropriate attire, bc we were all dressed up however after dancing in heels for 4 hrs were wearing flip flops. Instead of explaining to us why we were flat out told by the roid head manager that we were not going to be let in. Of course this did not go over to well. We were guest at the wedding and we were guest at the hotel. After talking with the bar manager we were told we were a threat to the club bc of a comment he hard us say and that there was no way we were going to get in so we should "just go to bed". When I tried to complain to the manager of the hotel I was met with the same rudeness and arrogance. While I was trying to voice my opinion, he was blatanly ignoring me and continued to go on with his nightly duties as if I was not there. I was talked down to as if I was a child. And basically he did not provide me any explanation for why he or the bond manager were rude. I guess 205 per night to stay here does not include being respected. I would not recomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Langham - just OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Stevo49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Langham on two occasions. Two years ago it would have gotten a fairly good review, mainly because the bathroom was spacious, I had a King size bed and the rates were fairly good. On my most recent trip the cost of the room was high, and really did not represent good value for money in my opinion. First there was no flat screen TV. I had a Queen size bed and the cost of the upgrade was $55 extra per night for a King. In addition, the bathroom was small and seemed a bit dated. However, the spa and workout area is absolutely fabulous and might be one of the best I've ever seen. This was probably why the rates seemed a bit hike for me. It's about a 15 minute walk to Fanueil Hall, and the location is fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and a pleasure to stay in this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABC123Wakefield
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Langham in 2006. At that time I was a solo visitor but due to the exceptional service and care provided by the staff I promised myself I would return with that someone special in my life. Four years later and now married to that person I returned to the Langham. I had already told my new husband what a wonderful place this was. On our return we were not disappointed. The room was as comfortable as previously experienced. The service and standards had not changed and all the concierge staff especially William were excellent, caring and very, very helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them and we felt like part of the Langham family. Not forgetting Jane on reception she too was just brilliant. Senior management at the Langham take note - you have a fantastic set of staff - from two very happy UK tourists from across the pond. We plan to return to this wonderful hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay..great location!!”
Reviews.Author: kta99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. We arrived late and had no problems with checking in. The hotel is beautiful, clean and centrally located. There is a wonderful little coffee shop in the park about a block away. We were within walking distance of many of the sights. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't experience any of the issues that previous posters had. We were a little bit leery after booking and then reading some bad experiences but ended up extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bubble1027
Reviews.Content: I used to use the hotel when it was Le Meridien. I often stayed there for work and personal use so I decided to see what the new hotel had to offer. There have been some great changes to the hotel with a new spa (only used to have a pool), great new restaurant & bar BOND (although I did like the old Julien Restaurant). The one thing that did not change was the outstanding service that I have always received in this hotel. I have not been back to the hotel for over 7 years but some of the great staff that made my stay so memorable are still there today. Everyone and I mean everyone goes out of their way to assist you with anything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: Flange_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at The Langham in July 2010. Fantastic service from the moment we pulled up in the taxi. The doormen, front desk staff, bellmen, concierge, and in-room dining attendants were all courteous and extremely helpful. The property has a unique restaurant called Bond. Great food, good value, and if you're just looking for a drink it's a pretty cool space to just hang out. One minor thing to note is that they do charge for internet use; most hotels offer in-room high-speed for free these days. But when logging on, the website makes it clear that there will be a charge if you proceed so - no surprises there. Overall, the best customer service experience we've had in a long time and definitely a place we would look to stay at again. We would recommend The Langham to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodations. Not a single detail was overlooked.”
Reviews.Author: sgertgen
Reviews.Content: We received a promotional rate when we booked the Langham without knowing what to expect. Upon pulling up to the valet, we were met at every turn with extraordinary service and an attention to detail that impressed us to no end. Our room was a Superior with a Kind bed. While it was not a large room, the window was large and the layout was efficient yet luxurious. The bed and bedding was high end, and the towels were not only thick, they were oversize bath sheet size. We used the spa, pool, and workout facility each day of our stay--fabulous equipment and outstanding environment. This hotel is worth every penny you pay. The location is a short walk to many local attractions, even the North End, which is about a 20 minute walk. Because it was a weekend, the financial district was quiet--a very nice treat when walkin for coffee in the morning! Useful tip: cabbies don't know how to find this hotel easily. Be sure to tell them the address (250 Franklin) and that you're going to the hotel which used to be Le Meridien. That will help them locate the hotel... oh, and be sure to bring dress slacks for the Bond bar and nightclub--they have a dresscode. We got turned away in fine golf attire/sundress.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel - Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jamela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham for the last night of a 3 week holiday for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. We got a really good deal, and based on some previous reviews was a little unsure however we had no need to be as our experience was superb. We arrived at the hotel early and did not expect to be able to get our room, but luckily it was ready. Reception staff were great and upgraded us to a luxury park view room, which was beautiful, especially as it was a lovely sunny day. This hotel is elegant and luxurious and I cannot understand the previous negative reviews. All the staff are great and the hotel is located within easy walking distance to Quincy Market and Fanieul Hall. We were looking for somewhere casual to eat, and the staff recommended Brandy Petes, which was exactly what we wanted and we had a great evening chatting to some of the workers from the Financial district . We used the bar and the cafe and both were really good, the decor in the bar and surrounding rooms was fantastic with old historic maps of New England on the walls. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Langham Boston”
Reviews.Author: HotelBlogs
Reviews.Content: The Langham Boston is located not so far from the business district of the city and minutes away from a popular street (Washington street) where you can do a lot of smart shopping. I arrived in the evening and the reception was very efficient to check me in. They upgraded me to a larger room with 2 queen beds even though the hotel was probably very busy on the same week of the marathon. My room was very impressive in terms of space and translates what a 4 star room should look like. I have paid a short visit to the pool on the evening which is very nice but couldnâ€™t help to sleep longer in the morning rather than swim. The bed is very comfortable with a decent desk where you can work easily. The bathroom was also huge. The negative point was the TV which was this big block TV in the furniture with a not so good reception. I think at the the price the hotel sell their rooms, you would expect a flat TV with HD channels on it. The WIFI is not free, which was also a disappointment. Overall, a very good hotel in its pure English styleâ€¦itâ€™s a Langham hotel after all.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: cmello28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Langham this past weekend for 3 nights (memorial day weekend). Overall we loved the Hotel. We loved the location especially close to everything you would want to see in boston historical area. We loved the decor of the hotel and the room they were perfect and very clean. The room we had was a classic king I believe, wasn't to big but perfect for us bed was amazing! we loved the ipod soundock in the room. We got to enjoy the indoor pool and gym which was very nice. Wish the pool was outdoors but think its a great idea for winter months in Boston!. We didn't get to enjoy any of the restaurants since they were very expensive!! We got a great deal from expedia and would definitely stay again. We parked across the hotel in the lot for $10 a day holiday special which was sweet. On out last day the Fire Alarm went off at about 9:30am which was strange but all was taken care of in a matter of minutes with not worries. As we were checking out at the time it didn't really bother us. Checking in and checking out was very smooth. Boston is a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and NOT WORTH IT.”
Reviews.Author: JLWB79
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's nice...but not $400 min.+/night for a dinky room nice. The room was small, and I was unimpressed. Lobby was pretty, but again, not worth the much higher rate than a 3 or 4 star that pretty much has all the same feautures. The pics we were shown online were not represenative of the room we got. I think they set some dinky rooms aside for hotels.com users...I'm all for paying more for room service and such but the Continental Breakfast (two eggs, toast, coffee, juice, 2 slices of bacon/sausage) was $27 before a room fee, taxes and surcharges. My husband and I had to laugh. After tipping the waiter, one would pay about $70 for for two people for that! Seriously? That's not luxury, that's completely idiotic. You'd think you'd get a big TV or soemthing too, but you get a little 24-ish old school model. Yipee! I'm living the good life now! I can eat my $70 crap breakfast in front of my 10 year old TV and then go to town on a $9 bottle of water (no lie) It would be one thing to pay this for a great experience, but it just wasn't. I didn't get the idea they gave a hoot either...Is "meh" a good descriptive word?

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: quenie0
Reviews.Content: Never again will I stay here or recommend this hotel. It's old and the service is bad. The GM is a snob and did not pay attention to our complaint. We felt that we were a distraction or annoyance. Worst hotel we experienced. Our business meeting was ruined by inefficiency and poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dated- In much need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: 4kidsintow
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel, but it was so dated. Our first room had a bizarre configuration that was crowded and didn't allow for TV viewing from the bed. The TV's were actually very small and old. No flat screens in these rooms. The decor was dated, not traditional and some of the furniture was stained. The bathrooms had plastic curtains which I do not expect to find at a 4.5 star property. On the positive side, the breakfast and the sheets were great. There are too many hotels in Boston to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Jazznost
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, historic hotel located in Post Office Square in the financial district of Boston. We were treated exceptionally well by the entire staff during our entire visit. From the doormen who remembered us every time we came back, to the warm and helpful concierge and front desk staff, the service was terrific. We had a comfy room overlooking the gardens in Post Office Square, and had access to a very pleasant indoor pool and health club just down the hall. They also offer a very extensive selection of spa treatments. We enjoyed the Metropolitan Tea in the Bond bar inside the hotel, and had a phenomenal brunch on Sunday at Cafe Fleuri, complete with great live jazz. Both are highly recommended and well worth the cost. Another bonus is the Governor's Room, which houses a wonderful collection of antique maps of Boston, from the Leventhal Map Center at the Boston Public Library. Some have complained about the lack of restaurants in the area, but it is a very quick stroll to Downtown Crossing and Quincy Market, and there are plenty of places to dine in these locales. The North End and Chinatown are also not far away, and easily accessible by foot. The T is also very close by at State St and/or Aquarium stations, just a quick stroll down the street. Post Office Square is also full of great Art Deco buildings, including the New England telephone building (now Verizon) that are well worth looking at while you are there. We are coming back this weekend, and looking forward to another wonderful stay at the Langham.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service sorely lacking”
Reviews.Author: CBH53
Reviews.Content: We reserved a king room at The Langham through a conference booking center for a medical convention in Boston. The king room was confirmed by phone the day of check-in. Upon arrival at The Langham, Russell, a check-in clerk, informed us that there were no king rooms available, and we would have to take a queen room. We decided to look at the queen room, which was essentially an attic room under the roof eaves. Two people could barely walk around the bed, and we asked the front desk to find us a king room, as we had booked. Russell insisted that our reservation was for a queen room, and he would "show us the confirmation on the computer" to prove his point. That was his only concern: to show that the mistake was ours, and not his. He made no offer to find us a better room, reiterating several times that we had booked a queen room and that this queen room was all that was available. We told him we were willing to to see if a two-double bedded room was available, and our amiable bellman, Daniel, got the keys to another room on another floor, and took us there. When we opened the door, we were met by the strong smell of cigarette smoke. This is a non-smoking hotel. When we called the front desk to request yet another room, Russell was less than happy to help us, and told us the best he could do was to send housekeeping to use an "ozone cleaner" in the room.
