By this time it is after 10 pm, and we were not amused. Our bellhop got on the phone and confirmed the smoke smell. Another desk clerk found a third room for us, again two double beds. The day we were to check out, the toilet malfunctioned. When weI called housekeeping. We were told "an engineer would be sent up immediately" Twenty minutes later, we went downstairs to the front desk and asked the clerk to call housekeeping. When we checked out the desk clerk on duty asked how our stay had been. We answered that it had begun poorly and that we had not been happy about it. She said nothing. We are very experienced travellers, and expect that a member of The Leading Hotels of the World" understands and appreciates the importance of proper guest service. Our experience with Russell and the manner in which the room assignment was handled speaks poorly of The Langham.

Reviews.Title: “I just stayed at this great hotel. I had...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerWithVision
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this great hotel. I had flown in from Los Angeles on the red eye from Detroit and didn't get into the hotel until 2AM. I had my luggage lost at the airport and nothing with me except my briefcase and laptop! The Front Desk Clerk was a lovely young woman who made me feel very much at home although I was anything but home. She arranged for a "distress kit" for me containing all the items I needed until American Airlines returned my bags. That evening the clerk arranged for a tee shirt and shorts to be sent up for me until my bags arrived. I was blown away! My bags arrived in the morning in time for me to have a meeting in the hotel's Cafe. I felt like a different person. The restaurant was bright and busy when I arrived. The host sat me at a large table until my appointment arrived. I was glad to have a large enough table to conduct business and not given a small table for two in the corner. They obviously are used to tony business clientele as the room was packed with well-heeled people conducting their own business. After a day of long meetings, I relaxed with a Harmony Treatment in the Spa which was just what I needed. The health club was very clean and well organized with a nice swimming pool and awesome workout equipment. I finished my reports over a Sam Adams and the best burger I ever had in a hotel room. I still have my "Boston" shirt the clerk gave me and look forward to staying here again. Sadly, I am booked at the Fairmont in April which is not as nice, thanks boss!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: EatatRalphs
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the better hotels I have ever stayed at! Stayed for a week in January and just could not get enough of the place! The room was amazing, the bar/ lounge Bond was amazing, and even the pool in the middle of winter was amazing! Room service burger was the best Ive ever had and Sunday brunch was superb! Thank you Hans for an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bosguy44
Reviews.Content: I just spent one evening (Sat 13th) at the Langham and was very unimpressed by the hotel itself and the service provided. This was a valentines day getaway with the g/f. Trip was booked through hotwire so I didn't know what I was getting but the rate for a 4.5 star hotel was very good. Unfortunately The Langham is at best a 4 star and probably closer to a 3.5 star hotel even without any issues. Prior to arriving I called the concierge to order the "rose petal turn down service" I explained to the concierge that this was a surprise for my g/f and that we would be going to dinner at 8:30 so they could come anytime after that. Upon arrival the hotel is very unimpressive at first glance. I expect a very nice foyer for a 4.5 star hotel. The foyer to the Langham looks more like a Holiday Inn. Low ceilings and nothing eye catching whatsoever. Check=in moved briskly and the front desk was very courteous and did take the time to explain where the restaurants, fitness center and other services can be found. I thought this was a very nice touch. The room itself was average for Boston. I did get one of the worst rooms available, I guess that happens when you book through a discount site. The queen bed was fairly stiff but not horrible. The room itself was furnished in an older style. The furnishings were OK but nothing special and the TV was below average for even a 4 star hotel. The room amenities were quite nice, particularly the robe and toiletries. So far I would have been satisfied if this was a 3.5-4 star hotel, but this was clearly not a 4.5 star hotel. After settling in we decided to go to Bond for a pre-dinner drink and app. WOW is the first word that comes to mind when you see this place. It is a really spectacular lounge with the huge chandeliers, low slung seating and beautiful mirror back bar. Unfortunately this luxury comes with a price and that price is steep if you want one of their signature cocktails. We did enjoy the two martini's we had but I'm not sure they were worth $14. As for the apps, they were also pricey but they were worth every penny. We shared the fried calamari with thai chili sauce and lobster pot pie. Both were simply outstanding dishes. The Calamari were quite large, cooked perfectly and accompanied by a sauce that was the perfect blend of tangy, sweet and spicy. The Lobster pot pie was equally outstanding, large chunks of lobster were combined with potatoes and chantrelle mushrooms. After our $90 pre-dinner drinks and apps we headed up to the room to get ready for dinner. At 8:00 PM we got a knock at our door, luckily I answered the door and the g/f was busy getting ready so she didn't hear me ask the hotel staffer to come back after 8:30 for the turndown service. Had she answered the door the surprise would have been blown. After a wonderful dinner we head back to the room to put our leftovers in the fridge before going back to Bond for a night cap. It was around 10PM and I was a bit surprised that the rose petal turn down hadn't happened yet. Still being V-days weekend, I assumed they were busy and would get to us eventually. After a few more martini's we head up to the room a little after midnight, sadly still no roses. Guess the surprise is now on me. Things only got worse as I tried to sleep with what sounded like a train station running underneath our hotel room. I know other people complained about the sound but I really didn't think it would bother me. Again joke's on me, it was horrible and only the booze helped me fall asleep. Checkout the next morning went smooth and they did apologize twice for missing the turn down (though on V-day weekend, forgetting roses isn't really acceptable). Outside of Bond, nothing stands out at the Langham which makes it critically important that they nail all the little details. Unfortunately, for me at least, they failed miserably. Overall this is at best a 4 star hotel, if you go there expecting something akin to the Park Plaza Hotel (in a worse location) you should be satisfied. If you go there expecting the Boston Harbor Hotel, you will be disappointed like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover816
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a long weekend vacation from The Langham. From the moment we pulled up to the valet to the moment the valet returned the car we felt like we were treated with the best service! All the staff at the hotel was very friendly and very helpful. I'm a huge chocolate lover and my boyfriend took me for a surprise to the Chocolate Bar on saturday for brunch. Anything and everything you could want with chocolate was there; from chocolate pasta, pizza, hot dogs (chocolate overed bananass), and everything in between! The service there as we expected was great, our waiter really took the time to get to know us on a personal level and that was really great. Also, the location of the hotel was perfect, we didnt take the car out of valet until we were ready to go home! Quincy Market was a convienent 6 minute walk, the aquarium was a convienent 10 minute walk, and another shopping location was only an 8 minute walk. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated. Overall the Langham was great for a relaxing weekend, we look forward to returning in the summer when we go back to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pbrien
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch from the amentities to the service. I cannot complain whatsoever, and I have to say it may have been the best treatment I've ever recieved. Our first room smelt bad, so they upgraded us to a room over looking the park with no questions asked. Everyone is very professional and courteous, and it was just a perfect place. The pool is brand new, hotel bar (Bond) is amazing, and everyone has a smile on their face. I would, and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty and clean”
Reviews.Author: Chasssky
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very pretty and clean. Our room was a good size, good enough to move around comfortably. The bed was comfortable as well and sheets felt great. Breakfast was very expensive so we did not try it. Hotel is nearby shops and easy to walk around. Concierge was very helpful in helping us find a shop and even called to make us an appointment. The staff was very good with us. One complaint, WIFI should be free.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Okay ... But It Should Be A Nicer Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 0567cg
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night over Thanksgiving weekend. This is a beautiful old property in a great Boston location. The hotel should be nicer simply because it could be. Let me say first that the hotel is clean and the rooms are adequate. I would stay here again. It bothers me when beautiful old hotels are not properly maintained. Wallpaper should not be peeling off. Tiles should not be missing. You get the idea. In my mind, this separates a great property from a merely adequate one. It also says something about the ownership and staff. It also makes an impression on people like me who spend lots of time in hotels. The front desk staff was great. They even called us 5 minutes after we reached the room to assure that it was satisfactory. A nice touch! They were also very helpful with walking directions. The room was very nice. Not the usual small closet-size room you expect in a city like Boston. I liked the fact that you could move around freely and had a comfortable place to sit. The bathroom was rather large and, to my delight, filled with extra towels and amenities. The bed was comfy and the linens were crisp and clean. That's all I ever expect. The TV was the old boxy type, but who goes to a hotel to watch TV? The window was small and the view was nothing to write home about, but again, unless you are planning to stay in the room and look out the window, who cares? The hallway noise and sounds of heavy doors slamming shut was a bit much a times. This is a regular problem in any old building. I wish they could cure it, because there's nothing worse than being jarred awake at 1:30 am by noisy hotel patrons having long conversations in doorways, following by slamming doors. The absolute worst thing was that the room was uncomfortably hot and the cooling system did nothing to help it. I wish that they would not shut the air conditioning completely off in the winter. This was an unsually warm November night, about 60 degrees, and it was over 75 in the room. Turning the cooling system on only made it worse, because no cool air was emitted. Unfortunately, things like this can ruin an otherwise satisfactory stay. It's Boston, so expect to pay dearly for parking. The valet dropped the ball on checkout. We called ahead as instructed but still had to wait outside the hotel for over 30 additional minutes for them to bring up our car. I did not appreciate that.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced,Noisy,No Respect for Do not Disturb Signs”
Reviews.Author: nhfisherman
Reviews.Content: I paid $330 for one evening.The room was very small.The room had a wet bar and an 8 ounce soda was $6.I looked at the room service menu and a burger with fries was $47.I had been disturbed all evening by loud noise coming from the adjacent rooms.I had the do not disturb sign out and was awakened by the cleaning staff at 10 am even though check out was 1pm.The room had bottled water at $9 for 20 oz.WiFi wasn't working,I called front desk to ask why,they replied,we are working on the problem.They failed to inform me of their business center.I forgot my cell phone +charger in the room.I called the hotel after I got home and was told by the hotel staff they would check and return to my address.Two weeks later I called and asked about it.They replied,we are sorry sir but we didn't find it.I was pretty disappapointed in the staff and would never even think about staying there again even if it was FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hotel with Shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: ShaunSligo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is particularly well situated and has well appointed rooms. In our experience,as world travellers,it does not provide value for money Shortcomings... 1. There is not a quiet bar area where one can have a drink and good conversation. The only bar has a nightclub ambience,with very loud music,flashing lights and apparently largely non-resident clientele. 2. Most all budget hotels,inns and B&Bs provide complimentary wi-fi. How can the Langham justify a hefty charge for this service? 3. The restaurant is over-priced relative to the food provided.

Reviews.Title: “Top Dollar Stay!”
Reviews.Author: p4ulmac
Reviews.Content: This was the first night of our honeymoon, and from the moment we arrived we felt special. Front of house was excellent, and as we had arrived early didn't expect to get checked in, but our room was ready, so our very helpful porter, Brian, gave us some pointers on "must see/do's" also some pointers on places to eat. We had a view of Post Office Square which was nice, as there is some green space there, rather than just a building across the street. Being in the financial district everything we needed was close at hand, and certainly no need to have a car here, as walking places was not a problem. I'd happily stay in this ex Federal Reserve building again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: hopefultraveller111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of a trip around New England in the fall. On arrival we were very impressed by the hotel and staff, and our room was lovely, if slightly on the small side. We had a very nice view of the Post Office Square Park. The location was OK, but after exploring the town we decided if we went back we would prefer to stay in the Beacon Hill area, as that part of town seemed to have nicer places to eat in the evening. The leisure facilities were good, and I enjoyed swimming in the little pool, which I had all to myself! However, we would not go back to this hotel due to the tremendous amount of noise coming from the functions they hold. The first two nights we were there the music was audible but finished about midnight, so didn't cause too much of a problem. However, the last night we were there is music was hyped up a few decibels, and didn't end until 2am. We had to get up at 5am to go to the airport, and so barely had any sleep. We complained to the reception staff, who were apologetic, but powerless to do anything. The Langham is clearly out to make money from these functions, but it is very sad that they do it at the expense of the paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Bedrock”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsSkippy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were coming in to Boston for a wedding and decided to splurge. We did book through Priceline. The staff were all wonderful etc. and our room was small but acceptable, on the 9th floor which,again, was fine. We met our son for dinner and came back to the room to go to bed. The bed was as hard as a rock. We did not sleep...I became so desperate that I lined up the pillows and tried it that way. I guess in hindsight I should have called to see if they had another bed option. My suggestion would be to lie in the bed first and see before going out to enjoy the city. I can't remember having been so uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: mkpatt
Reviews.Content: When my company booked me into the Langham they told me it was the best hotel in Boston - and they weren't far off the mark. The room was a bit small for my taste, but extremely comfortable. Ordered room service my first night because on a Sunday night there was nothing open. Food was very good, and arrived in no time. The bed was very comfortable and I fell asleep with no problem. Staff was very helpful in giving me directions around town and everyone there was pleasant. Although I only stayed there a couple of nights, it made my business trip a whole lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and classic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LovesGreatHotels
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Great staff with helpful concierge. Rooms are nicely appointed. Deluxe king rooms are the best; rooms with two double beds are less so.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD”
Reviews.Author: KFerg
Reviews.Content: A grand lobby, but this hotel is showing some wear and tear - renovations seem to be taking place with elevators & etc., so perhaps this is being resolved. Clean rooms, although small - they are typical for a big city like Boston. My issue with the hotel was that it was hands down the LOUDEST place I have ever stayed. Paper thin walls. Between a room two steps from the elevator, and several wedding parties that sounded to have a great time (but were coming and going until 4 am) there was no sleep to be had. I would not stay here again - it was an expensive splurge to be awake all night, and I eventually checked out at 5am to head home and get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - stay away from the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sports-bags
Reviews.Content: this was our first hotel on a tour of NE, where we stayed for 3 nights. staff were pleasant and courteous from the check in desk through to the bar, and great rooms. it was only when we had breakfast on our last day we had issues. we were seated quickly, but the server was much more interested in the table next to us of business people. my plate was taken away while I was still chewing, and they started to clear the table! fed this back but did not hear back from anyone at the hotel. 15 dollars a plate for fruit which was basically a bowl of berries. stay here, but steer clear of breakfast - go to one of the diners in the financial district

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kilkee
Reviews.Content: The Langham was a wonderful hotel. I am just back from a three night stay and it was so much nicer than I had expected. From the courteous front desk people to the housekeeping staff they couldn't have done more for us. The most outstanding person was the concierge Daniel, who never forgot our names and helped us by making reservations to suggestions for places to eat. He even printed out our boarding passes when we left. The rooms were spacious and elegantly decorated. The only negative about the room was the lack of a flat panel tv and no wifi and the wired cable modem was not free. The bathroom was great with a good shower and over sized towels. The toiletries provided were first class and even included q tips and hair scrunchies. The terry bathrobes and slippers were very luxurious touches and greatly appreciated. The location in the financial district was ideal as you can walk to Quincy Market and the harbor in about 5 minutes. I have already recommended it to a friend who is planning on visiting Boston next month and I will definitely stay there on my next trip. A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “WOW what Service”
Reviews.Author: rbb36
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to treat yourself to outstanding service which includes friendly, polite and professional people/employees I would highly recommend the Langham Hotel in Boston. This was a special birthday get away and the reason I selected this Hotel was because of a person named Kathleen who is in the reservation department...I was so impressed with her friendly personality and professionalism. The people at the Hotel went beyond the 'call of duty' by upgrading our room because of a birthday celebration and the rooms are amazing. Willie, the Concierge, was outstanding in helping us see Boston and he made excellent choices for the birthday dinners along with making sure there was a 'special treat' waiting for us each night at the restaurant. I want to thank everyone at Langham for 4 days that will be memorable to both of us and I will return...Thank you to all of the Langham Hotel Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UkLadym
Reviews.Content: This was an expensive night's stay. The room was dark and old fashioned. The bathroon was clean and plush. There were no tea making facilities- imagine!! We didn't dare venture to the breakfast room for fear of being bankrupted. Location good if you don't mind walking a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cyberbob2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Langham in Boston for two nights. It's a very nice hotel with a great location right in the centre of downtown Boston. We were on our honeymoon and got an upgrade to one of the suites, which was very nice. We received the newspaper every day and we enjoyed that a lot. The pool is nice, although it's an indoor pool and the weather would have been perfect for a swim outside. The staff at the reception is helpful but not very competent - the three staff members we had to do with didn't really know what was going on and all had different opinions on questions regarding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Leading Hotel of the World”
Reviews.Author: daOScotland
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully equipped and kept hotel in an interesting historic building. Very handy for the finance district but for other attractions too. It oozes luxury. The reception staff are fantastic; rooms are well looked after. The concierge is helpful. Rooms are spacious and well fitted. One downside; charging for computer access is a nonsense; other hotels make it freely available.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could have stayed more than one night.”
Reviews.Author: nadynep
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. The room was elegant and comfortable. The hotel has a doorman and conceirge desk and the staff was great, very helpful and accomodating. We arrived late in the morning and our room was ready as we had requested. The hotel is in a good location for sights around the aquarium and harbor. This was the best priced hotel near the downtown area and a good value. The room size and bathroom were more than adequate. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants, too pricey, but there are several pubs near the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: theshlee
Reviews.Content: Very elegant hotel. The location is great, very close to the wharf and the marketplace. Walkable to the subways easily. 'Very nice service. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My sister wants to steal the beds!”
Reviews.Author: agentile80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Langham, Boston on Friday July 31st with my parents and my sister and her husband. We were all attending a wedding of a family friend. The newlyweds stayed at the hotel as well. It could not have been more fantastic and my family had nothing but praise for the hotel. It was all the little things that impressed them. My mom loved the slippers, my dad loved the eggs benedict, and my sister and her husband were going to steal the mattress with all the bedding. They said it was the best night sleep they had gotten in awhile! We had impecable service from Juan, the doorperson, Neil and the entire Front Desk crew, to the very attentive Cafe Fleuri staff. I would like to give a special thank you to Marianna, the Guest Relations Manager, for making my family and friends feel so welcome and appreciated. The Langham, Boston has an excellent product, but it is the high quality of service that sets them apart. Their staff is welcoming, sincere, and more than accommodating. We will all definitely be back to stay! Thank you all so much!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BostonCatilina
Reviews.Content: I like the financial district location. Very close to Quincy Market, easy walk to North End for dinner. Service was very good--front desk was very friendly and helpful. Gym and pool are very nice. Rooms are pretty comfortable. Air conditioning worked well. Furnishings were a bit old, no flat panel tv, etc. but had a nice reasonably luxurious overall feel. Bathroom was small but the shower was good. I will probably plan to stay here again on next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: lorischwab
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, very clean room, and hospitable staff. I can't say it was remarkable like other 5-star hotels I've stayed at (e.g., Ritz Carlton or Mandarin Oriental) but it was a very nice stay overall. The location is ideal if you're visiting the harbor attractions (e.g., New England Aquarium, harbor cruises) because the harbor is a few blocks away -- or a 5-minute walk. They did have a special guest registration for children that was nice and it included stairs for younger children to reach the front desk, lollipops, and a registration card they laminate and provide at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cardifftravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights when we arrived in Boston. The first room we were put in was a little bit dark, there was no problem and they moved us into a lovely sunny room overlooking the park. The pool and changing rooms were excellent, lovely robes, loads of towels and moulton brown toiletries. We had also booked to stay for our last night. When we arrived back at the hotel we were welcomed back and they put us in the same room "as we had liked that room". The staff were all very friendly and most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kmp9787
Reviews.Content: Had to write this review regarding the Langham. Stayed over July 4th weekend. Everything was PERFECT! check in, food, staff, pool. I have never had such a nice time at any hotel I've ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay at The Langham”
Reviews.Author: TripMeNow24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 13 year old daughter stayed at The Langham for 3 nights. Had it not been for TravelZoo, where we learned of The Langham through a travel special, we likely would not have heard of or considered the hotel for our stay in Boston, but are glad we did! We cannot say enough about the concierge staff at The Langham. Hands down, they were the most helpful and friendly concierge I have ever encountered at any hotel. In my opinion, this can make or break your stay when you are in a larger city. From providing maps, literature and directions, to recommending restaurants and making reservations for us, they were willing to go above and beyond for their guests. The rooms are well appointed, the beds very comfortable, and our bathroom was spic and span! We had a nice view overlooking a park on the ninth floor. Turn down service is also provided, which is very nice after a long day. Some people have posted that they feel the Financial District is not the place to be when staying in Boston for pleasure; however, we did not feel that way at all. We arrived on a Thursday and stayed through the weekend. The places we wanted to go were easily within walking distance or by catching the subway or a ferry. We never used a taxi except to get to the airport. We ate at Cafe Fleuri once Sunday morning and had the breakfast buffet which was good. We were not able to do the famous Saturday Chocolate Bar at the hotel as we were too busy seeing the sites. We toured the spa and pool/fitness area which were both very inviting, but we did not have time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: EDNP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in May. I got this hotel through Hotwire so didn't know which hotel it was until I booked it. I was very pleased with this hotel. They gave us a complimentary upgrade to a room with a king bed (from a queen bed) per our request. The staff was helpful. The room was spacious and clean. The decor was beautiful. The bed was really comfortable (and I'm picky about this). They had bathrobes and slippers in the room and turn down service. The water pressure was not very good. There were definitely no views from our room but we expect that. It's in a downtown area with views of other buildings. We did not utilize their pool, spa or restaurant so I can't comment on those. It's a great location if you plan on spending time in the financial district in Boston. It's also good for sightseeing because it's close to the train. It was very quiet on the weekend which is great when you want to sleep in. It's also very close to Faneuil Hall and the North End, 5-10 minute walk. We had dinner at Tresca in the North End and it was delicious. South Station and the Aquarium are also within walking distance. They have valet parking with in/out privileges so it's easy to use your car when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel Luxury Prices”
Reviews.Author: Dagdabear
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Langham after flying into Boston from London for a holiday in New England. the hotel itself is a most impressive building and certainly lives up to it's description as one of the architectural and well decorated hotels in Boston. The idea we had was to have a one night treat in a top of the range hotel before starting our holiday, and in general the Langham lived up to expectations. We had no fault with the room if a little small. The service from all staff was excellent, and the buffet breakfast was about the best we had during our two week stay in the area. On the downside there were two things against it. Everything was just a little too expensive. It was nice to have a mini bar in the room but the prices were too much even for us to touch as a treat. Breakfast as said was great but at 20 dollars plus each it needed to be. the other aspect that let the hotel down was location, being near the financial district we found few places open near the hotel for dinner. Many had shut and the whole area was very quiet apart from one Irish pub nearby. what places were open were either full or had reservations which prevented us being seated. In retrospect for once the hotel restaurant would have been the best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson1
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel, nothing really stood out as spectacular. It was decorated nicely, the staff was very curteous...but if your staying in Boston I think that there is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, ok service for four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripreviewer4
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay with hotwire.com, so the hotel name was a surprise until the end of the booking. Upon looking up pictures of the hotel online, I was not too excited about staying here because it looked too fancy, which is not my style at all. The furniture looked old and uncomfortable. When we got there, it was very easy to find, pretty much a straight shot from the downtown crossing subway station (also a quick and easy walk from South Station). Check in was quick and easy. Our room was available early which was great because we didn't want to drag our luggage around Boston with us (although we were told if it was not ready that we could store our luggage there until the room was ready) Valet parking was also very easy. $28 per day (although the next day it took us about 30 minutes to get our car) I suggest calling ahead of time and asking them to bring your car around. Our room was small but nice. On the third floor, it was only a few doors down from the spa and the health club. I expected it to be very noisy because of its location near the pool and spa, however we were pleasantly surprised. The room was nice but small. We had a king size bed which fit three of us nicely. Also very comfortable! They did not have a flat screen tv which suprised me. The key to the minibar didnt work. The one very bad thing about this hotel was it seemed like there was only ONE elevator working our whole stay there. There was a sign saying "pardon our appearence while we improve our elevators' I would have expected it to be more along the lines of pardon the wait while we improve our elevators. We had to wait for anywhere between 3-10 minutes for the elevator and half the time it stopped at our floor, it was already filled with people so we couldn't even get in it. The thing we thought was best about this hotel was the location. You could walk for 5 minutes and be at the harbor, Faniuel Hall, or the Down Town shopping areas. Also tons of restaurants and bars were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy luxury”
Reviews.Author: Suzy52
Reviews.Content: I was back in Boston for my last day in America, after visiting Cape Cod and had not booked any accomodation. I rang up all the hotels that was recommended by my guidebook but everything was full! My last choice was the place I was ringing from - The Langham. I knew it was expensive, more than $350 a night but I wanted to have a good night's rest before my flight back to London. So I checked in, the receptionist gave me a suite for the same price as a double room, and when I saw it, I was really chuffed! It is massive! It's 3-4 times larger than my flat and garden and the suite felt like my own home in Boston! They seem to have provided everything I would need for a stay - iron, bathrobe, comfortable bed. The suite was clean, well maintained and quietly luxiourious. The only thing was that it didn't provide bedfast for this price so I went to a cafe nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Refined elegance and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kazsam
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Boston at the beginning of May. Fantastic room with high ceiling, ultra comfy bed and completely sound proof, I had the best sleeps there in a long time. The service was excellent, staff could not do enough for us despite hotel being busy and the swimming pool area was lovely. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sully17
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Boston in the last 3 years (the previous stay being at the Boston Harbor Hotel). Our criteria was a hotel with fairly upscale accommodations with an indoor swimming pool and proximity to locations such as the Aquarium, Fanueil Hall and the North end. The Langham fit the bill nicely. Valet parking and check-in were smooth, and the room was clean and fairly luxurious with bathrobes and large, heavy towels. Another nice touch was the stuffed lobster animals the staff brought to our two young daughters! The indoor pool, spa and fitness center area looks to be recently updated with an asian flair. On the three occasions we used the pool and hot tub, we essentially had the place to ourselves, which was a pleasant surprise. The lap pool is decent sized, although it has a constant 4 ft. depth so little ones can't stand up. The only real turn-off for us was the excessive price of the room service menu. Everyone knows that room service is expensive and not a good value overall, but we traditionally get room service on our first night on vacation. However, in this case we felt it would be out of whack even for the most luxurious of hotels. The Sunday breakfast buffet, on the other hand, was outstanding. They provide an assortment of eggs, ham, sausage, french toast, oatmeal, fresh fruits and yogurts that should satisfy anyone who likes breakfast. All in all, this is a solid hotel, and we would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Langham in Boston...”
Reviews.Author: unhgrad01
Reviews.Content: I loved my Langham Hotel stay in Boston. It is located in a great spot right outside Fanuel Hall and Downtown Crossing yet tucked away just enough so that heavy foot traffic was at a minimum. The bedroom was very cozy with a nice comfortable king sized bed. The heated pool was a plus and the Sunday brunch was to die for, especially the chocolate bar. I would recommend a night stay in this hotel to anyone looking for a great night(s) at a relatively decnt cost compared to other hotels in and around Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steven54
Reviews.Content: The Langham Boston is just right!! Personal yet Luxurious, a great new pool/spa with a hot tub and sauna in a very neat setting. The rooms are very comfortable, the people are friendly and the location is central-you are near everything. We couldn't have picked a better spot at a better price-you will love the Langham!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luxurious Langham”
Reviews.Author: KLR1010
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I have reciently returned to Annapolis, MD from our chilly 3 day trip to Boston, MA. We stayed at the luxurious Langham convienently located on Franklin street in close walking distance to everything! (shops, restaurants, the T) Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very nice bell boy who helped us with our luggage while he called another gentleman to vallet our vehicle. My fiance owns a rather large truck so unfortunately they were unable to park it in the hotel garage (clearance purposes). Although they were unable to park the truck in the garage they offered us one FREE night parking in the rear of the hotel. We took them up on the offer and got a free nights worth of parking...the next day we moved the truck across the street in the garage under the park. We stayed on the 8th floor in a suite overlooking many of the fabulous architecture Boston has to offer. Everytime I visit Boston (around two times a year-for the past 3 years) I have found myself coming back to The Langham. One of the main reasons is...the sheets are to die for! They also have complementary robes and slippers for your use during your stay which makes you feel like a million bucks! Their new restaurant/lounge BOND that just opened is the place to be! I was lucky enough to get into BOND and take a stroll around to check it all out. Overall, the stay was great and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to feel like they are living in luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Good city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: SE1
Reviews.Content: Large city centre hotel in covnerted bank building. Very friendly and efficient service in all areas. My room a little small and very hot- it didn't seem to be possible to turn off heating and hotel's efforts to do so didn't work. Plush bar, where barman made my day by (almost) not letting me in as I couldn't prove I was over 21 (I am 46) Good breakfast. Ideal centre for a city trip- recommended

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: stav1966
Reviews.Content: Customers are definitely at the centre of thinking at the Langham. All staf without exception were friendly, helpful, and went out of their way to give assistance in all matters of our stay. Hotel clean, very comfortable. Restaurant might be a bit pricey for some but highly recommended is the chocolate speciality that appears to be a hallmark. Less than 10 minutes walk from bus, metro and shops. A tip is a fantastic food hall 7 minutes walk away with massive choice and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ISA51
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a four day stay at the Langham. The staff was lovely - doormen even remembered our name. The spa was great - brand new and the pool and hot tub were great. We had a corner room, 801 with two double beds and a couch as well - very large room with a nice view of the park. Only would change the restaurante as was a bit pricey for the food quality but overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in October. The hotel was fantastic, our room was a superior and it had a brilliant view of the park opposite. The spa and the swimming pool are fabulous. The swimming pool has a glass roof ,so if you go early in the morning or late at night you can see the starry sky. The service we received at this hotel was definitely 5 star, we were treated like 'v.i.p.s' from the moment we entered the hotel, the staff couldn't do enough. The concierge is great, he most deifinitely knows his stuff, especially where to sample the most delicous food. If you stay here you have to experience the chocolate bar, it is out of this world. The location of the hotel is really ideal, five minutes from Quincy Market/Boston Harbour and with it being in the Financial district it is nice and quiet at night. The hotel surpassed all my expectations, we will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: iggie394
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal through Hotwire, so needless to say, I was thrilled to stay here for $155 a night. The hotel was lovely, though I did not check out the restaurant or any of the facilities. My room was very small but nice. The bellman was very friendly and helpful. The location was convenient for me, as it was a short walk to Downtown Crossing for my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: legend2x
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and previous stays were great. That is the reason why we came back again. However, we were disappointed this time. We reserved 'Superior Room' in previous stays and this time as well. However, the room turned out to be different from the past. It is a King Sized Bed in a 'Classic Room', about 270 ft'. We then questioned the front desk. He replied that 'this room is categorized as one of the "superior rooms". He was sorry but nothing can be done. We paid more for the 'Superior Room', but got the same space of "Classic Room". Another issue was with the house-keeping. Around 11AM in the morning, I left the room and saw the house-keeping cleanning next door. We had the 'Do Not Disturb' sign while my wife was still in the room. Not long after I left the room, my wife heard someone knocking on the door lightly. She ignored it since the sign was up. Next thing you know, the house-keeping came in. My wife was very upset because she was still in the bathroom getting ready. The house-keeping lady apologized and said she did not see the sign, then left. To us, that's unacceptable. It's their daily job. How can they not see the big pink sign on the door knob?? Later, we reported to the front desk. There are many hotels in the same area for the same cost. We feel that we overpaid and had no privacy. We will no longer stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Langham is Lovely”
Reviews.Author: tropicalfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early November in a deluxe king room. The hotel is centrally located between Faneuil Hall and Downtown Crossing, easy walking distance to the North End and Boston Common. The room was spacious, with comfy bed and luxurious appointments. The bathroom was excellent, with big, fluffy towels and bathrobes, slippers and nice toiletries. We tried to get spa reservations but they were booked- if you are interested I would make appointments in advance. Staff were friendly and helpful, and the common spaces of the hotel were beautifully decorated and well maintained. This is an excellent choice to stay for sightseeing in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Elpis
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed myself here. We were upgraded to a duplex suite because of the building works opposite, which was pretty magnificent. I recommend the Sunday brunch at Cafe Fleuri as much for its entertainment value - the themed food stands and chefs - as for the food itself, but it calls for a big appetite. The check-out clerk was a little surly and the standard breakfast somewhat minimal (in an effort to persuade you to order a la carte, I assume), but the hotel is very pleasantly Bostonian. Fabulous pool. The jacuzzi was out of order during my visit.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely building”
Reviews.Author: julieturner
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Trailfinders we are a family of 4 with 2 teenagers. My sons enjoyed the pool but were frowned upon by people just sat by the pool ( i could understand it if they were messing about but they were in apool swimming and racing one another). However the hotel itself is nice and the room was quiet too and comfortable. It was interesting to read that one reviewer found their ipod missing as we had put 2 mobile phones on charge on the desk in the room, when my son came to use his he found it wasnt there. (his earphones were there of which he kept them together) we pointed this out to security but nothing was found . Perhaps if someone from the hotel happens to read this they could investigate if other items are going 'astray' . I must admit i did prefer the Hilton at Back Bay

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimw
Reviews.Content: Had actually prepaid for a room at a nearby hotel and when I got in late they told me they were completely sold out and had moved me to the Langham Hotel. The Langham actually seemed nicer than the hotel I was supposed to stay at. The entire staff that I encountered there was all very polite and helpful. In addition, they kept apologizing for the inconvienence when it was not even them that had moved me. The valet parking is a little expensive $42, but lucikly the 1st hotel had compensated me for that. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location was good, many sites Boston Commons, Fanieul Hall and others were within 10 minute walk. i would definitely stay there again or recommend to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: phillywe
Reviews.Content: Comfortable well furnished rooms and one of the quietest hotel rooms I have stayed in. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful as were the bar and restaurant staff. The two front door men were exceptional, always happy and helpful even in the dreadful weather Boston experienced during the whole 4 days. A well run hotel with pleasant helpful staff, a lot of whom have worked at the hotel for many years - always the sign of a good hotel. Boston is not one of my favourite city's but the Langham made it enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Langham!”
Reviews.Author: lovefromca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham in Boston and it was great! The staff was friendly and very helpful (especially the concierge!) and their new spa was so relaxing! The hotel used to be the old Federal Reserve Bank building so it was pretty cool to be staying in such a historical hotel. I definitely recommend their chocolate bar on Saturdays, definitely worth the calories!!!

Reviews.Title: “it's okay”
Reviews.Author: 79Rome
Reviews.Content: good Hotel, too overpriced though. Room was nice (I got a suite due to an overbooking problem) , staff was nice but too bad they don't have wi fi connection in the rooms. Location is good, close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dotMayo_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stay In the Langham for 4 nights in July, it was super. We were checked in easily and our room was really clean and tidy. We did, however,eat breakfast in the hotel one morning and it cost us $70!!! It was rather expensive for what we recieved. There was a turn down service every night and chocolate were left our our pillows. There is a gym and pool, although the pool was very cold, the gym was lovely. The concierge is extremely helpful. The Langham is an ideal place to stay as it is close to all the local shops, bars etc but it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tio-man
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay in this great hotel. Location : in financial district, only a 2min walk away from the historical centre. Quiet neighbourhood. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Room was large, luxurious and very clean. Breakfast very good but also very expensive in my opinion. I appreciated the very nice pool and Jacuzzi. Last but not least : the hotel has a distinctive personal touch and ambiance, something that most 5*-hotelchains completely lack.

Reviews.Title: “Good except for Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Holleeds
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three night stay in Boston. The hotel is very good and, whilst I appreciate its position in the financial district means it is rather quiet, it is so easy to walk to everywhere. The room was lovely. Our first morning was a Sunday and the buffet breakfast was good albeit with a limited choice. However, after that the breakfast was al a carte - very unusual in a hotel nowadays. It was still good food but it does make it slow, so if you are in hurry, I'd recommend going somewhere else. We would have had nothing but praise if it hadn't been for the Reception staff. When we checked in we were politely, but disinterestedly, greeted. On leaving we pointed out that we had not been charged for the first breakfast. The clerk said he couldn't add it on 'now ' - as if it had been our fault, and then told us we'd 'got away with it'. I wish I could say he was joking about it but he wasn't. After that,he didn't even bother to say goodbye let alone 'Have a nice day'. That said, the Vietnamese porter was lovely and the Restaurant staff were very pleasant. Overall Boston is a lovely city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on the Langham!”
Reviews.Author: poohneller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Boston to celebrate my fortieth birthday. We stayed at the Langham for two of our five nights (the other three were at the Intercontinental). I booked the room through Hotwire for $154 per night - a SUPER deal for this wonderful hotel. I did research several hotels for this trip and chose the two listed because my husband and I have very different tastes. I like the smaller, more personal, "classic" hotels while he likes the larger, more contemporary . My favorite of the two was the Langham, especially with the deal we got. Our room was by the elevator, but we did not hear any noise at all. The room was a bit smaller than our room at the Intercontinental, but it was nice. The towels are amazing (HUGE and plush), and the toiletries were great. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was good, although a bit pricey. The concierge was helpful in giving us three good restaurant choices nearby, and we took his advice and enjoyed our meal. The doorman hailed us a cab since it was raining. We had a GREAT experience and would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not such a great experience”
Reviews.Author: bvilla
Reviews.Content: My husband I went here for a special evening out on the town. Upon arrival we were told we had a beautiful corner room overlooking the park. The room was quite nice and it was in fact facing the park. However, in the morning I noticed some little worm type bugs crawling around the bathroom floor, many of them disappeared under the door onto the carpet outside of the door - this just grossed me out so we checked out early. We left our car with the valet the evening before and when we got our car in the morning, we found that our ipod had disappeared from the vehicle. Overall the staff was not very helpful and/or with the room situation. I honestly can say that I will not stay at this hotel in the city again. There are many we will choose first like The Liberty, InterContinental, etc. The Langham is in a great location to walk to the Faneuil Hall and the Waterfront. I also found the lobby furniture to be in pretty rough shape, it really could use a new look.

Reviews.Title: “Not for travellers!”
Reviews.Author: Ivana_8
Reviews.Content: The website told that the hotel was perfectly located in "downtown Boston", instead I found out that it was in the heart of the financial district, only surrounded by high buildings filled with offices and banks, in a nest of small roads and very difficoult to find each time I walked back to it. Aside from that, the Hotel itself was filled with buisnessmen, so at the CafÃ¨ Fleuri,the refined restaurant, it turned out to be that I was infact seated at the worse table, not being rated as an A costumer, wearing my shorts and sandals, instead of executive dresses. Also the reception was rather uptight and seemed not easy with the fact that I was travelling alone. It all seemed very unconfortable to me, considering that from the website this Hotel seemed to be the perfect place to stay as a tourist for a pleasant visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars with an attitude problem”
Reviews.Author: incrediblepie
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in this place during 4th of July weekend and could not wait to get away. In a world where hotels are all beginning to look the same the end difference is the service and how one is treated. This is where the Langham fails miserably. Lets get the good out of the way first...clean rooms, nice room styling, well equipped gym and pool (small) and in middle of financial district. On the negative side...room was tiny, minbar was v v overpriced even for a four star hotel. But the cherry on the cake must be the staff. I was met a the door by a rude and abrupt consierge who ordered me to "hurry up" when I checked in case I left my car too long in front of hotel. Same gentleman decided not to hold the door open when we dragged our luggage through the hotel to reception. We decided to ask at the consierge desk for advice on where we could find a restaurant...sum total of their help was a map and "we are here" pointed at the map. Thanks. Floor staff were more like accusing bouncers looking for a reason to have a power trip rather than helpful courteous staff. With an early flight I rang down to reception for a taxi only to be told abruptly that there was a taxi rank outside the hotel and I "should be able to call it myself". Thanks again. Whole hotel needs a crash course in common courtesy. If a hotel claims to be 4 star it needs to act like it all over. No point in promoting an old world hotel charm (which they clearly dont have ) having arrogant bully boy staff on the floor incapable of smiling or being courteous unless you slip them a $5 tip!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, but getting tired”
Reviews.Author: The_Deacons
Reviews.Content: For such a great city, I'm surprised that Boston doesn't have any world beating hotels. However, it does have a couple of very good hotels and the Langham is one of them. It's in a great location for both business and pleasure, with all of the key attractions within walking distance. The staff are good (particularly the concierge), but the hotel itself is starting to tire a little. The rooms need a spruce up and the bathrooms are ready for replacement. Surprisingly, for a hotel that is primarily positioned for the corporate market, the "business centre" is housed in the gift shop and has only one pc. They're not automatically geared up for kids, but they did step up to the plate. Worth staying here for a good experience, but don't expect greatness.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: biztravelerChicago
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally comfortable bed with perfect down pillows and crisp, ironed sheets. The rooms are not particularly spacious but adequate. Excellent room service -- expensive but very good food and a wonderful waiter. The cooling system was awful -- the temperature is preset to 78 degrees and you have to have building engineering come around to rout around in the ceiling before you can use the in-room thermostat. The temp did cool down after several hours, but it was nonetheless annoying since the outside temp was a comfortable 68 degrees but the windows don't open. Construction across the street featured an outdoor generator that roared until 11 p.m. each night, making sleep impossible, but that was beyond the hotel's control. Ask for a room away from construction, though. Concierge service was good, but the morning fellow needs a reality check about who's wearing the borrowed blazer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: txrelaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in a standard room and had a very nice experience. The hotel is smaller than most and is nicely decorated, and the rooms are beautiful and cozy. I thought the bed was the most comfortable I've slept in in ages, and the robes and slippers are a nice touch. The Sunday brunch/chocolate bar is absolutely amazing - there are entire tables full of different chocolate dishes. Faneuil Hall is within easy walking distance so you can go shopping and site seeing anytime. The only downside about all of this is the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: The Langham was a nice hotel. It's really close to the airport (expected a pricey cab ride) but its in a good location too. I was there for business so didn't get to see the neighbourhood much but things seemed within walking distance (with respect to the business district, at least). The room was a good size. The decor and furnishings seemed good too. I ordered room service (pizza) and I thought it was good (albeit a bit soggy). The clam chowder in the hotel bar was good as was lunch in the hotel restaurant. The staff was very helpful with packages we had delivered to the hotel as well as suggesting dining suggestions to grab a bite and watch the hockey game. There's a few pubs within a few blocks of the hotel to relax and those wishing to eat a casual meal outside of the hotel. Overall, a very nice hotel with courteous staff. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than you can expect”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Sweden
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotell for anyone who wants quality. Me and my grilfriend stayed there for one night and it was perfect. We payed 250$ and it was priceless. The room was najs and in every detail perfect. From the hair saloon hairdryer to the coffee machine. A tip is that the hotell has complimentary shoeshining. Just put your shoes in a shoe bag on your door and they will be deliverd before 6 AM on your door!! The pool area was closed but from the photos you could learn that it would definatley be worth a visit just for the new area. So go there while if you can find a good price!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room but thats it.”
Reviews.Author: Tilly&Kyle
Reviews.Content: Let me say this upfront: we got a room there for about a quarter of the normal price on Hotwire.com. For that price it was a perfect bargain. If you are going to pay the going rate for this hotel I would go else where. Your money will get you a clean room (a little bit small but hey it is Boston) and polite staff and that is it. Just about everything else costs extra. For a premium quality hotel I was surprised that they didn't offer free internet access, had a limited cable offering, and the prices for breakfast in your room were ridiculous ($23 for toast and juice? you're kidding me right?). You'd think for the rate of a premium hotel they might have have at least upgraded the soaps or something. If you want to stay in Boston and are looking to splurge on a stay look for another premium brand, the Langham wasn't any better than any of the higher end chains that cater to the business traveler (minus the amenities).

Reviews.Title: “Service Wonderful/ Pricey”
Reviews.Author: shawnandlala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight and we were very pleased. The hotel is beautiful and the service is wonderful. We were so impressed by the nightly turn down service we left an extra tip for that specific maid. I expected the bed to be turned down from other reviews but what i did not expect was our clothes to be picked up and folded, my curling iron to be wrapped up and robes and slippers put out. They just went above and beyond, it was very nice. I do think some things there are a overpriced $14 Martini's (although there are 100 to choose from and very good) the dining room menu's are very overpriced especially for breakfast/room service, two eggs and juice were outrageslouly priced at around $29. Overall the rooms are clean and beds are extremely comfortable. Would highly recommend.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown with very nice rooms and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: lip89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a girlfriend during the summer and really liked this hotel. It sits directly in downtown Boston's financial district and if you catch this area on a weekend it is a ghost town. It is close to all the hot spots of Boston including blocks away from famous Quincy Market, the waterfront and the Boston Common. All within walking distance. The interior is very nice with upscale lobby and very nice restaurants. One of these restaurants has a Saturday afternoon chocolate bar and for thirty five dollars you can eat all sort of chocolate samples. The staff is nice although seemed a bit snobby for my taste. The check in process was painless, but in asking for help they acted disturbed. The rooms were very nice with a nice bathroom and very spacious. Seeing that this place is close by to everything, I would highly recommend it. Bring your wallet though, it is not the cheapest place in the city to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEfamilyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Langham for a meeting. A conveniently located hotel, very well kept, nice staff. Room clean and QUIET! Helpful staff. Easy walk to AMTRAK which is nice. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Maureen76
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from 10 - 13th January 2008. What a lovely hotel. We arrived late on Thursday night. Check-In was swift and efficient. We were on the 8th Floor in a Double Superior Room. After we settled into our lovely room we went to the cocktail bar for drinks and something to eat. It was lovely. We returned on 2 other occasions. We were served by Nancy - a lovely lady who has been working in this hotel for 20+ years. Her knowledge of the history of the hotel and interest in her job was outstanding and it is people like Nancy that make this hotel a very personal experience. We had breakfast in the restaurant on 2 mornings. It is in a quiet location but within walking distance of most attractions. If you are staying in the hotel on a Sunday make sure to book your table for the Sunday Jazz Brunch. It is amazing - Oh My God - what a selection of top class food. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: TomMQuinn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times for business. My office is a short walk away so the location is very convenient. The rooms are very nice - a tad small but clean and well-appointed. Room service menu is very good, as are the restaurants and the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbelldee
Reviews.Content: We loved the Langham. We had corresponded with the Dan at the Concierge desk for several weeks before our stay and he was wonderful. The staff was amazing, never missing an opportunity to make sure that we were perfectly satisfied with our stay. The room was a little on the small side but no detail was missed. The turn down service was very nice. Late night room service was not only quick but very good. The best part of our stay was the ability to just block out everything for a restful nights sleep. The drapes blocked out all light and the walls must be made of lead because we never heard a peep from the hallway or the rooms next to us. We loved the Langham and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pmmom
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night for my birthday. We paid for the next cheapest room, but got upgraded to a junior suite, when my husband told them it was my birthday. The suite was wonderful. The bed was so comfortable. There were free slippers and other feebies. The room was very clean and very nice. The staff was very nice. Breakfast was included with our package and that was yummy. I can't really say anything bad. It was a wonderful stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4 - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: UKJosie
Reviews.Content: A family of 4 from the UK with children aged 12 and 13 staying for the weekend... This was booked as a deal with Trailfinders in October using BA flights. We arrived late on the Friday night and check in was very easy. We had requested interconnecting rooms when we booked and this was arranged for us with no problems. The rooms on the 5th flloor were great - one double room and one room with 2 queen size beds. Spacious and well equipped with everything you could want. At the weekend there is a buffet breakfast which we had. The staff were fantastic - very friendly and welcoming especially as our 13 year old was classed as a 12 year for the sake of the bill. Plenty of choice and never ending coffee (the tea is just average). We booked in for the Jazz Brunch on the Sunday which was delicious. Huge amounts of food and so much choice, we didn't eat for the rest of the day. The swimming pool is currently undergoing a refit so we couldn't take a swim but that didn't really matter to us. The hotel is in a good location and we could walk everywhere. We did take a taxi from the airport and back again and that only took about 15 mins.. We found all the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful and ready to stop for a chat. The hotel seemed to be quite empty at the weekend but on the Monday it had soon filled up with business customers. To conclude - a great hotel in an historic building, all the staff were welcoming and friendly, a good location and we would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: silverthief2
Reviews.Content: I visited the Langham with my bf for one night on November 14-15, for a job offer trip. The location was perfect, right down the street from One Int'l Place, where he had his meetings. The room was on the second floor and was comfortable, though nothing over the top. The bellhops were kind of hit-or-miss. They graciously helped me figure out which cabs accepted the vouchers I had, however, when we arrived one of them pulled a backpack out of the trunk of our cab and placed it on the (wet) sidewalk. I wasn't too happy about that. Similarly, the concierge staff were great when I checked in a bag, but took a long time for no apparent reason to retrieve it when I returned. I'd probably stay here again if I needed to be in this area of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “the best experience”
Reviews.Author: omarita
Reviews.Content: i had the pleasure of staying in the langham hotel on the long weekend of thanksgiving 2007. as the relative i was planning to visit died a few weeks before, it could have been a sad occurrence. instead i had the best experience i could have wished for. to start with, i was out of the airport in about 15 minutes. never happened before! immediately a friendly taxi. at the langham in about 15 minutes. no traffic. great. at the desk some very competent and pleasant gentlemen, among which especially anton and salim stood out. my room, 711, an upgrade via trailfinders uk, a delight. very clean (i'm dutch - so very important!), great lookout through the window wall at those unimaginable skyscrapers (again, not to be seen in the netherlands), great bed and nice sitting area. fridaynight my relative's daughter and i had a tasty and quiet dinner in the excellent restaurant. saturday-and sundaymorning, by that time hungry again, i enjoyed the lovely breakfastbuffet from 7.00 am especially the fresh fruit section, the eggs benedict without ham, as requested, and the double espresso's warmed me up for the day. shopping at macy's and tj maxx and border's was five minutes away and an (inexpensive) joy. sundaynight a few young friends and i had the best chinese food in the specially recommended peach farm restaurant in chinatown, another five minutes from the hotel. then the concierge section: i have never before experienced such professional, all-out and personal assistence before. mr. william and his competent staff helped me with all my requests. and there were quite a few, from sending tlc packages to a pregnant daughter in arizona to obtaining a special schnapps liquer, bank privileges and grocery-and drugstore sprees. even storing my purchases in a special freezer for safe keeping. i am quite an experienced traveler. in europe as well as in the us, where i lived for over 20 years. i want to recommend the langham hotel and its excellent staff to everyone with a wish to be pampered and taken care of indiscriminately. sincerely, rita serphos, leiden, the netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Poodles65
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for 4 days. Room was very nice, comfortable bed but not as good as the Westin Heavenly bed. Turn-down service with a robe and slippers which was a nice touch. Stayed on the higher floors with the slanted windows which was unique. Nice sitting area by the windows. This is an older but very well kept hotel. You are treated like a special guest and there is plenty of staff around. Concierge was very helpful - pretty much knew everything. Location is closer to the historical sites, but far from great shopping, although Washington street isn't far where you would find DSW and Filene's basement. Also, since this is the financial district, everything closes down after 6:00pm. Was stuck looking for a drug store, although there were 5 in our area, all were closed. Ate in the restaurant once for breakfast - this is where the service lacked. Only one waitress for about 10 tables. The other staff were too busy getting the brunch service ready. This was our only disappointment, otherwise a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, pricey”
Reviews.Author: Migizi
Reviews.Content: This was a 2 night weekend stay to see the heart of Boston. Hotels downtown in Boston are never cheap, and we actually went the Hotwire route in this case. The rates for this property are typically high, like $300 a night at the standard room level. Review... GOOD: --Great location, walking distance to a lot of the good stuff to see --Nice property, classy and elegant all around --Rooms are very nice, comfortable and well-appointed --Service is excellent --Sunday brunch was among the best I've had BAD: --Pricey, unless you get lucky --Rooms are a bit small --Sunday brunch was also far and away the most expensive I've had Overall, I'd say if the rate is within your budget, and particularly if you can get a good deal, this is a fantastic hotel to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Langham”
Reviews.Author: Meem1
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in the lovely Langham for one Saturday night. The hotel and rooms were comfortable, beautiful, quiet and clean. The hotel was easy to find with a reasonably priced public parking garage around the corner. The doormen and car valets were very helpful with directions and assistance. Check in and check out were both pleasant and easy. The head of housekeeping was especially helpful and took care of a problem immediately.We had very little contact with other hotel staff. Hotel is tailored to business travelers and is located in the financial district. It was an easy walk to the Quincy Market and parts of the Freedom Trail. The restaurant was nothing special the night we were there. However, we missed the Saturday Chocolate event and Sunday Buffet. Maybe next time. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located - superior service”
Reviews.Author: Davehere
Reviews.Content: Looking for something not too pricey in EXPENSIVE Boston for a quick weekend. $300/nite for the 3 of us in 2 beds seemed the best we could do in the centre of town. Room turned out to be very nice, well appointed and with plenty of space. Staff very pleasant every time we needed something from them. Only problems, very small, no complimentary mouthwash when requested and drinks in charming bar were outrageously overpriced - but the bar area was striking so we didn't feel too ripped-off in the end. Had seen other reviews not so favorable - don't know where they're coming from. Our hotel experiences generally in Europe and this compares very favorably although more expensive (as are all US properties.)

Reviews.Title: “The brunch has to be seen to be believed”
Reviews.Author: gillianholt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 wonderful weekends at the Langham. The rooms were large and very clean. The king size beds amongst the most comfortable we have slept in. Room service was fast , delicious, how do you serve wood grilled lobster without overcooking it? The concierge has recently won the award for the best concierge in Boston and all of the staff went out of their way to make us feel very welcome. We will definitely be back to the Langham

Reviews.Title: “Terribly rude service!!”
Reviews.Author: London_Lady79
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this hotel, the first time a few months ago there was a very rude lady on reception and when I checked in there she was again - just as rude and patronising! Not a very nice welcome! The bar man (Steve) was also extremely rude and the service was the worst I have ever experienced in any bar and/or hotel anywhere in the world. I will not stay here a third time and will definitely book the Intercontinental which is where we spent most of our time as we had been told by the Langham concierge to go there as they had stopped serving dinner and drinks in the evening! The Intercontinental was a dream - I even tried to change hotels but they had no space!

Reviews.Title: “Good Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: Visited the Langham Boston on a business trip the night of September 18. This was my third stay at this property and I enjoyed my stay each time. Check in/out was a breeze and my room and bathroom were impeccably clean. Great location for business travelers. I'll most certainly stay here on my next trip to Boston. My only suggestion is that it's time to move out the $199 Wal-Mart television and move in the flat panel. The Langham isn't cheap, the TV shouldn't be either.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected..”
Reviews.Author: melissaidan
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Langham at the end of a wonderful fortnight exploring North and South of Boston (from Gloucester to Cape Cod). We decided that we would treat ourselves to one of the better hotels in the City, to mark the end of our trip and our daughters' school holidays. We picked the Langham, based mainly on the reviews we found on Tripadvisor, but have to say that it did not live up to our expectations. Maybe these were too high, but we have stayed in a wide range of different rented accommodation, at a range of prices, and believe we have a fairly accurate idea of what to expect for our money. The hotel was relatively expensive but our room - a double double - felt cramped and would not have been somewhere we would have wanted to stay for more than the 2 nights we spent there. Cleaniness was good, and the swimming pool more than adequate for a quick splash around after a busy day sight-seeing. As we stayed over Labor Weekend, many of the coffee shops and delis around the hotel were closed so we ate breakfast in the Cafe Fleuri - very expensive for what was, although extensive, a not very appetising selection of cooked food. The waiting staff were polite and friendly, but needed to be asked for refills of coffee more than once. Indeed, pretty much all the staff we met were helpful and accommodating - apart from the rather rude gentleman who checked us in. Having arrived at the hotel before the 3pm check-in time, we were advised by the person at Reception that our room would be ready within the half-hour. Rather than have house-keeping rush to get things done, we said that we would leave our luggage with the Concierge and spend a few hours getting lunch, walking around the harbour etc. We returned more than 3 hours later - and after 3pm - to be told our room wasn't ready and it would be about half an hour before we could get in. When we explained the position and asked whether there was another room we could have, the receptionist relucantly, and with little grace, managed to find us something; in a hotel of this calibre, we might have expected that this was an action that would have been willingly offered rather than one grudgingly agreed to. Because of its location, there is little external noise, and we did not notice noise coming through the walls etc from other rooms so we had restfull nights. And, again because of its location, we were able to explore the city with ease. The Langham is not somewhere we would go back to, but it was not quite as awful as one or two reviews on here might suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Top Staff make for a great stay at the Langham”
Reviews.Author: Difficult2please
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived on 19th July, we knew booking the Langham for our 4 night city break had been no mistake. We had reserved a deluxe double double (for 4 of us) and save for the fact that double beds in the US must be smaller than double beds in the UK, the room was generous and spotless. (Next time it will be double queensize.) Front of house staff but particularly the concierges made our stay so easy. Nothing was too much trouble and all their recommendations were real winners. We stayed Thursday thru Monday and the hotel (and surroundings) were fairly quiet over the weekend, which suited us, but possibly not to everyone's liking. Breakfast is too pricey and we ate out Friday and Monday mornings. Saturday and Sundays they offer a Buffet breakfast with kids at half price - this makes the cost more palatable and, so long as you are at your table by 9.30, its a leisurely affair. We ate in on Saturday night too (since our legs would not take us any further) and again,the pricing at Cafe Fleurie was tolerable given their generous approach to charges for the kids meals. Wouldn't waste time looking elsewhere if in Boston again - just go straight to the Langham.

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance and too overpriced”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited to stay at the Langham - Hotwire rates the hotel as 4.5 stars and I got a great price. However, after my stay I can say I was unimpressed. Here are my comments: The rooms were nice but nothing spectacular. I did like that a bathrobe was provided, and even slippers! However, there wasn't a pen but rather a pencil. Who writes postcards or letters using a pencil? Staff did come in to the room in the evening to provide chocolates and the next day's weather. Room service was way overpriced. $25 for breakfast before delivery fees, service charges, etc. My calculation was it would really be close to $36 by the time all the additional charges were added on. The cocktail lounge was old world elegance and there was a piano player, but $14 for a martini? Come on! One the biggest disappointments for me was the afternoon tea. I had never attended one before so thought this would be the perfect opportunity to do so. I emailed the hotel and received a reply that I should book well in advance. When I showed up, there were only 2 other people there and it didn't change the whole time I was there.
