In addition, it must have been between lunch and dinner because staff was changing the chairs at the tables around mine, making a lot of banging noises for what I think should have been a peaceful, quite experience. The newspaper provided was a financial newspaper from London, I think. Why not a local paper? Internet service is $10 for 24-hours. Not bad, although I didn't use it. Then, after confirming the charges to my room and receiving my final bill, I checked my credit card account online a few days later to find an additional charge for $4.55. I contacted my credit card company to dispute the charge and they have removed it for now. What could I possibly have purchased or used that would only cost $4.55 at a hotel that charges $25 for breakfast? I bet I couldn't even get coffee for that! All in all, I felt this was a hotel trying too hard to rely on its faded, old world elegance. That, combined with its location, make it not a place I will look to stay at unless I can continue to get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, expensive restaurant”
Reviews.Author: turistaamericana
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Orbitz so we got a deal on flight and hotel stay. It was very elegant, clean and the hotel staff is very friendly, efficient and helpful. The concierge helped us book day trips, etc. You can't beat the location; everything is just a short walk away. Our only complaint was the prices in the restaurant (well, and the service there). Our first morning there we ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant - a mistake we didn't repeat. The waiter barely spoke English and ignored us most of the time. I had 2 sausage links, scrambled eggs, some potatoes and wheat toast. I added a side of fresh grapefruit and orange juice. My husband had eggs benedict and orange juice. With tip, the total was $75!!!!!!!!! I would expect to pay $30 - $40 tops. I believe the prices in the restaurant were the same as room service. BTW, we really enjoyed dinner at Anthony's on Pier 4 and the Barking Crab. Very different but equally good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: seacoastNH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Langham from Saturday to Sunday. We attended a concert in town and didn't want to drive home afterwards. Hotwire had a great rate of under $150 so we booked it. Of course you don't find out the actual hotel until you confirm and pay but matching up the location (financial district) and amenities we had it pretty well narrowed down. Check in was very efficient, bell service was prompt and gave us the lay of the land. The room was excellent, very nicely decorated, boutique hotel style with plush towels and linens, robes, slippers, 600 thread count sheets, the whole 9 yards. Turn down service left chocolates and filled the cooler with ice for our water bottles and sodas. We parked across the street in Post Office Square for 9 bucks a night, very sweet deal for Boston. We hit the bar for some martini's around 4 pm, the drinks were excellent and the bartender quite attentive. He even made dinner reservations for us at the Chart House near the aquarium. Above and beyond service for sure. He also knew the full history of the hotel and the stories behind the old paintings hanging in the bar. Very interesting. Later that night after the concert we hit the lounge again and the piano player was fabulous. The waitress kept the drinks coming and the snack bowl full, the wasabi coated soy beans or peas were spicy and very good. We enjoyed every aspect of the stay although I would say if I was going to pay full rate I'd probably spring for the extra money to be at the Four Seasons. The location is good, although on weekends the financial district is pretty dead. On Sunday we ate breakfast near Downtown Crossing at a place called Kennedy's, that was not so good. Slow and poor service resulting in cold food. The Langham Sunday brunch looked awesome but we had filled up on dinner and for $50 a head, were just not ready to eat that much. In summary, I'd stay here again if I could get a decent rate. It's hard to stomach the full rate when we only live about 1 hour away and can take the bus or train quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Expected closer to perfection for $350 a nite!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelleKel
Reviews.Content: Good 4 star hotel that lived up to expectations and I'd probably go back because of the staff and locale. I did observe a few oddities that I found out of sorts for a luxury hotel. Petty complaints? Decide for yourself. Met family in the lobby a couple of times during the week. Nice part is that there are plenty of places to sit; strange part, the furniture should have been restuffed and upholstered long ago. Threadbare fabric and cushions down to the springs?!?! Gimme a break! Seems odd that mgmt doesn't take notice, care. Booked a superior king room ($350+ a night!). Not terribly large and not terribly small. Typical for a city hotel. Bizarre thing, room was discombobulated when I walked in and remained that way for all three nights of my stay. Lampshades crooked, never straightened, dust ruffle around bed didn't fit; looked real sloppy. Suggestion: Get the dusty electric cords out of sight! "A" it looks muddled "B" its dangerous!! My 2 Â½ y/o nephew pulled the lamp cord that was hanging down and piled along the side of the dresser and the lamp tumbled down & knocked him on the skull. Good thing it was the fabric shade that clunked him, not the metal base!! Common sense; if the cord was out of sight and mind, like in most hotels, it wouldn't have happened! Alright the maid cleaned the room as expected for a clean Holiday Inn but lacked the tidiness of a luxury hotel where people fork out $350 a pop! 3 nites, $1,300 bucks later, for me not so petty!

Reviews.Title: “Langham Stay”
Reviews.Author: jjerkins
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to have a superior room. We looked out over the roof air conditioners on the fifth floor - say you prefer not to have room 564. Otherwise, we had a great time; only five blocks from Quincy Market and a nice walk, close to Filene's Basement, Macy's. Ate at Saraceno in the North End and The Four Seasons Restaurant - both fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: TravellingIsGood
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything specifically negative to say about the Langham, only that it failed to knock my socks off. I stayed here for 2 nights en route from California to London, so I was in transit somewhat and the hotel did provide me with what I needed - a quiet room, comfy bed. Good points: the staff were friendly, the swimming pool and whirlpool were very nice and Julien's the cocktail bar was beautiful. Also I asked for a DVD player and one was provided promptly, which impressed me. Not so good points: there's nothing really close by in terms of places to grab a snack or a soft drink - there's a 7 eleven the other side of the park but that's it really. The room service was extortionate - all of the wines were expensive but so was the food - way overpriced I thought, and I begrudge this. Its a nice hotel and a grand building but like I said, it didn't knock my socks off.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: ssmak
Reviews.Content: After reviewing this hotel and it's 4.5 star rating, I was expecting a bit more. Granted we did not take advantage of any of the brunches, chocolate bar or any other amienites but our room was "okay". There is a parking lot adjacent to the Langham (One Post Office Square) but the pricing is not clearly listed. Langham offers 24-hour, in-and-out valet parking for $25, which in retrospect I think we should have gone with as our parking for a day and a half was $45. Check-in wasn't a problem, though they had two people at the desk, four stations and a line of about 6 or 7. The concierge didn't seem to have alot of information about the area. We asked about the Freedom Trail ("Information is at Boston Common") and Parking (which was a huge debacle in which I got three different answers from the same man). The conciegre always seemed to be on the phone. The room wasn't anything spectacular, though the floor had a stale smoke smell to it... which was odd as the floor was non-smoking. There was an ionizer down the hall from our room. The room looked cramped/poorly set up. The TV wasn't very viewable from the bed. You could see it, but it wasn't totally comforatable. Our room overlooked one of the main hallways, the fitness room and the pool. The towels were firm but not as cushy as I had expected for a hotel of this caliber. Perhaps it's because we were in a "regular" room instead of a suite. The bathroom was nothing too remarkable. Because this hotel is in the Financial District, it is not busy on the weekends or after hours. Dunkin' Doughnuts is around the corner for Saturday Morning breakfast. There weren't any convieniece-type stores open to grab snacks (after say, 7pm) and the hotel did not offer any kind of vending. The closest place for late-night-non-pub snacks was at Boston Common. The hotel was about a 10-15 minute walk to Boston Common where you could catch the green or red lines. I guess I expected more from a hotel with a 4.5 star rating, though I have a feeling that the amenities are what makes the rating what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiuseppeC.
Reviews.Content: Charming and well appointed, this hotel is probably Boston's best place to stay, located in the heart of the city (but Boston is so small....) with a QUITE positive price/value score. My room was large and recently restored, luxury and elegance are the attributes of it. The minibar had an entire world of things to eat and drink inside of it. Prices were acceptable too. The spa and pool center is a plaesant place to spend 20 minutes before dinner time, and the Hotel has always wonderful activities during the day (es. day of chocolates of the world, day of tea, day of pizza and so on). Concierges are really kind and indicated restaurants and other places to go even at really impossible evening/night hours. Gorgeous place for family with kids too. I absolutely raccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel - the rooms are very well appointed although a bit small. The lobby is very nice, and the staff friendly and helpful. We got a great deal online. The bad part - it is in a fairly dead part of Boston. If I were not here for a wedding, I would have never stayed there. It is a short 8-minute walk to Faneuil Hall, where the action starts. The tea time here is also very luxurious and fun if that is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Langham's HVAC problems make for misery”
Reviews.Author: Adamchik
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed in two different rooms in different areas of the hotel, and had the same problems (we did not know at the time, until we compared notes later). This was during the week of Presidents' Day. The rooms were spectacularly hot (80+ degrees), even though it was snowing outside. Engineering seemed to know about it, and so did the front desk. We were both moved from our original rooms to different floors, and experienced the same problems there. Engineering was very courteous, but they offered me fans for the room. Can you imagine - fans for Boston in February?! The front desk also tried to be nice - they even offered a free meal in the restaurant. The hotel is very convenient if you are downtown, and the restaurant is absolutely first-rate. It is also not that expensive given the quality and location. However, I would check carefully to see if cold air is coming out of the air conditioning in your room when you check in. If not, turn around and find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but disappointed with management”
Reviews.Author: Massfamilymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham in June 2006. It was part of a trip booked by a children's wish organization, as one of our three children is in remission from cancer. Her wish involved a shopping spree and show in Boston, and the wish organization booked the Langham for our weekend. The location was great. The public spaces in the hotel are beautiful. The suite was nice. We ate brunch in the hotel and enjoyed excellent service and good food. Our complaint stems from our initial arrival at the hotel. We are two adults and three children. We were told by the wish organization to identify ourselves as the "wish family" to ensure special treatment. Well, we felt we received sub-par treatment on our arrival and our wish child felt badly, as she was old enough to notice. Our room was a two-story/family suite. Downstairs was a sleep sofa/sitting area and half bath. Upstairs was the king-size bed and full bath. We needed a cot for our third child, and called the desk to request one, although they should have known we would need one. We went out to dinner, and returned to the hotel to change for the show. Still no cot. We called the desk again, and left for the show. When we returned at 11:00 p.m., there still wasn't a cot. We called down again, frustrated, as we had three tired children. Meanwhile, we opened the sofa bed and not only was it unmade, it was littered with potato chip crumbs. Needless to say, we were very upset and called down again. Finally, the night head of housekeeping came up with a cot and clean sheets for the sofa bed. While he was very apologetic, we feel the hotel dropped the ball. We were not expecting special treatment, but we were appalled that our needs were so blatantly overlooked considering the organization that booked us and the reason we were there. We hesitated complaining to management, as we did not pay for the room and felt awkward. However, when we returned home, we filled out the hotel review form with our experience and checked off the section that asked a manager to call us. No one ever did. Maybe it was just a bad night, but an acknowledgement and apology would have gone a long way. While our child's "wish weekend" was not ruined, we feel management dropped the ball during a very difficult time of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: trixiegirl2007
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Boston and I stayed at the Langham for 1 night. I had a standard room and since I was on business really spent minimal time in the room. However, the room was quite nice. It was clean and a fairly good size. There was a desk for working and additional chairs and another table. The bathroom was a bit rundown but clean. Room service was expensive and I had to pay $10 for Internet access. Overall, because the location was great and I felt safe, I had a good experience. I do think it is really high priced but I would pay a higher price for a clean room and safety. Staff was very professional and the robe and slippers were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Dave2269
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in January and glad I chose this hotel. Spacious room and tv, mini bar, safe etc. Good location, about 5-10 minutes walk from Macys. Friendly staff and very informative and helpful, particularly the Concierge. Breakfast ok but choose from the menu rather than the buffet. Boston appears to be safe and I walked everywhere or took the subway. If you like shopping, I would recommend a visit to the Wrentham mall, about 45 mins away, this can be booked at the hotel. Would return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Langham in January. Booking through the hotel website and taking advantage of the 3 nights for 2 package we got great value for our money, about 130 per night. Considering this deal I was expecting a rather small room but was pleasantly surprised by a good sized room on the ninth floor. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the room had great amenities - wonderful comfortable bed with down duvet, huge fluffy bath towels and robes, an alarm clock that accepted my iPod etc. Unfortunately wireless is not included, you must pay 10$ per day if you brought your laptop or 10$ for 25 minutes on computers located in the lobby. The heated pool and hot tub were amazing and open until 9pm. We did not use the gym but it looked well set up with several different machines. We enjoyed room service one night, a burger for each of us which was delicious and a lot of food. We parked in the public lot next to the hotel which was expensive as expected for downtown boston. We paid $56 for Friday night to Monday morning. Most of that cost was just the monday morning - it is actually really cheap to park here on the weekend. The location was fairly good for tourists - easy walk to Downtown Crossing (Filene's Basement!), Quincy Market and the waterfront. If you are interested in staying in this area then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, AMAZING Brunch”
Reviews.Author: RCS1977
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Langham in August. The hotel was very lovely and the room was nice but not too memorable. However, the staff at the hotel were so lovely, it made our stay just great. I reccomend this hotel very highly. In addition, if you are there on a Sunday, spend the $$ and go to their brunch. It was outrageous and the best I have ever seen in my life. Every type of food you can imagine is spread before your eyes. Enjoy your stay, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: MelsieTR
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed here the 2nd Dec for 6 nights this year. You couldn't miss the hotel. it looked like a little house in the middle of all the tall Buildings. Really pretty on the outset, and twinkling with all the christmas lights. the doormen were extremely helpful and very polite. reception was quick and easy. the rooms were quite large with a king size bed and the bathrooms was huge. good shower, bath. large mirror over the sink, the length of the bathroom. and a long mirror on the door. the bedroom also had a desk and laptop connections, a chest of drawers, coffee maker, mini bar filled with orange and apple juice,beer, wine champagne, water, soft drinks, whiskey, Vodka and Bacardi. a couple of grenola bars as well. although quiet expensive it was nice to just be able to have a night cap while watching TV after a grooling day of shopping. the hotel also had a spa and swimming pool although we did not make use of these amenities. the bar in the hotel was very nice but had no atmosphere really. Rooms service to the room was quiet dear. for a continatal breakfast and Banana pancakes 2 cups of coffee, 65$. so we did that once and spent the rest of the holiday going to Quincy market where they do food from all over the world at doesnt cost much. the location of the hotel is Great!! 4 mins to walk to quincy market or macys, and 5 mins from the aquarium! Excellant. 4 miles from the airport. all in all this hotel i found was great, bit pricey but worth it for the bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisey rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HJPofi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business Oct 26 and 27. Room was small, no couch, and the noise from everything in the hallway came right into the room. Otherwise the location is good and the hotel was friendly and clean. 3 stars

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Tricolours
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Sept as part of a conference group. Really enjoyed the hotel with nice large rooms and comfortable beds. We found the hotel was in a good spot with an easy walk to most of the attractions, shopping and restaurant district. I would be happy to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building, too many glitches”
Reviews.Author: theroadlesstravelled
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through the property directly as it was a last minute trip and I did not want any surprises. The reservation person (manger in charge), was unable to verify that I had a room the next day, (given the short notice), and assured me that she would call me the following morning, (hopefully before I left for Boston). "This happens all the time." She did not call, but I did, and after much confusion and waiting, another person was "pretty sure" that we had a room. I charged the $340 and hoped for the best. The hotel was a little hard to find, but we got there okay after a long day. IT REALLY IS IN A GREAT LOCATION. The good news is that we not only had a room, but it was on the top floor. The staff were polite and the wait was not long. Getting off the elevator, we were assaulted by cigar smoke. It was thick and pervasive. It seemed to follow us to our room. Our room was nice and clean and fairly spacious with a row of slanted windows,-but it was shockingly hot. I tried to call the main desk for 15 minutes and it was busy. We had enough time to change and run to our dinner reservation, but notified them of the problem on the way out. When we returned, we learned that engineering was unable to fix the problem. They did have a room for us on the 2nd floor-so we took it. DId I mention that one of the three elevators was out of order? That we packed up in the heat with an exhausted child? There was no offer of help and the process was quite frustrating and long. They did offer to comp the breakfast, but we had already paid for it. The new room was spacious-(24X30?), 12 foot ceilings-and looked out onto a little park. (Luckily they had good black out blinds.) There were 2 huge windows but it was quiet. The bathroom was nice-very clean with marble everything. Decent size. Good water pressure, many towels. King sized bed was confortable, (nice soft linens, hard pillows), and there was a good seating area. They had not cleared out the mini refrigerator as requested and it was late so I didn't bother to call. After 10 PM, they called, waking me and my son up, to ask if we wanted them to come and do it then. I did not. I ended up throwing away food as a result. The noise level at the hotel was great-hardly heard anyone else. The pool was nice-small but with lanes. Plenty of natural light, clean. Some floatation devices for the kids. Adequate hot tub. The exercise room consisted of free weights and 6 cardio machines. While in the exercise room, you can watch your family below in the pool through a glass wall. The bathrooms had changing areas. There were 2 employees on duty so it was safe and professional. The breakfast area was pretty but the service was HORRIBLE. Our waiter was arguing with his assistant and they managed to disapppear from our entire corner of the restaurant. (My fellow patrons and I tried in vain to locate them.) The food was avearage but overpriced, ($25 each), and our orders were wrong. There was indifference from the wait staff so we did not press the issue. The irony is that we ended up OVER tipping because we could not wait longer than 19 minutes for them to collect the check. Go elsewhere! We paid for late check out-but found housekeeping cleaning amongst our belongings with the door wide open when we returned to our room. I had wanted to give my son a bath, but she insisted that we wait as she was, "almost done." I do not fault her, but obviously the communication was poor as she did not believe we were supossed to be there. Sigh. The really good news: they took 50% off the bill when I went downstairs to complain that the maid would not leave. I would have rated this property higher if there had not been so many glitches.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat”
Reviews.Author: rebeccawhipp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a treat to ourselves on the two nights of our honeymoon. Fantastic location (just five mins walk from Quincy Market), and fairly reasonably priced too â€“ Boston itself does seem to be expensive though. Bedroom, bed and bathroom all pretty generously proportioned, with traditional Victorian dÃ©cor. Robes and slippers provided in every room. Also received chocolates and a next day weather report each evening. Were given an upgrade to a Junior Suite on the second night and that really was so much nicer â€“ park view and ultra-massive room with sofa area. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others â€“ go on, spoil yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Had better service @ Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: scribbybean
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights mainly based on reviews on TripAdvisor. Check in was quick, hotel seemed well run and taken care of. The problem was that the temperature in the room was quite warm and for some reason was not able to be adjusted. I called down to the front desk three times and was told three different stories: 1. They still had the heat on in the hotel because it was early spring and the ac couldn't be turned on, 2. They would call engineering and have them lower the temperature for our room, and finally, 3. There was nothing they could do & brought up a small desk fan. I've stayed in hotels all over the country and have never encountered this issue. The fact that it was never resolved made me swear off Langham hotels forever. I wrote to the management when we got home and never received a reply.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: maccahallam
Reviews.Content: excellent choice of accommodation. would find it very difficult to criticise. The hotel has all that you could need, friendly staff, an excellent concierge service, pool and gym facilities. The room we stayed in was excellent with extremely comfortable beds and a great view of downtown boston. would strongly recommend. 1st class!!

Reviews.Title: “Utmost Luxury”
Reviews.Author: chad351
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend while attending a performance of Cirque de Soleil at Suffolk Downs. Hotel is in close proximity of Quincy Market and Fanieul Hall. Arrived at the hotel after a long day and we were greeted with turned-down beds, chocolates and the weather report for the next day....!!!! The pillows are simply the best (where do they find them?) and the bed linens were by far the most luxurious....truly unbelievable. This is a very classy hotel and we would highly recommend it for any traveler, be it for business or pleasure. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Grand style, great service”
Reviews.Author: Alfredo101
Reviews.Content: Rooms are unique, with differing floor plans, many with a few stairs. Very clean, nice size bathrooms. Nice touch with chocolates on the pillow at turn-down service. Concierges Dan and Sean very helpful; daytime guy not as friendly, knowledgeable, or helpful. Work out room is complete with Concept II ergometer, pool, and enough machines for a good workout. Only downside is location is 15-20 min walk to Boston Commons, Copley area. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Langham is Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: mollyanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Langham from 9/1 to 9/4. We arrived early in the morning and planned on checking our bags until later in the day. To our delight we were allowed to check in! We had booked a "moderate Queen room" and were given a lovely room on the 6th floor overlooking Post Office Park. The room was immaculate as was the very large gleaming bathroom. Furnishings were lovely and new. The hotel furnishes plush bathrobes and slippers and our nightly turndown service, complete with chocolates on the pillows, made us feel like we were on a cruise ship! The radio was left turned on to a soft music channel - a nice touch. The staff was friendly and accommodating, from Stacey at the front desk, who checked us in and out, to Juan, one of the very nicest bell men ever. The housekeeping staff was right on the mark and we could never pass one of them without receiving a smile and a greeting. The Concierge supplied us with umbrellas for our one rainy day, which were greatly appreciated, since we prefer to walk until our feet fall off (!) when in Boston. The lobby and other public rooms are gorgeous. Sadly, we did not enjoy any meals at the Langham - that will have to wait until our next visit. The only "annoyance" was having to go to two floors once and three floors once to find ice! Not a showstopper by any means - just took a little longer to chill our wine! Having stayed previously at Jury's and the Wyndham (now Hilton) many times - we think we have found our "new favorite" hotel to be the Langham and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: brokenankle
Reviews.Content: We paid $144 via Hotwire. Parking, by valet only, was reasonably priced for Boston at $25/night. Our room was beautiful, the bed comfortable and the temperature controls worked. Room service food was good, but don't make the mistake of ordering a children's meal - it was terrible. Our room was very noisy. We could hear doors banging all day and night. We were so distraught as to call Security regarding this issue. The pool was nice but it didn't have enough seating. The Sunday "Jazz Brunch" had no jazz; only a Billy Joel piano man. Also, the raw bar at the brunch had only over-cooked food. There is no way that I ate $50 worth of food. Oh well, live and learn. All told, this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice at the Reduced Weekend Price”
Reviews.Author: WorldlyGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with husband on Aug 18-20 booking directly with the hotel for a good 3 nights-for-two-nights price. This is in the downtown section and very convenient to Quincy Market and Boston Aquarium, and an easy walk to Downtown Crossing shops and Freedom Trail sites. Checkin was easy and pleasant, and we got our requested room with a view overlooking Post Office Square. The room was a standard king, witha desk, dresser, TV cabinet. It was a little cramped. The bathroom was nice-sized and marble outfitted. A coffeemaker was a pleasant surprise since we didn't expect to find one in a 4* hotel. The bed was on the firm side...which was also unexpected given the emphasis these days on "heavenly" etc. comfy hotel beds. Room service and turndown service both were fine. We got used to the evening chocolates very quickly. The public rooms on the second floor are very grand (this building used to be the federal reserve bank) and should not be missed. Saturday night we had cocktails and dinner in the bar. We felt like lords. The piano music added an additional touch of class. We did not check out the pool or gym. The main reception area is understated. We used the concierge twice for basic directions and he was accommodating. The area immediately around the hotel is very quiet on the weekends. Local cafes and eateries tend to be closed. We were told that the Elephant & Castle pub/restaurant on Arch Street (3 blocks away) offers a nice $15 brunch buffet on Sats and Suns, which is a definite bargain compared to the Langham's $50 pp Sunday brunch. We had a good lunch here, but did not check out the brunch. A word about parking: We parked our car in the adjacent parking garage (entrance on Oliver Street) , with an "ouch" factor of $78 total. On weekdays, including Friday checkin and Monday checkout, rates hit full-day $32 after approx. 90 minutes. Saturday and Sunday were $7 each. Pass on the hotel valet parking option if you don't want to pay more still. Summary: understated, and good value at promotion rates. Some might find it staid. We enjoyed the "old banker " grandeur.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxurious hotel with fantastc staff”
Reviews.Content: Loved this beautiful & immaculately kept hotel for its decor, staff & location. Our room was not hugh but by no means small (and it was a welcome change to have only one double bed and not two regularly found in European hotels, which somehow take from the ambiance of the room). The room was so comfortable, it was definitely a room you would look forward to coming back to after a busy day sightseeing - which is a great bonus! The little touches were welcome (although only one robe & one pair of slippers for two occupants was a little puzzling!) Turndown with chocalates was lovely touch. The staff are amazing, everyone we saw from porters, front desk & concierge were extremely helpful (it was very helpful to find concierge could provide us with a European - US adaptor, another guest got a phone charger from a hugh box of chargers available! Great idea!) The leisure centre was nice, swimming pool smallish but perfectly adequate. Unfortunately we did not get the opportunity to eat or even have a drink at this lovely hotel although I have heard favourable reports though it can apparently be a tad expensive. In relation to the rate for the hotel, we got a very good rate from hotels.com so it was most definitely worth what we paid. Lastly the location was also great, easy walking distance to all attractions & Boston certainly is a great place to walk around and admire. To sum up I would definitely recommend this hotel - we really enjoyed our beautiful room & I hope all the hotel staff get the recognition that they deserve for a fantastic job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: fivegoldstars
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on a short vacation to see the sights of Boston and surroundings. We thought the Langham to be very good overall, however there were a few inconsistencies. The rooms and facilities were excellent, as were the restaurants but the quality of food at breakfast was better than dinner. The staff were generally very helpful and friendly, the concierges excellent, although the 'bell-boys' and some of the doormen could do with some improved people skills in line with the quality of the hotel. The indoor pool was useful, if a tad small and the gym reasonably well equiped. The location was a little out of the way, but this suited us as we preferred it to the hustle and bustle of downtown. Having said that, it was only 10-15 mins walk to Filenes and the same to Long Wharf. We would both stay at the Langham again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrianJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham Hotel twice for 5 days each time and we were really happy with it. The rooms we stayed in were large, had huge beds and very quiet. There is a turndown service in the evening and they leave some chocolate in the room also, which is a nice touch. The staff are helpful and very polite. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk to Quincy Market, Fanueil Hall and Boston Common (touristy areas), and about the same to a "T" station (underground). The only thing we weren't that happy about was the price of breakfast. It was $22 for an "American" breakfast (sausages, bacon, eggs, fried potatoes), which we thought was a lot. For two people with a tip you are talking about $50 every morning! As an alternative, there is a small park on one side of the hotel and there is a cafe in the park which does lots of salads, sandwiches and stuff like that. If you like trying different food, it might be worth going to their Sunday Brunch, which is $50 per person, but it's all you can eat and they have a huge variety of food - crab claws, shrimp, pasta stir fries cooked on the spot, pancakes, chicken are just a sample. They have lots of desserts to try too. Overall we were very impressed with the hotel and the location is very good. It's also very safe around there. We were out late lots of nights and never had any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and pet friendly, too!!!”
Reviews.Author: queenltg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days - great location, a few blocks walk to Faneuil Hall, Washington Street or Boston Commons. (Do walk because driving in Boston is just awful.....) Anyway, the hotel staff could not have been more accomodating - we had our dog along, and they were so nice to all of us! They don't treat you like you are persona non grata if you have a dog (and my dog is way cleaner than a smoker!). The hotel has beautiful accoutrements, the bed was wonderful, the sheets are GOOD ones, the room was cozy. The granite and tile bath is clean and fairly new. The only drawback is that I thought we had free internet and it's not, they charge you $10 a day....but now You know, so go to the Langham, relax and have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accommodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Shaken_Bake
Reviews.Content: The Langham is a beautiful hotel with impeccable service. We had an incredible visit there five years ago when it was Le Meridien, and I was pleased to find nothing much had changed but the name. The rooms are tastefully and attractively furnished, although our room on this visit (7th floor king superior) was a bit on the small side. The beds and the sheets are incredibly comfortable and the rooms are quiet â€“ best nightâ€™s sleep Iâ€™ve had in a hotel! I enjoy the small details that distinguish a hotel in this class from routine chain hotels: the room fixtures are easy to use and really work, the bathroom amenities are high quality, the service immediate and cheerful. The location is in the heart of Boston's Financial District, within easy walking distance of the State House and Boston Common, Faneuil Hall and the waterfront. One tiny issue (not a trip-spoiler at all) was that we were billed for a minibar item that we didnâ€™t use (a quick phone call resolved the problem, but I wonder how many people just pay it without noticing). This is a hotel for demanding guests and I left very satisfied. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Nick2U
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a Friday evening at the Langham. We chose this Hotel because of the Tripadvisor reviews and it's location. Overall, we were dissapointed with the service. The bartender was more interested in talking to his friends than taking orders, the concierge was misinformed (bad directions) and the valet parking was not professional. Our room was small with an immediate view of a concrete partition. It was reasonably well appointed with a comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was small. We found the lounge and restaurants areas out of the way. Because of this the entrance is subdued and lacking the activity that we think makes a luxury hotel exciting and inviting. We did not eat at the hotel although the dining areas were attractive. We found the area to be convenient (10 minute walk to Quincy market) and quiet. The Langham is a stately and attractive building but inside it lacks substance.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Coming Back to this Winner”
Reviews.Author: YazBeanSaysMeow
Reviews.Content: We started staying at the Langham when it was French-owned and known as the Meridian. We stay at this property every time we come into Boston, and the new management has kept the place -- and the service -- as good as it's always been. We usually stay on weekends when the parking and rates are less expensive (although out-of-towners will be shocked that $26/night for weekend parking can be considered "less expensive") and the entire Financial District is very, very quiet. The seventh floor has just been renovated, although we almost switched rooms to the fifth floor and really couldn't see that much difference on first glance, meaning that all of the rooms are in spectacular shape. The Asian amentities are great, especially the very thick and creamy body lotion. Lots of outlets on the side of the desk for laptops, cell phone chargers and such. And, the maid had magically figured out a way to defog a perfectly large square in the bathroom mirror so that one could get ready immediately upon getting out of the shower. We love the Ritz-Carlton, but prefer staying at the Langham when we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very good family hotel; Superb F&B”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: Very impressed. We also had a 2 bedroom suite and it was very spacious and tastefully appointed. Food and beverage is above average and their home-made ice cream, pizza, and Saturday afternoon chocolate buffet were all excellent, as was their Julienne restaurant. We enjoyed the baby crib with the stuffed animal and the milk and cookies they delivered our first night. Staff was mostly very friendly; once we couldn't get seated in the dining room and we were instead seated in the lounge but comped on the chocolate buffet for the inconvenience. Service is not impeccable but certainly quite good. Example: We sat for an hour without any food being served in the Julienne; they misplaced our order and nobody came to check why we weren't served. It was only after I got up and asked where our dinner was that the food began to come forth. There were less than 10 people eating in the whole restaurant so someone was obviously asleep at the switch. The piano bar is a very nice place to sit with the old bank decor all around you, and even dance a bit. We also liked the location which was convenient to Faneuil Hall; on Memorial Day Weekend their street performers festival makes it a great family place to be. Prices for spa services onsite such as massage are quite reasonable for today's market.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Langham”
Reviews.Author: erdoc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Staff exceedingly pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Richie_London
Reviews.Content: First off the was very easy to get to and right in the heart of the financial district so you feel that right in working Boston life. The room was bigger than I had expected, having read the reviews on the moderate size room before booking. The plus points were the bed, very comfy. The gym was good and had a good mix of equipment and adequate sized pool. The Sunday brunch/ lunch was expensive $50 a head but the standard , quantity and choice was excellent. (creps were amazing) Bad points .The bathroom was not cleaned to a high enough standard on our arrival, as there were a number of rogue hairs dotted about . On 2 days having come back to the room founding that a pile of our used towels and robs on the floor in the corner of the room. To sum up a great location to be based to whole of Boston and a good place to be if you want to be in walking distance of the bars and restaurants at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Langham.Beautiful,spacious rooms with elegant decor. Excellent ,friendly service .The weekend breakfast buffet is superb (though sadly not available on weekdays ). Food very good and not overpriced given the star rating and the hotel's popularity with the corporate travellers. Gym was quite small and not very well equipped but pool very nice. Would definitely stay there again if we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Very Lite”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langham in August for 3 days and again in January for 2 nights with our two children. This time one of our two adjoining rooms reeked of cigarette smoke on a non-smoking floor. We were eventually shown other rooms, but the configuration was not comparable and management did not upgrade us or reduce the price. The second night we were awakened at 2am by two drunks and their girlfriends in the next room who were yelling and shouting in their room and the hall until 3:30am. Needless to say, this is not the clientele or behavior one expects in a luxury hotel. We stay at the Langham because it has a pool, although it is somewhat small, and it is close to the Quincy Marketplace and the North End. Next time, however, we'll probably try someplace with higher standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at this hotel. I must say we were not impressed. I had booked this hotel based on all the rave reviews I was reading. When we arrived, we had booked a superior room throught the hotel itself, the receptionist at the desk told us that they upgraded us for free to a deluxe,but upon arriving to our room 604, it was clearly not an upgrade, the room was the same type of room that they call a standard room on their website, more like a downgrade. Plus the room was hot and I asked for a room fan,was told that they would send it up,it never arrived. Found the hotel staff not that friendly. Would not use this hotel again, based on our experience with the quality of the room and the hotel seems a bit run down. Westchester NY

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Shelley H
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston at the end of September and stayed at the Langham for 3 nights. The hotel is centrally located to all of the sites. Upon check-in we were given an upgrade to a superior room. Our room was large and very nicely appointed. Very comfortable beds and special kudos to the high quality towels. Overall we found the hotel to be upscale but not stuffy. We would definately stay here again.
